Reviews.Title: “All around great experience”
Reviews.Author: JSpudQuincy_Illinois
Reviews.Content: For a great stay this place can't be beat. Good location, just couple blocks off Orchard & Scott. Lots of shopping & Metro line nearby. Hotel is new, has nice sized rooms, free Wi-Fi throughout, nice pool & fitness area on the 12th floor. The special things like 2 pieces of free laundry, free airport pickup, free meals & really helpful staff make the stay enjoyable. This isn't a huge hotel with several restaurants, shops, spa etc. It is just a nice place to stay at a very good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Staycation that left an impression”
Reviews.Author: jia284
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze and the receptionist asked if I have stayed in this hotel before. When I said that I have not, they arranged someone to go up to my room with me. The guest officer told me about the facilities in the hotel and offered to show me the features of the room. I thought that was a very nice touch! The room was quite big, with mirrors all around. The bathroom can be seen from the room as it was a glass wall. It was quite nice to be able to lie in the bathtub and soak away while watching TV. The bed was comfortable and clean, but the pillows were a bit too soft for my liking as I prefer harder pillows. Everything was in order, the shower facilities, the view of Orchard, the many TV programmes... We went up to the gym on the 12th floor too. The gym is well equipped enough, the pool is a little small, but has a nice view. The sauna can only seat 4 people and the steam bath was out of order, hence we did not get to try those as the sauna was already packed. We had a simple breakfast too. Nothing amazing, just a simple spread of bread, coffee, tea, milk, cereals, some salad and fruits, the usual eggs, sausages etc. One thing I liked was the nice touch of putting an umbrella in the room's cupboard. As Singapore has very unpredictable weather, the umbrella shows the hotel's thoughtfulness. Worth a stay as it was only 5 - 10mins walk away from major shopping and the experience there was great. :)

Reviews.Title: “An Traquil oasis in centre of town”
Reviews.Author: CSom
Reviews.Content: located just 5 mins walk from the famed Orchard Road in Singapore, Quincy is an unique full-board hotel in town. The decoration is modern, and atsmphere is very homely and comfortable. The room is modern and comfortable, and all the minibar items are free. Even if the meals are all inclusive, the quality is high. It is the perfect location as a base to explore singapore, or a great hideaway for locals.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!!!”
Reviews.Author: KJM_8
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 4 nights over the Easter break and could not recommend this hotel highly enough! As with the other reviews we found the all inclusive rooms fabulous, not too small at all for 2 people! The ever so slight hill to the Quincy is really nothing, if you can walk around Orchard Road all day you can walk up the small hill to get to the hotel! We found the food to be really good and plenty of choices even if you were to stay for a week. Dinner menu also included 2 specials each night, a soup (Minestrone, Cream of Broccoli and Tomatoe while we were there) and a dessert (Apple Studrel, Profiteroles and Cassata) also there was always a large bowl of fresh fruit salad and soft serve ice cream! We really enjoyed chatting to Adhamm and Chandran in the restaurant each night. We stayed in room 1005.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: StamfordLucille
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a bit on the small side but functional. The free wi-fi is great. The location was good, only a short walk to the transit system, buried in the never ending shopping malls. From the moment we checked in hotel until the time we check out, the Quincy satisfies all elements of one's stay. Ruben at the desk was very helpful and accommodated us even upon an early arrival. The lunch and dinner gave enough variety and the food was quite tasty. Would certainly stay at the Quincy again.

Reviews.Title: “RAVE RAVE RAVE RAVE RAVE....”
Reviews.Author: shazhunter
Reviews.Content: WOW WOW WOW WOW WOW......Absolutely LOVED this centrally, modern, contemporary hotel. No gripes to be had here. Its frigginfantastic......Building, wow, decor, wow, reception, wow, service, wow, rooms, wow, self flushing toilets, wow, facilities, wow, free dry cleaning, wow, surprise wedding anniversary packages, wow, staff uniforms, wow, artwork, wow, 5 minute walk to Orchard Road, wow, complimentary papers, wow, free internet, wow, bathroom amenities, wow, digital bathroom scales, wow, waffles robes and slippers, wow, built in ironing board, wow, fast elevators, wow, state of the art gym, wow, swimming pool, wow, free beer and wine 2 hours, wow, movie night on the 12th floor with pop corn, wow, wow wow wow wow wow wow... Wotta Q-tee.......Going to Singapore....DONT STAY ANYWHERE ELSE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stacey C
Reviews.Content: I cannot enjoy another hotel, ALL the front desk. Everything were pretty well said by previous recent reviews. Yes the staff could not have been more helpful. Would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it if you like a drink!”
Reviews.Author: TheBrissyTravellers
Reviews.Content: We got an all inclusive pack for 2 nights which included all meals and free mini bar, wifi and alcohol at happy hour (6-8pm). We had 1 way limo transfer included also, we were greeted at the airport. A fairly nice Mercedes sedan and the driver was lovely. The limo also had free wifi. The rooms are very modern and extremely clean. We were very happy with the Molton Brown toiletries. The bed was not as nice as Sofitel but very nice pillows. We did not try the luch but we did have dinner both nights and the food was really good. We took full advantage of the happy hour drinks and the staff were very good the second we put down our glass they were there to offer another round. Only complaint is there is no bar area so you are drinking where families are having dinner. Breakfast was OK, small spread but mostly very good, only complaint was the pastries were not very good. The hotel is only a short stroll to orchard Rd which was very convenient. It is quite expensive so if you are to going to spend much time at the hotel you might consider another hotel. All-in-all we enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Decent value... Very modern”
Reviews.Author: Cathleen N
Reviews.Content: The first thing that comes to mind is modern... from the slick look of the lobby/restaurant to the almost "cubist" feel of the rooms. The rooms are a bit on the small side but functional. The free wi-fi is great. The breakfast was okay but not great. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was good, only a short walk to the transit system, buried in the never ending shopping malls... about 30 minute walk to the Botanic gardens. The first time I stayed there, the bathroom was not very clean on arrival, orange grout is never good, but housekeeping came and took care of it. Overall I wasn't wowed, but I thought this was a decent value, especially for this city.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gohszeying
Reviews.Content: I knew about this hotel the first month they had opened but didn't get the chance to stay till now. I took the Qool weekend package and booked directly with the hotels as I felt that it was the best rate as compared to all other booking engines. My check in was smooth and quick, I was briefed by the friendly officer at the counter on my offers. What really impressed me was, as there was a complimentary bottle of red wine for my stay, I commented that I didn't like red and prefer white, the officer took notice of that and gave me a bottle of white wine instead. Throughout the stay, as all meals were provided, I felt that the package was really worth while and love the concept of coffee all day and even provided take away cups for you to bring back to your room!!!! And not forgetting the free flow of self services ice cream as well! Good job Quincy! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: nha1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Quincy for 2 nights after a 2 week trip . The hotel and service were great. The location is very good, you can walk to Orchard Road within 5 mins and a few more mins to the MTR. Lots of restaurant choices, however you do have free feels in the hotel. We only ever had dinner and breakfast in the hotel and both were pretty good, along with happy hour (free drinks) so a great bonus. Our room was really nice, a good size with 2 double beds… great little perks, free mini bar, Molton Brown toiletries, free laundry (limited quantity). The service from receptionist to restaurant staff was great. On the day we were leaving we were able to keep our bags in the office and use the health club to freshen up before our late night flight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: ayson97
Reviews.Content: Mu husband and I stayed at Quincy for 2 nights this March. Lobby was quite small with only 3 chairs. We checked in around 10am and there were a couple of groups ahead of us so we had to wait for our turn standing up. However we only waited for around 5-8minutes. We were offered a room upgrade since there was no available studio room at that time and we agreed to add $60 plus taxes. Room was nice with all modern amenities. Free use of nespresso machine & complimentary minibar (2 cans of soda, 2 beer, 3 bottles of mineral water, 2 pieces energy bar, Lays chips, instant coffee & tea). Very comfortable bed & pillows. The free Wifi was great throughout the hotel. Hope they will add more choices in their breakfast buffet. We ate dinner there and my husband loved their steak. I liked my sweet & sour shrimp with rice and their soft ice cream - delicious. The hotel is around 10mins away from the nearest Orchard MRT station. Lucky Plaza was just around the corner of Orchard Rd and this is where we had our money exchanged. A bit of a walk when returning to the hotel if you are carrying a lot of your purchases. During our reservation, they agreed to my request of departure airport transfer instead of pickup since we will be coming from another hotel before Quincy. Overall had a really great stay at Quincy.

Reviews.Title: “Quincy Hotel Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Lloyd R
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Quincy mid March '12. Overall my experience was a pleasant one. I like the room design, openness, glass shower, etc. I was offered an upgrade on arrival for an extra SGD30 plus taxes, which I accepted. The room was adequate but not large by any stretch. I suspect the standard rooms are on the small side. I have an appreciation for good food and I was disappointed in this regard. I had breakfast the first morning and didn't return for another meal in spite of the fact that the three meals are included. The food was very basic and choices limited. Beans out of a can, lowest quality bread, etc. Obviously skimping on the food to make money. I will probably go back but if I want a decent breakfast I'll book the Hilton next time. The price differential is not sufficient to be consequential. The service is not 5 star but it's adequate. Nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: annaxox
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and were absolutely delighted. The hotel is only a 20 minute ride from the airport and is a five minute walk from Orchard Road. This distance also allows for a more quiet environment compared to the hotels directly on Orchard Road. The staff were excellent and helped us book tickets for Universal Studios and helped us find the best dining choices in the city. (We booked through a travel agency and did not go full board.) Breakfast was a limited selection but the choices were all delicious. The hotel is excellent, and well-appointed despite its small size. I would have liked to attend their cupcake making class but we didn't have enough time. I suppose this is just a reason for us to go back to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay but nice experience”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMiyauchi
Reviews.Content: I arrived very late from Hong Kong, very tired, but the receptionist made me feel good just with her smile. Usually, hotel staffs are also tired in the night shift but the lady who welcomed us was very nice. It was unfortunate that I was almost outside all the time and had limited time to experience the hotel but the room was OK, the breakfast at the lobby floor was OK, you can use a PC for free right in front of the reception area, so I think it was a nice stay. It was a bit different from what I expected since I had a image from the website to be more loud, lots of color, noisy, but it wasn't. I didn't had a chance to walk around the area but my colleague did, and he said it was easy to get to the Orchard road shopping area. I didn't know but my friend there in Singapore said this is the same ownership with the Oasia Hotel which I stayed last time. It was a coincidence, but it seems like they must been offering something that I must like and I don't know what it is. One thing, I am Japanese and I expect an hair dryer in the bathroom but it was in the closet and the shape of the power outlet only let me dry my hair in the working desk area. Is it always like that in Singapore?

Reviews.Title: “tremendous hotel, unparalleled service”
Reviews.Author: sirtravel
Reviews.Content: It is rare that a hotel lives up to all the expectations that you read about in the reviews, but the Quincy definitely does. From the moment you get picked up at the airport and wisked to the hotel until the time you check out, the Quincy satisfies all elements of one's stay. I arrived late on a Sunday evening, was efficiently met at the airport, brought to the hotel, ate a very nice dinner (Sambal Prawns), was able to enjoy a beer from the free minibar, catch up on my e-mail (again free!) and get a great night's sleep. The toiletries (Moulton Brown) and linens were first class. I got a great night's sleep in a super comfortable bed and awoke to a very good breakfast whether you wanted a Western-style breakfast or Asian breakfast including made to order eggs, Asian noodles, bacon, sausages, cereals, fresh juices, etc. I had some dry cleaning that needed to be done and it was included in the room rate (two pieces of dry cleaning or laundry per day). I returned from a full day of work and took a quick swim in the small (but very nice) pool to wake me up, showered, changed, had a fresh Tiger beer on tap at the (again free) cocktail hour (6-8pm) before going out to a business meeting. I returned at 9:30pm able to catch dinner before it closes at 10 (Crayfish fried rice - yummy). I only stayed two nights but it was super. In many ways I wish I could have stayed longer. The only thing I could say -- and this is not any reflection on this hotel -- is that Singapore is such a great food city that you might want to enjoy what Singapore has to offer beyond the hotel. But the hotel is so nice, it is hard to leave. I could not recommend it more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool - Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Sshhaun
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on a transit stopover. Great staff at reception, functional, quick and good breakfast. Bed was fantastic - very slightly noisy corridor noise, but otherwise great - and good blockout for sleeping if needed. Nice bathroom - . would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Unreal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cookieau2000
Reviews.Content: Had 5 nights in this hotel. Due to plane delay unfortunately missed out on Limosine from Airport but the hotel refunded our Taxi fares. Room was very modern with great amenities. All staff were extremely helpful. Any problem was immediately taken care of & managing staff checked repair was completed successfully. We enjoyed many of the complimentary meals as there was a good choice provided. as well as beverages & Happy Hour. We even ventured to the pool area one evening & enjoyed the movies & popcorn offered under the stars. Great Hotel I would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Nicest people in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Hotelranger
Reviews.Content: Very clean modern minimalist hotel. Very nice and kind staffs ... everyone is nice. Very helpfull .. quick responses to anything you ask.

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ProsserKeeton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Quincy for 3 nights and what a great hotel! Check in was a breeze. Ruben at the desk was very helpful and accomodated us even upon an early arrival. He also went out of his way to direct us to some interesting spots in the city as well as his favorite Dim Sum restuarant in Chinatown. We had a room on the 13th floor, and the wall-size window gave us an awesome view. The room was very comfortable with every amenity. The all-inclusive price is also a great deal. The lunch and dinner menues gave enough variety and the food was quite tasty. Walk to Orchard Road took 5 minutes, and location is accesible to metro, buses, hop-on/hop-off bus etc. There were always taxis outside on the street as well.

Reviews.Title: “'Amazing and a MUST stay'”
Reviews.Author: Briger9
Reviews.Content: The Quincy Hotel, Singapore was an amazing experience and a must stay when visiting Singapore. We were picked up in a Limousine at Changi Airport, greeted on arrival and offered an upgrade of our room. All the staff were extremely polite and nothing was too much of a hassle when asked. In particular, a waiter by the name of Adam, was 'simply the best'. From breakfast through until dinner he bent over backwards at any request we had. The buffet breakfast, set menu for lunch and dinner were first class, along with complimentary drinks between 6pm and 8pm. Only a short 5 minute walk from Orchard Road, the Quincy Hotel is well worth everything it has to offer, molton brown toiletries, free mini bar restocked daily, pool on the 12th floor, gym, free wi-fi, 2 items of laundry per room per day, all inclusive. What else could guests want!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the awards”
Reviews.Author: MaldonDW
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the strength of TA awards and reviews and we were not disappointed. Originally built for business users but now much more general tourists using the hotel. The rooms make excellent use of the space (book a corner room for more space). The all inclusive rate include buffet breakfast and waiter served lunch and dinner. Between 6 and 8 pm drinks are free but there is no dedicated bar. The pool on the 12th floor is something to behold. Service, food and all round dedication to making the customer experience were excellent. A great choice for a trendy Singapore break.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, all inclusive was a bonus, exceptional location”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteBT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a 54 min walk from the heart of Orchard Road, it is also a short walk to the Botanical Gardens, embassies, tanglin etc ... I got an exceptional rate via a booking website and was delighted and surprised that this included an al inclusive deal ... when these guys say all inclusive, they mean it. I received as part of the rate transfer to the hotel (from a wonderful gentleman who it felt like gave me a tour on the way), wifi free and fast, breakfast, linch, dinner all included as was the mini bar for snacks, in the evening you even have free drinks and food in the bar area downstairs. There were some lovely touches too such as receiving a letter from the gent that checked me in with his photo explaining he was my relations manager during my stay ... very nice touch !! The pool was also fab, narrow and overhangs the street, again though free drinks form the poolside fridge. The rooms are quite small, but they are well appointed, super comfy and styled in a very modern way, as is the rest of the hotel. They are aiming for chic and this could be seen as pretentious but the wonderful wonderful staff with their warmth, do not allow this to happen ... the staff will also arrange tours, brollies, cars etc for you ... nice job Quincy .... from start to finish ... www.charlottebt.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: ossieosborn
Reviews.Content: It was my first time at this location as suggested by a colleague. Found the hotel to be great in that it is very relaxed and trendy. It has features and benefits that are unique. I consistently felt at ease with the staff and service was comfortable. This location provides snacks, meals and most importantly a daily laundry service (2 items) as part of their package. Believe me; the food selection is very good. Meals were somewhat repetitive, but great none the less. There is a lot to choose from, so no one needs to be concerned. The gym was well equipped and I loved the pool on the 12th floor. It was a boon every morning after a quick workout to drop into the pool and cool off at 6am. The pool is 24 hours a day – available!! The location is off Orchard, easy to walk to. It also a little tough to get a taxi as the hotel right next door seems to get the cream call. I found that it was easier to walk down a block and find one there. No complaints as the hotel location is where it is not busy and not noisy – I loved that part. Rooms are reasonable in size and the shower is incredible. They supply an incredible amount of bath products – really feature rich. In short, a great place and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: markinsuffolk73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the start of our trip to Oz and couldn't fault it. We went with the all-inclusive deal but due to a slight mix-up we did not get picked up from the aiprort, however the staff were really helpful and allowed us to check in early to our room which allowed us to get some sleep after our flight and early arrival. Room was immaculate, spacious and well fitted out and had everything that we needed. The swimming pool was a tad cold but was fantastic and a good place to relax with a drink. The food was also pretty good - couldn't fault the breakfast and the dinner choices and food were good quality. The hotel is only a 5minute walk from Orchard Road and it's plethora of shopping malls so is perfectly located for a short stay. We ahd a great time in Singapore and I would certainly stay @ the Quicny again if we ever get the chance to return!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, very chic and great location”
Reviews.Author: travel1406
Reviews.Content: A short walk from the heart of Orchard Road, and close to Tanglin and the Botanical Gardens, the Quincy is a good choice for business travelers or couples. The rooms are small but cleverly laid out. Everything worked well. The mini bar was free, the internet was free and fast, and the breakfast buffet (also included) was all I could have asked for. The Molton Brown toiletries were an added treat.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not the very best hotel in Singapore, but pretty good”
Reviews.Author: JonathonP
Reviews.Content: I agree with all of the positives mentioned by others, but for me what makes a great hotel is how they handle it when things go wrong. The air con in our room stopped working so I called reception. Within 5 minutes the guy was in my room fixing it. Unfortunately it broke again overnight. When I told reception the next morning they instantly offered me another room. I should point out that the air conditioning in the new room wasn’t exactly arctic-like. It certainly made the room quite comfortable, but if you like your room to be like a fridge (it is Singapore after all) then you might be disappointed. The free meals are a good bonus. We had breakfast most days but only had dinner a couple of times, mainly for convenience. On one evening my wife and I were in a bit of a rush heading out to a show. We asked the waiter at dinner to serve us whatever on the menu was the quickest to make. He suggested one dish, but also offered to make another dish, which wasn’t on the menu. Both dishes arrived very quickly and we made the show. I’ve stayed in quite a few hotels in Singapore for work but this was my first holiday there, so I wanted somewhere with a little more personality. The Quincy certainly has that, it’s quirky, but in a good way. I’d definitely stay there again, if on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: MissRissBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over night after a conference on Bintan Island. Super stylish hotel with all the mod cons - my favorite was the Nespresso in the room! And the Molton Brown bath products - yum. Rooms very comfortable, great bed. Sadly not much of a view due to location but everything is a short walk. Restaurant food and service was great, even though you're a short walk to the shopping and food malls on Orchard Rd. Front desk staff were professional but didn't find them particularly friendly. If you're just booking for a night, note that laundry isn't available as part of your room. We got caught out on this. I did leave some jewelry behind in the bathroom which they posted to me (at my cost) but was impressed they went to the effort. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good All-In Package”
Reviews.Author: galaxyraider
Reviews.Content: This review is a bit late, but I guess it's better late then never. I booked the all-in weekend package for our wedding anniversary and had indicated it to the staff so that they could arrange something special for us. However, the information seemed lost in translation as the receptionist didn't even have a clue. We did get a cake in the end of our visit though, but it would be even better and more memorable if it was in the beginning. We arrived slightly before 2pm, but apparently our room was not ready. We then had to wait for a good 45 minutes. The receptionists didn't even notice that we were waiting and I had to approach them again to get our room. The guy who attended to us the first time was away but he didn't inform the rests about us. All the while we were waiting right in front of them! When I pointed out the delay and requested for later check out time, she was unhappy. What a service! The hotel itself was great. The package was excellent. All the 3 meals (breakfast, lunch & dinner) were included and they were good. The minibar was free and there was a Nespresso machine in the room! The cupcake baking class was enjoyable. All in all it's a good hotel. However, this hotel is more suitable for business trip or couples. Not so suitable for kids as they were not many things to do for them. I believe they could improve their service and it would be an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: RobbieJ0106
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quincy hotel for 3 nights at the start of our trip to the Far East. The hotel provides excellent service and value with the all inclusive package. The location is handy for shopping on Orchard Road, the MRT stations are also close for further afield. Rooms were a good size, comfortable and clean. Would certainly stay at the Quincy again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: subchat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on a Business trip after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor.I had booked directly on the Hotel website and this stay was more to experience the unique new concept of "All Inclusive". I have to admit that this experience was in one word 'Awesome'.Let me start from the beginning: Reached Singapore in the morning by Singapore Airlines at 07.30 am (half an hour before schedule). Breezed through Immigration and Customs ( I had 2 packet of Cigarettes with me and hence went to the Red Channel with intent to declare and pay duty, if required). However, the officer just waved me on through the Green Channel even while I was showing him the packets. Good start to the day. At the exit there was this gentleman standing with my name on a Board and in a short while we were on our way in the Mercedes (Complimentary Limousine Pick up arranged by the Hotel) and reached the Quincy in 30 minutes at 8.45 am. The nice little Front Office girl Alicia checked me in and explained to me the policy of early check in for which you had to pay SGD 20/- per hour (they had mentioned this in the mail in response to my query so no surprises there). She offered to store my luggage and requested me to come back at 12.00(Official check in time is 14.00 hours). Walked to the MRT station Orchard Road ( walk took 10 mins. to Paragon on Orchard Road and another 5 mins. to the MRT). Went to Mohd. Moustafa on Farrer Park for some shopping of Toiletries and Chocolates(only place open 24 hours and prices the cheapest in Singapore). Returned at 12 and Room was ready. However, since I did not want a Room on the 11th Floor due to the reported noise of the Swimming Pool pumps mentioned by a Trip Advisor member so she suggested I have lunch in the meantime while some other Rooms get vacated. Had a lovely lunch of Seafood Fried Rice and then soft serve vanilla ice cream with Chocolate Sauce and was in my Room 1003 on the 10th Floor by 13.00 hours. Rooms : The Rooms are not too large but cleverly designed with lots of Glass to make it look much bigger. Very comfortable King Bed and huge Bathroom with those lovely Molten Brown Toiletries(shampoo,soap,body lotion,shower and bath gel), shaving kit, Toothbrush,comb, cotton buds set Huge French Window with a lovely view of Buildings around with electronically operated curtains to black out the light completely. Complimentary 3/4 bottles of Water ( no hassles of puchasing water and lugging it from the Grocery to your Room) which is replenished daily as are the toiletries and Mini Bar items(Lays, Beer,soft drinks,cup noodles etc.) and coffee/tea/sugar sachets. Hair Dryer, shoe polish, bedroom slippers, Dressing Robe and safe all in the Room. A long working desk and Chair with free internet and multiple plug options are all there in the room.Tell me what else do you require in a Room. Only they could do with some more storage like drawers and a luggage rack . Food: They have a breakfast Buffet from 07.30 to 10.30 am with a variety of dishes which include juices,cereals,croissants/bread,egg options(if you do not like the one on the buffet they can make your choice for you),hash brown,sausages,bacon,baked beans,one local dish like Rice or noodles and excellent coffee from the machine.The breakfast is both varied and adequate. The cafe where all the food is served is an extension of the Reception Area and kept absolutely clean all the time. Lunch is from 11.30 to 14.30 and consists of a set menu with several options of Continental, local(Fried Rice or Fried Noodles),some buger/hot dog options and some pasta etc. The choice is quite good, portions generous and the food tasty.Then for dessert you can help yourself to soft serve vanilla icecream with a choice of Chocolate or Strawberry Sauce.Also soft drink,juices and coffee are freely available. Happy Hours are from 18.00 to 20.00 where you can have your drinks (wine, beer, spirits etc. - house brand only) free and please note that the do not scrimp on the drinks and no sooner you are nearing the end of your drink there is a waiter who politely asks you whether you need another one. Great service all around. Dinner is from 18.00 to 22.00 hours and they have here a soup of the day and dessert of the day and at least 10 options of various dishes - Continental (Grilled Steak,Pan Fried or grilled fish or Chicken,some pastas,risottos and local dishes like nasi goreng,noodles,rice etc. and also 2 items of Special Dishes for the Day. The menu changes everyday but I suooose if you stay for a long period there is bound to be some repetetion.Not Gourmet food but extremely well presented, tasty and generous portions. The dessert while I was there were Tiramisu and another day Chocolate balls or Chocolate Profit Rolls. Yummy. Service: Top notch with smiling people all around and they make you feel at Home both at the Reception and in the Cafe.Alicia the girl at the front office even printed my boarding pass and called a taxi for me. Location: It is around 10 mins leisurely walk to the Orchard Road. Returning back is a gradual incline but nothing much unless you have small children or mobility issues. I thought it very good exercise after all that food . In any case you can always take a taxi which is extremely cheap in Singapore. To sum up this would be an experience of a lifetime and wish more Hotels should introduce this concept or at least a half board concept since most people are away for lunch.If you are in Singapore for a gastomanical experience and wish to move around all over Singapore in search of that perfect meal and to sample all the local dishes then this Hotel is not for you. However, if you have already done the food street experience once and are on a repeat visit to Singapore and would like to relax and enjoy a couple of drinks and some good quality food and experience the All Inclusive concept at a very competetive price and VFM then look no further than Quincy. Kudos to the Quincy team for making the Hotel stay a very satisfying and Comfortable Experience

Reviews.Title: “All-Inclusive Boutique Hotel; Comfy Beds, Great Shower & Meals”
Reviews.Author: 50waystogo
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice 5 night stay at The Quincy. The room was compact, but not too small, with a modern/contemporary decor. Important things: the bed was very comfortable, slept great from day one; and the shower had great water pressure with a choice of hand held or rain shower head. No waiting for hot water either. Nice bed linens, thick towels and Moulton Brown bath products. Only downside to the room was there was no plug in the bathroom for the provided hair dryer so it had to be used in the room and the plug was not by a mirror. Overall though, not a big deal since everything else was so great. The breakfast had many choices of hot and cold items; and the dinners were very good... especially the pastas, many of them handmade! When I commented to the waiter on how excellent the pasta dishes were he told me that the head chef was Italian. After running around Singapore all day, it was very relaxing to be able to have a nice dinner with wine at the hotel... although the dining room setting was very casual and not fancy, the food was great and the menu varied each night. The pool area was nice, with a few chaises and a couch/sitting area set up, but the pool water was very cold, so we did not use it. It was a nice view though from the 12th floor pool deck. The airport pick up was very convenient, and our taxi back to the airport at the end of our visit was only 18SD. Our flight in was 6 a.m., and although we weren't able to check in that early (well, we could have paid extra, but we wanted to start exploring Singapore), they had some shower rooms that we were able to freshen up in, they kept our bags for us and we were able to check in early, just after lunch, with no extra charge. The staff was very nice and helpful when we needed directions and also made dinner reservations for us one night. We highly recommend The Quincy and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for the Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Rcallier0025
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend with my wife. We really enjoyed the room the bed was very comfortable. also liked that we were 10 min walk from Orchard RD. The set lunch and dinner menu has something for everyone and the food is actually pretty good. Would highly recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, good location, good rate - but dusty rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ecotraveller1978
Reviews.Content: The Quincy has a funky decor and is a great deal considering its location (5 min walk from Orchard Road) and all inclusive meal plan (which was delicious). The room was very compact but the decoration was modern. However, the room was incredibly dusty - to the point we immediately began sneezing when we came into the room. In fact, the black phone cord was so dusty the inside of it looked light grey and fuzzy! Disgusting. The decorative headboard also had a thick layer of dust on top. I called housekeeping to ask them to dust when they serviced the room the next day, but they did not. Pretty unacceptable. Another complaint was that it was Chinese New Year and we were told by the lady at the front desk that Chinatown would be dead so not to bother going there. We found out the next day that in fact there had been a parade in Chinatown that night and the neighborhood was packed. That was a deal breaker and so we will not go back where the staff is so clueless about the town they live in, especially as we told her we were there for CNY. They also said they had a list of the 'only' restaurants open, which again was a lie. Maybe they were getting paid a commission? In the end, I'd give this place a 3 and 1/2 if we could add half stars. Stay for the cheap room and nice decor, food, but don't expect anything from the service - and bring a duster!

Reviews.Title: “Funky, friendly and fun.”
Reviews.Author: JRinWA
Reviews.Content: Funky, small and fun. Just what I wanted. Didn't realise the hill back from shopping was going to be so big on the way back from a long day on Orchard Road - but manageable! Breakfast was good, chef happy to prepare eggs however you wanted and staff more than obliging. Meals at night were large and very tasty. Never ate lunch there as always out. Weekend activities are definitely worth trying. Staff great to talk to for "local advice". Overall very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AussieandBrit
Reviews.Content: The staff were so friendly and helpful at this hotel, with a special mention to the restaurant staff who were very polite and always had a kind word and smile for my daughter. The room was clean and comfortable. All meals were included in the price, making this an incredibly reasonable hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Think Different”
Reviews.Author: L0bbster
Reviews.Content: If you could take the Apple Store and turn it into a hotel then the Quincy would fit the bill. The concept is disarmingly simple; include everything in the price that other hotels charge through the nose for, design the rooms to be elegant and simple, treat the guests as part of the family and then let them relax. We really enjoyed our stay here; our room was on the 8th floor and the RFID 'key' means it is easy to open the door. We arrived into Singapore early (around 07.00), were picked up by a driver and his Mercedes and whisked off to the hotel. A small niggle is that check-in isn't until 14.00 so we had to twiddle our thumbs for a while. Nonetheless the staff couldn't have been more helpful, suggesting we could freshen up on the 12th floor, where the pool, gym and sauna/steam rooms were. The showers are beautiful; they're walk in rain showers and there were plenty of towels to grab if we needed them. The pool is beautifully appointed although there are only three sun loungers so it's first come first served. Our room was perfect for us; Moulton Brown products, accessories such as hair dryer/iron etc were thoughtfully arranged all in one place so you don't have to 'hunt them down' and there was a large bath as well as a huge rain-shower. The mini-bar is stocked with water, soft drinks and a couple of cans of beer and you are invited to help yourself. There are facilities to make a cup of tea though there is no milk. Each room can choose to have 2 items dry-cleaned or laundered by the hotel. My wife was sceptical but I dropped off a pair of trousers and a linen shirt at the front-desk at 09.00 and they were ready and brought to our room around 18.00 that same day. They looked as if I had just bought them! Happy Hour is from 18.00 to 20.00 and the service we got was first class; our glasses were never empty and the bar man was excellent at keeping his eye on things and coming up to the guests for a chat. Dinner was good but a bit 'hit and miss'; the menu is a limited one (although it is 'a la carte' and not a dreadful choice of help yourself bain-maries); we would have enjoyed more Singapore dishes but again this is a slight niggle and didn't detract from the experience. Breakfast was excellent although most of the guests seem to twig that much of Singapore doesn't open until 10.00 so they tend to have a late breakfast, which means most people arriving at the same time with a limited number of tables. Even so, we only had a 5 minute wait for a table. To get to Orchard Road is incredibly easy and is a gentle stroll from the hotel. Once we were bored with the 'mall' concept, we took a taxi to Arab St and had a Moroccan peppermint tea at one of the cafes and then caught a bus to China Town for a late lunch. We both really liked this hotel; the experience has been carefully thought out to make it an elegant yet simple one to enjoy and agreed that we would certainly stay there next time we visit Singapore and I liked the fact that all ages seemed to feel equally comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish modern and efficient”
Reviews.Author: Ch B
Reviews.Content: This fairly new set up hotel just of the Orchard Road on the hill, is a nice place to stay. THe nearly 'all inclusive' concept appeals a lot. There is a free minibar and free set diners included in the rack rate, as well as limousine service from the airport. However after 1 years in business the hotel has put up the rates considerably. Also be prepared to receive challenging welcome cards from the staff ( organized) like 'where have you been so long, we haven't seen you for a while'. 'We hope you are doing fine and come stay with us soon again".

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel with unexpected amenties, priced right”
Reviews.Author: Tom N
Reviews.Content: I landed at Changi tired and ready to get to the hotel and grab a bite to eat. My journey with The Quincy started there when the hotel's complimentary limo driver picked me up and gave me a friendly introduction and tour of the city as he drove me to the hotel. When I arrived, I was greeted by the staff and offered a beer and dinner (also on the house) even before I had made it to my room. The service at this place it incredible. And for a business traveler I have no interest in staying on a busy street and being woken up late at night. This place is tucked just far away off of Orchard that you have nice quiet place to retreat from the day but you are only a 2 minute walk from all of the shops and restaurants in the area. A full English breakfast and free dry cleaning were part of my morning the next day. And thus is the way the rest of my week went. I also liked the fact that the hotel is new and hip but doesn't feel pretentious like a chain of hotels named after a letter of the alphabet I sometimes stay at. Should I return to SG someday, I'll definitely be staying at The Quincy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Caroline L
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, excellent value as breakfast, lunch and dinner was included.Good facilities and in a central position, very near to the main shops - about 10 minute walk. Ruben the concierge was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. A must is to visit China Town and to take a "bum" boat along the Singapore River. Very pleasant stay and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “all inclusive= good value”
Reviews.Author: alisonAberdeenshire
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is near Orchard Road easily within walking distance. funky and trendy lobby and rooms, clean but a little attention needed in corridors, under beds etc. The all inclusive deal is good with plentiful good food and drink on offer throughout the day also free mini bar and laundry service. The reception staff were friendly, knowledgeable and efficiant. The waiting staff were great, happy and attentive keeping our wine glass topped up!! The pool area was clean and smart and empty!(bit scary for me with glass walls on the 12th floor!) overall: had a lovely holiday and the Quincy hotel added to our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Quite amazing.”
Reviews.Author: syanagz
Reviews.Content: My birthday celebration continued from Naumi hotel to Quincy hotel last december. It is quite a walk from Orchard mrt station, it's behind the Paragon mall, 5 minutes walk uphill. The staff was polite and friendly. Checking in was a breeze. The lady staff brought us to our room and introduced the facilities to us. Perks: 1. Complimentary wifi. 2. Complimentary breakfast, lunch & dinner. 3. Complimentary mini bar. 4. Molton Brown toiletries. We went for the complimentary dinner and it was good. There were a variety of dishes to choose from - local & international. Soup of the day was clam chowder and there were quite an extensive selection of beverages. Dessert was Tiramisu. The room was itself cosy. Huge bed and nice bathroom. Huge window attached with electronically-operated blinds. Mini bar was a huge selection of drinks, a bag of chips and a cup of instant noodles. I must say this was well thought off. The pool was empty on the day we went. So we had the entire pool to ourselves. The water was so cold but still we had fun. The gym was basic and we did had a go for the sauna. Overall: An amazing experience at Quincy Hotel. Will definitely come back when we get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: aussievoyageur
Reviews.Content: Great value for a few days stay in Singapore. The all-meals-included arrangement works well as the hotel is centrally located and transport is cheap so it is easy to return to the hotel for your meals. The food was good but the menu could change more often.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: GuitarmanBowral
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Quincy on the way back to Australia from the UK in January 2012. Overall we enjoyed the hotel. The superior room we had had a very comfortable bed and a great shower and bath. The 12th floor pool, although not resort style large, was a nice spot to cool off and enjoy the complimentary (non alcoholic) bar and views. The breakfast and lunches are quite good (except for the orange juice...YUK!!!). We did not have dinner at the Quincy, although it was included, as the atmosphere of the "restaurant" (in the foyer area) is not really conducive to anything other than the utilitarian. All in all the Quincy was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Gemstone511
Reviews.Content: We stopped over at the Quincy for 2 nights en route to India. The location is fantastic, the rooms comfortable and spacious and the staff friendly and very efficient. We were collected at the airport which was a real plus after a long flight. The meals were included in the price and for a day or two that is great I think you would get bored with this if you stayed any longer as you would want to explore more restaurant options in Singapore. One issue I did have is that I booked the Quincy months before we were to stay there. In the meantime a friend in Singapore asked us to stay with her. I contacted the Quincy but they had my credit card payment and there was no refund at all. We had paid the full amnt for 2 nights so we had to go with that . I think if there is sufficient notice a full refund should be applicable or you should be able to pay a deposit on booking and the remainder when you turn up. Losing a deposit would be fairer.. That is what I am used to and usually expect. I would recommend this hotel but make sure you do not think you will change your mind , or perhaps, book it at the last minute.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Roger-marston
Reviews.Content: Service and rooms tip top. Good views from all rooms across the city. Very close to Orchard Rd where there are more stores and shopping malls than you could ever need. Food was good and included in the room price as was your beverage before 7pm. Reception staff were very efficient and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, not so good for a stoppover.”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_Prawn
Reviews.Content: This would be a great hotel if you were staying for some weeks. It includes full board in the rate, so you can have breakfast lunch and dinner in the simple restaurant downstairs for no charge. If you are just in town for one night it is not so convenient or good value.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: covanderhoek
Reviews.Content: this hotel is superb ... if you have to stay in singapore, which is mostly one big mall ;-) you definitely consider to stay overhere. it is a modern top class hotel, with all facilities and with a very high class service. you feel extremely welcome by the overall friendly staf - from doorman to manager. this is what europe needs ;-) i will definitely visit them again. co van der hoek the netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Honestly - an excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JuneMcL
Reviews.Content: I had read other reviews of this hotel and the majority seem to be in agreement that this is simply a great hotel. I read someone who complained that this is not a 5 star hotel and I understand that this is not a 5 star hotel in terms of luxury (although it is cracking) but for the package you get, the staff and food - this is excellent (which happens to be 5 star of trip advisor site). The hotel is modern, the rooms are clean and the bathrooms are lovely (shower amazing) with a nice touch of Molton Brown products. There is a very large tv on the wall, a coffee machine and mini bar. All items in the mini bar are free - mostly soft drinks but a few tins of beer too. The only complaint I had was that we were woken a few times in the morning by the sound of water in pipes, like someone somewhere was flushing the toilet (room 301) and I think the hotel should look into this. The wifi is free. The pool (on the 12th floor) is open air and slightly overhangs the building which is pretty cool. Don't get me wrong, if you're an olympic swimmer, you're not going to get a massive work out but it was great to unwind after a day on your feet. There were loads of towels here for your use and another big fridge with free water/soft drinks. The sauna was lovely, as was the steam room and the small gym was modern. The food was very good - I was only there for 4 days so no issues with the choice. I can honestly say that there was always three or four choices on each menu I could have had. We also made use of the 2 hours free bar where you could get most alcoholic drinks. The restaurant staff were lovely - very attentive and friendly. The location of the hotel was fab - I read one review that complained that it was up a hill - I can only think this person lives in Holland where there are no hills because there was a slight incline to the hotel, nothing more and it was a 5 minute walk to Orchard Road. We had no issues with being collected by the hotel taxi either. We did arrange our own taxi for going back to the airport as the hotel would charge you $68 but arrange yourself it was only $45. This IS and excellent hotel and I would stay here again if I return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in a big city”
Reviews.Author: DeliverAsPromised
Reviews.Content: Stayed in January for work. Great place to base yourself from, with no fuss access to free Internet, laundry, free food, free drinks during happy hour (2hrs). It makes a hotel stay away from home actually enjoyable. You don't feel disconnected. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Anna C
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at the Quincy for 5 nights, everything about this place is great...no fantastic. Excellent value & great location. The many inclusions such as airport pick up, 3 restaurant quality meals each day, evening drinks & daily laundry make this a value package. The staff were great & the room top notch. I wish all accommodation was as good value as The Quincy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: pawsandclaws
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Quincy in October 2011 and had a fabulous stay. We were there a total of four nights and on the first night our room was hot and the aircon was just not reaching a comfortable level of coolness for us. We asked to have it seen to and a maintenance man was sent to check on it. He adjusted some things but after an hour we still did not notice any change and as it was late decided to tough it out and see what happened after more time. The following day it was still hot and humid in our room and the aircon was on so high we could not hear ourselves talk. We went down for breakfast and explained to the very helpful lady at the front desk that there was an issue. On our return from a day of shopping the room was yet again unbearable so we notified the front desk. Within a half hour they had moved us to a gorgeous corner room that was larger in size, more comfortable with a few special touches that the first room definitely could have done with. This room was perfect in temperature with everything working, as it should. This was not a room I saw advertised on the Quincy’s website, if it was I would have reserved it as for us price is not necessarily the deciding factor. The room was more spacious and the bathroom more luxurious. Dinners are included in the Internet rate and I found the food served was really actually surprisingly good. There is a free cocktail hour but the staff is happy to reserve a glass or two of the wine or whatever for you so you can still have it with your dinner if you go over cocktail hour. The menu varied every with some interesting meals served and my fussy foodie palate was kept amused and happy. Not gourmet fare at al but honest and simple and good cooking being done in the kitchens. Breakfasts were a bit repetitive and boring but I did love the help yourself coffee machines that served a nice strong good quality fresh coffee. All in all the Quincy won big with us. There staff is brilliant and helpful, always smiling and ready to help when it is needed or just returns a friendly greeting. I loved the modern twist this hotel offers in so many areas and the location is excellent and close to the shopping mecca. Perhaps our only complaint was that as mentioned previously the Quincy needs to put the more luxurious rooms on the Internet as an option to reserve with perhaps more detailed photos. If the second room we were given was on the Internet it is most definitely the room I would have reserved. Our first room was adequate but small in size but still passable for a short stay. The Quincy also has a fascinating poll floor. My husband and I enjoyed one night sitting out in the cool air watching the lights and reading a newspaper. Sodas and water are freely available all over the hotel at no charge. The Quincy was a great place to stay and a definite return destination for us.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay and amazing service”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMU
Reviews.Content: Stayed in The Quincy hotel as a "staycation" for my partner's birthday celebration. Excellent service from the staff who help me surprise my partner by putting my bouquet of roses on the bed, they even surprised him with a tiramisu with a birthday tag and candle at 9pm (a front fesk staff named Henessey sent the desset up) and ended our stay with a happy birthday card. Just bowled me over with their personal touches. The rooms are spacious and the bathroom amenities are stocked up with wonderfully scented Molton Brown showering products. Of course their famous stocked up mini bar which is fully stocked and complimentary as part of the deal. I will definitely recommand them to visiting friends for their amazing service and the easy access to the hotel and yet away from the nightmare of Orchard Road -L

Reviews.Title: “Quincy...Great location & inclusions (wi fi, airport transfer, mini bar...)”
Reviews.Author: TracyLT
Reviews.Content: My family (me, my husband, 14yo daughter & 17 yo son) stayed for 2 nights in December. The location is fantastic, about 3-5 min from Orchard Road shops (come out close to Ion Orchard Centre). The hotel itself is quite stunning and the rooms are very clean and modern. The "perks" of free pick up from airport, 2 pieces free laundry, breakfast, lunch & dinner, free wi-fi included , free mini bar (beer, water, soft drink, chips) are all fantastic and valuable. Breakfast is a buffet - cereal, toast, bacon, eggs, fruit, juice, cheese, meats - ok Didnt try lunch. Dinner pretty good-vegetarian daughter well catered for with pasta; I had chicken schitizel, husband steak, son pasta. Free wine/beers from 6-8pm (I think they offer "cocktails" too which is spirits?) Pool seems good but didnt use it. Husband used gym & said it was good. Negatives? Not many but.... We booked and paid in advance but when we got there we were told we had to pay $30 per night for an "upgrade" in order to get the "connecting rooms" we requested. They did not actually connect, they were merely next door to each other. Also, our mini bar didnt work. Tip: hotel offers to arrange return airport transfer for $68 SGD. We arranged our own maxi cab and paid about $25 SGD

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Leswant
Reviews.Content: I went with my partner to singapore in mid december. I usually don't give myself the time to write reviews but in this case I wanted to highlight a hotel that will give you that extra service and smile that makes the stay memorable. That is what you get when you stay at Quincy in Singapore. The breakfast, lunch and dinner options that were included are quite good as well *smiles* There is a quite adequate gym incuded, the pool looked good but was unfortunately being serviced when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Most Trendy Hotel I've Visited”
Reviews.Author: TAMember021620121
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with my stay here in August 2011. What enticed us to visit was the all inclusive package that is offered with this Boutique hotel. When deciding on which hotel to stay at, a lot of the other options were similar in price but could not match what is included when you stop at the Quincy. The room was clean, slightly on the small side. The bathroom was good sized with a tub. The internet speeds were good and the minibar included a selection of soft drinks and two cans of lager. Given the higher cost of alcohol in Singapore, I think the included drinks in the Minibar and the free drinks in the evening is great. We arranged pickup from the airport and the driver was waiting when we arrived. The transfer in the Mercedes was around 20-30 minutes, although the car does have free wifi on board. Our driver was nice and the hotel reception staff were as to be expected. The staff at the restaurant area were also polite. The service is polite, but not too extreme which is what I visioned. I found the location pretty good. The main advantage is close proximity to the shops, malls and Orchard which is what I wanted. The hotel is located at the top of a small hill, but nothing too dramatic. The closest MRT is a 10-15 minute walk. The pool area is cut in to the building so is mostly shaded and the gym is small but well equipped. The pool area and gym have free drinks for guests. I would recommend the Quincy and have already booked a return trip in Q1 of 2012. Both times I have booked directly through the Quincy site and there have been offers of reduced price rooms when booking multiple days which is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Book it - you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Roy R
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of the reviews on Trip Advisor. This was a special trip and I wanted my wife to enjoy the hotels I selected. This was the first leg of a month long holiday so the Mercedes limo waiting for us at the airport hit the right note from the off. When we arrived at the hotel the receptionist took us to our room on floor 14 (which had a good view) and pointed out the all inclusive nature of the hotel and made us feel very special. They had picked up on the fact that it was my birthday and gave me a handmade card and a bottle of wine. The all inclusive meals were a bonus and the complimentary mini bar was a nice touch. The food was fine and the mini bar stocked with beer and soft drinks. The room decor was very modern and gave the feel that little expense had been spared. The impressive pool was out of order during our visit, but we could have used their sister hotel pool. The staff at the Quincy are the real stars - they really appear to care about their Customers. After checking out in the morning and returning for our bags for a late evening flight, we were invited to take coffee while the receptionist went off down the street to find us a taxi. We were no longer guests but the service continued regardless. They should start running courses for larger hotel to train their staff in Customer service. The location couldn't have been better. Close enough to the action but in a quiet cul-de-sac, so noise was non existent .We had considered booking a tour of Singapore. However, we saw all the main parts on foot during our two day stay. So, if you like walking I would recommend this as a way of seeing the city at close quarters. One highlight was the superb Botanical Gardens, only a 20 minute walk from the Quincy.

Reviews.Title: “What a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sydneydavid56
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the stay. Staff are friendly and pleasant. Breakfast was limited but good with something for everyone. Even though we didn't lunch or dinner there we enjoyed an evening drink before heading out. Definately would recommend this one to you. Great location as well

Reviews.Title: “The Trendiest Hotel in Asia' by TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: yulianjade
Reviews.Content: I was browsing around to look for a nice hotel to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. And, i came across Quincy. They provides 3 meals daily! Tell me, which hotel provides lunch and dinner for their guests?! Except Quincy! Service - A pleasant greeting from the staff at the lobby - After checking in, the staff escort us to our room!!! - Complimentary red wine provided! - A big surprise! Mini bar is FOC, yes FOC! You can find 6 bottles of mineral waters, can drinks and beer too! Chips, nuts and cup noodle! Housekeeping replenish daily! Awesome max! Room - ipod docking station avail - bathrobe, slippers, iron, torchlight, what ever necessities you can find in the wardrobe - Molten brown toiletries, high end toiletries know! - comfortable fluffy bed Facilities - gym, sauna, steambath, indoor swimming pool locate at the same level. - best thing is you can grab drinks from the chiller is absolutely FOC too! - towels provided beside the swimming pool as well - iMac stations in the lobby Dining - classic breakfast buffet - local lunch set menu - international dinner set menu - don't forget to grab some beers or liquor during their happy hour (6pm-8pm). Absolutely FOC, yes FOC again. It's no wonder they're awarded The Trendiest Hotel in Asia' by TripAdvisor

Reviews.Title: “Innovative Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Vikrant Y
Reviews.Content: I started my honeymoon with Quincy for two days and we really liked the hotel. It has a very innovative character in it's room and it's decor and the service here- full board, laundry, complimentary wi-fi means that the hotel price you pay is the price you have to spend. Absolutely, loved the hotel and I would love to come back and stay in it for all my trips to singapore. Also, the location is very convenient as it's just off orchard meaning shopping is just a few minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HC_Chua
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Quincy after a 2-night stay. We were both very impressed, hence decided to sit down immediately to craft this review. We are Singaporeans and decided to make a reservation at the Quincy Hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We wanted a spot near to the Orchard Road shopping belt from which we could enjoy the restaurants and cafes in the vicinity. A lot has already been mentioned in other reviews so I would just focus on experiences that were unique to our stay. We had a room on the 13th floor, which is the second from the top if I was not mistaken. View was average, since it was surrounded by buildings of similar height. Room size was average for Singapore hotels but very well designed and fitted. Bathroom fittings were quality all through and Molton Brown toiletries was a nice touch. Even though all the meals were included, we decided to save our stomachs for restaurants that we had targeted before this stay. We did grab lunch after our check-in and the food was good. There was a decent selection to cater to most palates. Breakfast was average. Could understand why some reviews were critical as the rest of the package/hotel sort of raised our expectations. There is room for improvement but we were more than satisfied with the choice and quality. For a hotel with a small footprint, Quincy has done a good job putting in a small pool, gym and steam room on the 12th storey. Our focus was not to make use of these amenities during our stay but did check them out. We liked what we saw. Service was great both before and during the stay. As we are locals, airport transfer did not quite apply. I emailed the hotel to request for a pickup from a local address. The response was prompt and positive. No fuss at all. In view of our anniversary, a couple of bottles of Sauternes and a personalized card were left in our room while we were out on our first night. Icing on the cake, we must say! We enjoyed our stay at the Quincy very much. We are already considering a return to this wonderful hotel in future. Hurray to the Q team!

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: raura
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is the perfect hotel. The Limo (included in price of the room) meets you at the airport, whisks you to the door (be aware that the limo is only included one way - not return). Check in was abreeze, Claudine checked me in very quickly, then came up to the room and showed me around. The rooms are fantastic. Great bed, free mini bar (but no alcohol), great ipod dock, great TV. Bathroom is fantastic with large rainhead shower and also great bath. Lots of amenities including umbrella (for rainy Singapore!). My only complaint was that there was an iron, but no ironing board??? so impossible to iron really. Reception gave me a power adaptor too as I did not have one. All food is included - buffet style. Only ate breakfast as I missed dinner and lunch due to my flight times, but it was fantastic. Combo of western and Asian food. And it is all free!!! The gym is very very well equipped with new equipment. Pool is fantastic, as it has a great view, but it was closed for renovations the week that I was there. The hotel is a short walk from Orchard Road, and also the Orchard MRT train station. Bit of a hike if you had big bags, but otherwise it is a great location. Staff all very very good. I cannot really fault this hotel. Amazing, and trendy too!! It is far better than a lot of the 5 star 'chain' brand hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Quincy”
Reviews.Author: Bryan_889
Reviews.Content: Great feel to the hotel immediately on arrival, which is very important. Cool lobby and fast efficient check in and very helpful, professional staff all assisting where possible. My hotel room was and still is small but the layout is smart, nice simple TV and internet system, nice stylish bathroom and always a pleasure having Moulton & Brown shampoos and shower gels etc – nice touch guys! I enquired to the reception of the cost of Internet and was told 16 S$ for 24hrs but when I went online it was actually free. Don’t change it, people like that! And disappointing, only had a quick over night business trip, as I wanted to check out the steam, sauna and pool on the 12th floor – shame I didn’t have more time; one of my friends raved about it – he obviously had more spare time than me.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and funky in the heart of downtown Orchard Rd”
Reviews.Author: Hawksksk
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay here in Oct 2010 for a couple of nights. As I was a newbie to Singapore, I was really impressed with its central location. And, as it's tucked up a quiet side street, it doesn't come with the noise and bustle that you associate with the Orchard Rd shopping area. Aside from the great location, the hotel itself is a pretty impressive sight. Very unique and cosmopolitan, it has a real architectural charm and great street appeal. Inside, the place reflects the same attention to trendy detail, with modern and stylish furnishings. Upon check in and throughout my entire stay, ALL the staff were extremely welcoming and helpful. And SMILEY! I love that. My room was clean, comfortable and fitted out nicely. Not the biggest room I've ever been in, but nice all the same. The open air infinity pool was amazing. I would've spent more time out here if I wasn't only in town for such a short stay. To swim with views of the surrounding neighbourhood was a real treat. Lastly, and quite possibly the most convenient and stand-out part of the package, is the all inclusive meal option. My memories a tad hazy, but as I seem to recall, EVERYTHING was included - Breakfast and Dinner, and then free hours pours of wine, beer and spirits!?! I honestly thought there was a misprint to begin with, but no. A few scotch and drys every evening after dinner, don't mind if I do. Very nice. It's been over a year since my visit, and I now actually live in Singapore. If I was to visit the city as a tourist, I'd recommend the Quincy without any doubt. It's the perfect base for any tourist. For a business traveller, it's also a great and easy option. However, it's proximity is to Orchard Rd and shopping - not the Financial or major Business districts. However, given the criminally cheap price of taxis over here, I'd gladly stay here, a place that feels a lot fresher and friendlier than your standard chain business hotel, and shell out for the cab fare. Great little spot.

Reviews.Title: “No surprises”
Reviews.Author: Jonasy
Reviews.Content: It may be stylish but this is definitely not five star hotel, our auto-windows shade was lob sided, bad room service food quality from Modesto, loud bathroom noise from the room upstairs and horrible welcome drinks which should not be served in the first place. Staff were friendly but that was it....my first and last stay sadly.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy little gem”
Reviews.Author: ColomboJJ
Reviews.Content: Excellent modern hotel next door to The Elizabeth Hotel, 5mins walk to/from Orchard Street. The food (breakfast,lunch & dinner are usually included in the room price) was great, especially the steak I had for dinner and the fried rice I had for lunch. Lunch & dinner are a la carte, while breakfast was a buffet. Breakfast selection could have been better, but all in all, great value for money. Free minibar included juices, soft drinks, beer & chips. The room were slightly small, but very tastefully decorated. However many sites mislead about the number of floors- there are only about 16 floors and not 28 as advertised. The pool on the 12th floor was small and rather cold. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: whitegiraffe
Reviews.Content: I chose the Quincy after extensive consultation of Tripadvisor reviews, and it's true that it's well located and has nice rooms and a lovely pool deck. Unfortunately, nobody mentioned the nauseating smell of food that hits you as you walk through the lobby door - the lobby doubling as the restaurant. It is absolutely overwhelming and has the odour of a hospital kitchen. Personally, I found it so stomach turning that it was extremely difficult to eat the food they did have on offer. On the first night, my partner and had went to eat outside (in the smoking area) simply to escape it. Having said that, the Pasta Arrabiata I ate on the first night was among the best I've ever eaten. Breakfast though was dire. They do provide everything you could wish for - bread, yoghurt, eggs, etc, but it is of the poorest quality imaginable. All I ate was the Cornflakes. There are many positives at the Quincy. The limo from the airport is brilliant after a long flight. The staff are pleasant and helpful and the rooms attractive and clean. The pool deck and gym are lovely, though the pool, sauna and steam room were all cold. The location just off Orchard Road is excellent. For me, however, the hotel isn't worth it unless you're in Singapore on business and planning to eat lots of meals in the hotel and make the most of the free WiFi and laundry. We ate two meals there in two days, missed the laundry service and were disappointed with the cold pool, sauna and steam room so rightly or wrongly, we felt short-changed. Recommended for business travellers only.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel & Great location to main shopping on Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: Joolsinbris
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Quincy for 4 nights from the 26th November to the 30th November. This hotel was a real find. We love 5 star hotels and this lived up to all those expectations and more. It is well located being a 5 mins walk from the Paragon Shopping Centre and Orchard Road. The room was very contemporary with a large comfortable bed, large flat screen TV and a great window seat. The bathroom has a fantastic dual shower - "rain shower" included -plus a large tub. What we noticed the most was the cleanliness and number of staff around the hotel cleaning and polishing the lifts, floors etc. The hotel also has a pool & gym on the 12th floor which is lovely and great views while you are paddling around. If I had to make a criticism it would be the buffet breakfast being a little average, but having said that they have a self serve coffee machine which made great cappacino and I am a coffee addict so this went down well! Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and Impeccable Service, Excellent Boutique Hotel, Impressive Amenities”
Reviews.Author: LawyeroftheYear
Reviews.Content: Check in - convenient; fast and efficient Amenities - all working and serviced properly - nice gym, I used the pool and steam The hotel is well designed, trendy, Apple Macs in the lobby for surfing the net, wi fi throughout - good coffee and lots of free water regularly replenished. All the small touches are there. Location wise it is perfect. A 2 minute pleasant walk to Paragon shopping center on Orchard Rd. The most impressive aspect was that of the staff, in particular Ruben, who went beyond the call of duty when I left my Suit Jacket in a taxi (with wallet, iphone 4 in the pockets!). Ruben telephoned all cab companies; assisted with me getting to the airport and did everything he could to make my life easier after my own mistake. This is what a great hotel is all about - no nameless faces - truly personal service.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with amazing perks”
Reviews.Author: Sewaneegal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quincy during our first trip to Singapore from 11/23 - 11/27. We chose it based on Trip Advisor reviews, location (5-10 min. walk from Orchard Road shopping district and MRT station), and price. The Trip Advisor reviews for the Quincy are right on the money. This is a great boutique hotel at a great price, considering all the perks. The hotel is clean and modern but not fussy. It is described as very "trendy," but I did not think it any trendier than a W Hotel, for example, and the staff was certainly very friendly and accomodating. The hotel seems to make an attempt to make guests feel at home, with free yoga on Sat., cupcake baking classes on Sat., and once/week "movie night" at the very cool infinity pool on the 12th floor. If I were a business traveller in Singapore, I think this would be a very comforting place to stay. Included in our room rate ($235/night) was a limo transfer from the airport, two free pieces of laundry or drycleaning/day (LOVED THIS, having been in humid Thailand the week before), free Wi-Fi (excellent speed and connection on my iPhone), free local calls, free minibar( water, tea, soda, beer), free cocktails from 6-8 PM, and breakfast/lunch/dinner. We did not eat 3 meals a day, but found the hotel food to be pretty decent. Breakfast was a buffet with Asian and Western options. The pasta we had for dinner was surprisingly good, but there are simply too many great places to eat in Singapore to be eating at the hotel all the time! The rooms are small (like NYC or any large city) but well-designed and feel larger than they are. The beds were a bit firm for my taste, but linens were nice quality and pillows soft. Bath was good-sized with separate (large) tub and shower. The toilet was Japanese-style with attached bidet. Toiletries were by Molton Brown, always a plus. We had no significant trouble with noise during our stay. We did not use the pool or workout rooms but did check them out. The pool is very nice with a lovely city view and free water, sodas, and beer and towels available at the pool. The workout area is small but has very nice, new, state-of-the art machines. We enjoyed our stay at the Quincy very much. When we return to Singapore, we would definitely consider returning. I think I might have preferred a location closer to the river as I am not a big shopper, but a similarly charming hotel there (Fullerton was beautiful) would have been twice as expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: emmoo
Reviews.Content: Quincy Just back from my Singapore trip not too long ago. Choose this hotel because of the reviews in Tripadvisor. Was very satisfied with my stay. Just a small problem, I didn't know the hotel is located at uphill which I need to walk up and down to Orchard. Walking down is not a problem but walking up is a major problem for me as I need to carry a 9 months old baby with me all the time, plus some shopping bags.  I have booked for 2 nights but wanted to check out the next day because of the uphill location. Spoke to Leo, Assistant Manager of the hotel but was informed that my money will be forfeited for the next day as I have fully paid for a promotion package. However he offered me a free upgrade and a teddy bear to my baby. We named the bear "Quincy" to remind us of this wonderful trip. I was very pleased with the way he handled the situation and helping us during our stay. I have stayed in many hotels, some are much better hotels but this hotel offers one of the best service.  Pros: Neat, clean and modern room Free minibar Free limousine pick up Free local calls Excellent service Good food, for both lunch & dinner Cons: Breakfast variety is very limited Location ( I don't it is a problem for most people unless you have a baby like me or you having walking problem)

Reviews.Title: “Qool??? What a biggest joke on earth!”
Reviews.Author: jimmyong911
Reviews.Content: I tried hard yet failed to notice any significant aspect of this hotel that supposed to make it a great hotel. Location wise, its ok if you don't mind walk up and down hill. The level of service is perhaps the most jarring disappointment. Nevermind that the staffs can't even address guests by their name, they are simply nothing much to shout about other than hypocrite.
