If I have to pay that sort of money again, I would have done it just like how we spent our weekend last week. Pay additional $10 stay in a 5 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Unique boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pam255112
Reviews.Content: Small but impressive, nice rooms well appointed, great staff, nice breakfast, easy walking distance of Orchard Road, we really enjoyed our stay here and would recommend this hotel to a couple on holiday or anyone on a business trip

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Tom H
Reviews.Content: I did not actually stay at the hotel but my partner does and she chooses it whenever she is in Singapore because she loves it. I wanted to surprise her with something special and after calling from Australia, the Assistant Manager, Leo, was able to assist me by placing a special amenity and a handwritten note in her room. Leo was kind enough to do this all free of charge and even sent me some photos of the gift and note. I was very impressed with his service and this reflects very well on the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “So glad I chose this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: helen371
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a week's holiday to Singapore. Prior to going I trawled the internet, looking for the best hotel and decided on The Quincy as the reviews I read were so positive. I'm so glad I chose this hotel. From the moment I was met from the airport by their driver the service they provided was excellent and the hotel itself is just lovely and also in a great location, central to everything. The room was great, with complimentary mini bar (re-stocked daily) and Molton Brown toiletries. The food was of a good quality and the restaurant staff really take care of you. If I am ever lucky enough to return to Singapore I would choose this hotel again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “One of the must modern!”
Reviews.Author: Gijao
Reviews.Content: I go often to Singapore and i already try many hotels but that one, are one of the best that i see in Singapore... I mean to price is around 200 euro, of course there are some better but the price are not the same... Quincy are really clean and really close of shopping area the room are nice, they should not includ the dinner in the price room because around Singapore there are so many competitive restaurants much better and according my opinion if you stay less than 5 days in Singapore is much better try the different type of quisine around the town... But Quincy was a nice experience...

Reviews.Title: “Best deal for hotel stay near orchard shopping belts”
Reviews.Author: Panda9830
Reviews.Content: Stay 1 night at Quincy hotel on 5-Nov-11, never disappoint, have a great time with wife. Checked in at 2pm, was wow by the modern & cosy design of the room, with 42" LED TV (w HBO, MovieStar, CNN, local channels & a host of other), free mini bar w cokes, 7-ups, carlsbery beers, mineral waters, lays chips etc, free wifi, dock for charging apple devices, ironing board, air dryer, branded shampoo, body wash, mouth wash, toothbrush etc... Stay cover all meals (buffet bf, ala carte lunch & dinner), yummy :) Night time after dinner u can relax at the pool sides w music, free flow of liquor, popcorns, chips & movie which screen at 9pm :) Turn down come with free bottle of red wine for guest, a plus factor :) Staffs are friendly & helpful :) Hotel is located at a quiet area & away from the noisy, busy street of orchard road, and also only a 5min walk to paragon shopping mall at orchard road. For a promo price of $374 nett per night is really worth the value esp hotel is near orchard shopping belt. Sure will return for weekend stay, thumb-up :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience with attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: DaynaLee80
Reviews.Content: This is a backdated review. My friend and I checked into Quincy on 22 October 2011 for the weekend. Firstly, the day before the check-in, my friend who made the booking received a call from the hotel asking if we are interested in the Baking Class. Although we did not join the class, we were thankful for the effort made by the hotel staff to verify before we check in. Upon checking in, we were told to wait for our room in the restaurant and take our lunch because they needed to verify which room was the twin room. We were rather puzzled due to this, and finally asked them about it, when the front desk staff very candidly told us that the twin beds used to be together, serving as a King bed, and now Housekeeping will be pulling them apart while we have our lunch. We were rather amused by it. (But let me assure you... the beds were gloriously comfortable.) That evening, when we were having our dinner, the staff of the hotel appeared with a Tiramisu cake to wish my friend "Happy Birthday". Apparently when they updated our particulars into their system, they noticed that my friend's birthday was the day before and surprised my friend with a birthday cake and a personalised birthday card! For the past few years, we have been celebrating birthdays with staycations and this was the only hotel which did something like that without being prompted. Thank You to Quincy Hotel for making my friend's birthday weekend memorable! The room was well equipped, cozy with the complimentary mini-bar, the wi-fi (so many hotels in Singapore do not have that!). The bed was comfortable, and they allowed for late check out. The food at the restaurant was good too! I have stayed in many hotels, even hotels such as St. Regis and Hotel Fort Canning. I have to say that Quincy Hotel was the best staycation I ever had with my friends and I will sincerely recommend it to people. I may be back for my next staycation too! Thank you for the lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Experience - Perfect Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: tsawaf
Reviews.Content: After using tripadvisor for several years now, all it took was Quincy Hotels perfect reaction to a lousy a situation to take this hotel from a solid good to a great .. Was staying in room 303 and woke up after an afternoon nap to a mini flood in my toilet. Called down to the reception and the receptionist; Claudette/Claudine - i need to confirm her name - switched me to a new room without hesitating. I didnt even need to ask for a switch. Two mns later she personally delivered the new keys with an apology. Furthermore, she knew that my brother had checked out earlier in the day and consequently took the initiative to put me in a king size bed as opposed to a twin room without my even requesting it. That was what i appreciated more than anything. So i walked into my room later that night only to find a personalised letter apologising for the 'mini swimming pool' in my room - not to mention the personalised Molton Brown giftbag with several toiletries (that werent even offered as a standard in the room). Overall, the hotel is very well located, has free internet (a big deal in a world in which established five star brands dont), a few free bears and at least seven free bottles of water per room! Had i selected a St. Regis, Four Seasons or Shangri-La - i wouldve paid at least S$400. The Quincy stood at about S$280/night and while it had several kinks (bar isnt open late night, free drinks at the bar btw 2-8pm didnt extend to my friend who was hanging with us --> even though we were two guests in the bedroom the first night) i would definitely say this hotel is excellent value for money .. Again - great customer service, excellent value for money .. its not the Four Seasons, but then again i wasnt paying Four Seasons prices!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great change from the normal Singapore hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKaussie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after a 2 night stay at the Quincy. It really does deserve an "excellent" rating. From the time I booked off the hotel website the staff were incredibly responsive. We had a twin and a double room placed next to each other as we had requested. We liked the minimalist style and up to date electronic gadgetry and the shower was excellent. If there was only one thing we could have done with in the rooms it would have been more storage space. Nonetheless, the bed was very comfortable indeed, the hotel quiet despite its location (very convenient to Orchard Road shops and MRT) and the free minibar a great idea. We enjoyed the gym and the groovy swimming pool on the 12th floor (the temperature of the pool was cool which is just what you need in humid Singapore). The waiting staff in the restaurant were great and the drinks at cocktail hour and the wine during dinner, were free flowing. We ate breakfast and also dinner at the hotel both nights. The menu changed between nights and there were daily specials as well. The selection is predominantly western with a strong pasta bias but there was also fish and steak on the menu. The starter was soup and bread and there was a different dessert each night or alternatively a help yourself soft serve icecream or fruit salad. I agree with all of the positive comments about this place. As we arrived in Singapore from Indonesia, the hotel was happy to arrange for our free pick up service to come from Terah Manah ferry wharf rather than Changi.

Reviews.Title: “Quincy Package - Businessman's Point of View”
Reviews.Author: SJH2702
Reviews.Content: http://www.quincy.com.sg/ The Limo driver (included in my package) was waiting at the designated area. He chatted to me all the way into the city so I did not get to try the Wi-Fi but that wasn’t a problem to me. The rooms are not the largest I have stayed in in Asia, but they are more than adequate. The room assigned to me for 2 weeks was a standard room, which had a queen size bed, long desk / work area, bath & separate shower, 1m wide robe with safe & drawer. Overall the standard room is adequate for the single businessperson, but maybe a bit tight for a couple. Having now completed my stay at the Quincy I realise I could have left some clothing at home & just relied on the free laundry – 2 pieces per day and if you want more pieces washed, the 2 highest cost items are free then you pay for the remaining. Meals are more than adequate: Breakfast – cereal, yoghurt, bread/toast, bacon, sausages, eggs, baked beans, has browns, pancakes, various fresh fruit, juices, tea, and coffee. Only problem with breakfast is they didn’t have VEGEMITE… (But that was fixed by a visit to the supermarket in the Paragon basement, which is at the end of Mount Elizabeth road just near Orchard. Lunch – only got to enjoy lunch once due to work and sightseeing, but the day I did it was typical lunch fare – burger, steak sandwich, BLT, plus a number of other options. Dinner - steak, fish, chicken available every night, plus an additional 7-8 items which varies on a 3 or 4 night rotation, including lasagne, sweet & sour or vegetarian dishes, etc.…. The staff were extremely pleasant & helpful, though in some cases English was not well spoken in the restaurant which made for some interesting / frustrating conversations, but they definitely tried hard to please.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: GoLo
Reviews.Content: I usually don’t give a 5 but I just can’t find anything wrong about the Quincy. I wish there were more hotels like it around the world. Airport pick-up, all meals and drink included, internet, laundry, and a great service…what else do you need? Location is great, walking distance to Orchid (use short cut thru the building across the street) and the rooms are top notch, clean and comfortable. I won’t consider staying anywhere else while in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “JUST SUPERB AS USUAL”
Reviews.Author: fintanBeijing
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from just after the opening when I lived in Singapore -when food was really terrible!!! now six?? times later -always great -rooms really really well designed -small but elegant -location superb- you maybe confused but realy on Orchard in three/five minutes walk!!food now great -maybe waiters need to smile more but guess they do not get much tips as all inclusive -we should and I do reward their service -I work in Hotels as a Hotel Manager in China now as a European -love this place as my partner does -love Singapore love Quincy -bit pricey but value for money and a real find -pool superb -real quality "Molton Brown" toiletries which are the best -for me my home in Singapore -just great to relax and unwind with free internet even in garden -pknow Singapore hard to convince me to stay elsewhere !!

Reviews.Title: “Oh please”
Reviews.Author: 24Hour
Reviews.Content: I can only conclude that the over the top positive reviews of this hotel are from people who have never really been to a fine hotel. To give this pedantic place a 4 or 5 star rating is ridiculous. It's a middling hotel that disguises a lot of un-needed "inclusives" in the "it's for your convenience" mantra of so called customer service. The staff at the restaurant are good but I suspect that is a different company.

Reviews.Title: “great experiences-excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: hartman30
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice when coming to Singapore for our holiday,Excellent location close to the Core of the city.The service and the attention is excellent.The rooms are quite,clean,and very comfortable.Couldn't have asked for more from the hotel- very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and value, I'll return.”
Reviews.Author: Shami S
Reviews.Content: As this was my first trip to Singapore, arriving after 10pm, I really appreciated the free limo pick-up from the airport. If I'd arrived earlier or was staying 2 nights I could have enjoyed free cocktails and dinner. As it was, I was impressed with the breakfast selection and the lunch (about 8 options), all included as were the snacks and minibar (only 2 beers, but lots of soft drinks)...they even had nespresso machines in the bedrooms. I found the price reasonable, even cheap compared to basic room rate for other Singapore hotels.

Reviews.Title: “satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: anujaustin
Reviews.Content: average hotel for the price. A/C is observed not effective in my room

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for Business”
Reviews.Author: eng_pablog
Reviews.Content: All inclusive Hotel Boutique! Excellent choice when coming to Singapore for Business, Excellent location in a quite zone close to the Core of the city. The service and the attention is excellent and the personnel is always willing to meet your requirements. The rooms are quite, clean, tidy and very comfortable, the minibar complementary is good quality. The food is really good, nevertheless being a hotel boutique with only one rest. there is not too much option when you eat there for more than a week. However, the quality of the food is good. Gym and Pool are really cool, gym with up-to-date machines in really good conditions! Pool fit for laps and the environment in the Pool and gym are is nice. There are two last generation computer for internet and the front Desk will assist you in scanning and printing. The wi-fi in the room Complementary is really fast! The Best Option in Hotel for Business in Singapore. Also you might want to stay there for Vacation and Shopping excellent location. Also for Family they provide the Baby Crib.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT FIND”
Reviews.Author: TRISHLADISH
Reviews.Content: I really recommend this hotel. We were collected by complimentary limo at the airport, which was very welcome after a long journey from London. The rooms were very clean and the staff helpful. There were free drinks on offer each evening and an excellent menu - the food was of a high standard. Two items of laundry done daily really added to an excellent stay. Just off the Orchard Road I think the Quincy is a real find.

Reviews.Title: “Again, another very satisfied visit to the Quincy”
Reviews.Author: DinFrance
Reviews.Content: Second visit to Quincy. Great stopover place for couple of nights to break journeys to/from Australia and Europe. The all-inclusive approach is good. Limo from airport, meals, breakfast, mini-bar, free internet etc etc. The rooms are well equipped and have views over the city (ok just other buildings). Maybe the rooms modest in size but nicely done. Linen and pillows extremely comfortable. Well located for Orchard Road. From the outside, the building probably does not look as sparkling as it used to but this is being incredibly picky. On checking in, I received a hand-written card welcoming me back (after more than two years). In my mind a touch that shows the quality of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, great location.”
Reviews.Author: seb_julian
Reviews.Content: Great little boutique hotel offering great personalized service. When I stayed there the standard package included daily meals of breakfast, lunch, evening cocktail and dinner. Rooms are clean with drinks in room fridge free daily. This hotel is a short walk away from central Orchard Road. And the hotel pool is located on mid-floor of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, hip hotel with fab staff! Seriously!”
Reviews.Author: Bumbi17
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cool as ice! But seriously. It is nicely done, very hip and close to Orchad Road (center street of Singapore). The girls at the reception are nice and very informative. The only hunchback is that they do not really have a place in the rooms where you can store your bags... :) Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stayvacation”
Reviews.Author: SGTraveler2010
Reviews.Content: Spend a holiday weekend in Quincy hotel Everything is provided , even ipod dock and all the possible port for the LCD TV. Excellent gym facility even though it is small. The hotel need access card to even go into the lounge which I kinda like it as it feels more secured.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for short break in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Aussienomad14
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel from the Tripadvisor reviews and had a little trepidation if it all could be so true. We visited in April 2011 for a 3 night pre-cruise visit. Limousine was waiting for us and a very pleasant and quick trip in from Changi. As we were an early arrival (8am) we were offered the opportunity to pay extra for a room available then, or wait until it was ready. We fly overnight so wanted to have a quick look around the area before checking in. Great location off the main Orchard Road area but so close. Very quiet surburban feeling sitting outside near the pond in a lovely outdoor area for coffee or smoking. Rooms were nicely decorated in a modern look but the bed was just lovely as we succumbed to jetlag about 12.30. Reception said our room would be available at 11.30 and right on the dot, they came over and took us up. We had a corner top floor room overlooking the east and the view was spectacular at night, especially when it stormed every afternoon. Did not use the pool but it is a lovely area to read and relax. Having all meals included was great and the range was varied and suitable. A short walk to Orchard Road and transport but out of the noisy bustle. Mosaic glass busts in the reception toilets were really spectacular and the place was kept clean and tidy all the time. Reception on arrival and departure were excellent and we will be staying here again when we come through, and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “A good little hotel and value for money”
Reviews.Author: lynton1
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night. The aiport limo collection was 100% as was check in when it was suggested we take advantage of the last few minutes of the complimentary lunch which was very nice. In fact all the food was pretty good with the head waiter, Chandra, going out of his way to help with requests. The room was small but clean and more than adequate for one night. What the hotel does lack is somewhere to relax apart from the room and pool area - its all a little clinical but there again it does position itself as a cool 'boutique' hotel. They have space outside so perhaps they should extend the hotel a little. The reception people were very helpful at all times with taxis and local information. Those who have not stayed here should understand that the hotel is definitely a 'business' hotel and not the sort of place you will be wanting to lounge around. Its situated in a quiet residential area which is close to public transport and Orchard Road - a 10 minute walk down the hill. All in all we were well looked after and entirely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service was great but not sure about the room”
Reviews.Author: ANAVOA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Quincy recently and when I saw the room, I was surprised at how small it was. Definitely the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in Singapore.You would worry about if someone would hit you with the bathroom door when you are hanging clothing in the wardrobe!! I booked a room and breakfast package through pyo travel website. When we got to the room, the attendant asked us if we wanted to add $30 per day for wireless internet, minibar. I was a little annoyed as I thought wireless internet would at least be included in a hotel like this and didn't think Sin$30 per day was reasonable. Luckily there was 2 mac computers I could use at the lobby. The other thing I was surprised about was the water stains mark around the bath tub (looked a bit like rust) and also there was no exhaust fan in the bathroom. And on my third day, the cleaners took both my bathrobes away so there was no bathrobe to wear at all. Regarding the good points of this hotel.. it is very close to the Orchard MRT.. took us 10 mins to walk there. So it was very convenient for shopping and going out. Secondly service from the receptionists is very good. One night, one of them offered to book a table at a restaurant for me which I was very happy with. Thirdly the bed is very comfortable which helped us with sleep. And the room is very quiet (infact I could not hear any traffic noise at all). Fourthly, the pool area is nice with the sauna, steam facilities and seating area. With breakfast, I think the range of food you can get is rather basic compared to some hotels that I have been to. I wished there was more tropical fruits to choose from. But the chef was nice enough to cook some extra stuff when asked. So overall I think it is a functional place to stay in though the size of the room bothered me most.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: ConAit
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were visiting Singapore for a short stay and after experiencing a flight delay of 12 hours we were very apprehensive about our limo driver being there to meet us. At the airport. We were delighted to find him waiting for us and promptly took us to the Quincy Hotel without a problem. When we arrived at the hotel and checked in we were asked if we would like to have a meal before we went to our room. We were welcomed with courtesy and hospitality, Our trip started a little later than expected, but the service offered by the Quincy Hotel more than made up for the loss of time in Singapore. The meals made available to us were more than we required. When we needed anything from room service, it was brought to our room promptly and the staff were no longer than 5 minutes for what ever we needed. We found the restaurant staff were extremely efficient and made sure that we were adequately looked after every meal and cocktail hour. We can only speak highly of our experience at The Quincy Hotel. Thank you to all the staff for your service and courtesy, it was very appreciated and we would love to make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ritarostan
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasant to stay at this hotel. Spacious rooms with nice furnishings. Staff in this hotel were friendly and helpful .Breakfast was excellent. We could drink tea and coffee for free . Will recommend

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: docgelo
Reviews.Content: From the moment I booked online, I have been emailing staffs of Quincy about my concerns regarding the reservation, airport pick up and details about bringing a child in the hotel room and his hotel meals. And Quincy Hotel people managed to reply promptly to my queries, with utmost courtesy, that gave me superb initial impression of their hotel. Quincy's impeccable customer service was spontaneous and constant. It was apparent from our airport pick up (a friendly Singaporean driver warmly welcomed us and brought us to Quincy), the Filipina staffs on duty at the reception were expectedly friendly (not that I am biased with my fellow countrymen), up to the reception of the wait staff at the dining area; everyone at Quincy made our hotel stay so relaxing and stress-free. Other than outstanding hotel service, facilities and even those Molten Brown toiletries and other little details were not overlooked at Quincy. My family and I love their "all-inclusive-hotel-package" concept. Imagine this : It was our very first time in the history of our vacations that we didn't need to buy bottles of distilled drinking water at a 711 store because Quincy had free flowing supply of distilled water exclusively bottled for the hotel, canned sodas, even beer and spirits available 24/7 at your convenience. They're even sweeter in placing a drinking glass made readily accessible beside a bottle of drinking water at one of the bedside table. AMAZING! Kindly read the rest of our experience complete with photos (tons of it) on my blog about our Quincy experience here --> http://docgelo.wordpress.com/2011/09/03/our-amazing-quincy-experience/

Reviews.Title: “Top marks all round”
Reviews.Author: Mavis25510
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Quincy made a great 5 days in Singapore even better. It's location is perfect for the nearest MRT, Orchard Rd, and other shopping centres. Our room, with its very comfortable king size bed, was quiet, well equipped with complementary mini bar and most importantly, tea making facilities. The room temperature was the best we have known in hotels, where sometimes it is so noisy and/or so cold that it becomes uncomfortable. We took full board which we wouldn't do again as to take full advantage of this service meant that we came back for lunch/dinner. For breakfast, everything was on offer whatever your requirements were. The complementary two pieces of laundry per day per room was very helpful and delivered back the same day. Staff were unfailingly helpful, both at reception and in the dining area. Apart from the fact that we fell in love with Singapore and its friendly people, we can't wait to get back to the Quincy. They treated us so well. It was a really special stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not tired to stay there”
Reviews.Author: Konstantin F
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Quincy repeatedly (at least 6 times) during the last 12 months from 3 to 18 days and I intend to stay there again. As a regular customer I enjoy particular attention from the staff, but I don't believe that less regular customers would have any reason to complain about their friendliness, efficiency and helpful attitude. This applies to the reception staff, the waiters and the houskeeping staff. The rooms are spacious and have all amenities one can wish. The "all-inclusive" formula is very interesting. I appreciated in particular the laundry service during my longer stays. One could wish a larger choice for dinner (if you stay longer than 5 days, the menu becomes repetitive), but the food quality is excellent (both Italian and SE-Asian cuisine). All in all one of the best choices in Singapore for a relatively (for Orchard Road standards) moderate price.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Experience”
Reviews.Author: Unhappy030
Reviews.Content: We are on our last day after meeting friends here this week and we would like to report that it was exactly what we needed after a hectic 3 weeks travelling around Europe. The front desk staff were fantastic, nothing was too much trouble. We loved the food with a slightly different menu each day only negative was the coffee was only warm and the hot water for tea was never hot but apart from that very minor problem. We were most impressed with the impeccable service we received from a staff member named Chandran, he was friendly, curtious, attentive and made sure we always had a drink and that we were very happy. he went out of his way to ensure every need was met whilst in dining area all members of staff were excellent but he stood out as the best. i would definately come and stay again and anyone that wants a rest and not looking for restaurants every day this is the place for you. Regards Sharon and Neil Morrison

Reviews.Title: “Cool, modern and well located at Orchard Road. Great 'all-inclusive' boutique concept but didnt value my trip this time”
Reviews.Author: PandoraSkies
Reviews.Content: On paper, the Quincy is everything a chic city boutique should be, with a dramatic design exterior that is as exciting inside from reception to rooms to restaurant and, based on this alone, I want to sing the Quincy praises. Regrettably, however, my stay was somewhat marred by a poor customer experience but I am confident, based on others feedback during my stay that certainly stood out as the exception to the many other reviews Quincey has received and, albeit bad luck in my case, would appear to be just that. Focussing on the positives (and there were many) from a design perspective, expect the Wow Factor - neon lights, egg chairs, waterfall patio, 12th floor pool and state of the art technology in the rooms - definitely a stand out in a road of more tradtitional hotels and everything the boutique traveller wants to see. Rooms are small by Singapore standards but normal for boutique. Decor is chic and modern and rooms have quirky glass cubed bathrooms that allow you to view the skyline as you take a hot soak and are accessorised with lush Molton Brown products. The monsoon showers are incredibly addictive! 12th floor pool is adequate and chills to a mediterranean vibe after dark and there is a well equipped gym and sauna. Well located on the hub of shopping on Orchard Road you are met with some of the best Gucci and Armani stores globally, more luxe than their NYC 5th avenue counterparts. That said, Singapore is a competitve city for chic hotels, whether large scale or boutique the price point can be similar and unless the all inclusive really works for your personal needs there may be better options elsewhere with equally and higher style that are sure to exceed on service. Quincy distinguishes itself in this compettive space as the first in all inclusive to the boutique hotels but this under delivered for me on this trip (mini bar is soft drinks only and a few snacks, all inc bar is at a time i was heading into town for dinner) so it may not have had the true value for money I expceted or enough to distinguish Quincy over others. travelling in a group tho, this would work well. Again as I was oin a short stay to see the city, flexibility was key and , unlike typical all inclusive offerings you may find in Europe or other cities, Quincy places a restriction to set times for meals which conflicts with the diary of anyone exploring a city like Singapore and there are much better ciulinary options in the trendy Clarke Quay or adventurous China Town. The restaurant is not extensive, but the menu is good, so it can serve for early evening refuelling and still eat late evening elsewhere. The cocktail hour 6-8pm is a nice touch but for short breaks there is a need for caution with sitting times as you may not synchronise for the lunch and/or dinneror breakfast on your arrival and departure days. The all inlcusive extends to mini bar, although the reality is that these are 95% soft drinks and a few snacks. My personal experience was that this wasn't replenished during the course of my weekend stay but I think I had an exceptional hit of misfortune and following my trip the hotel have made an incredible goodwill offer to counteract, which is sure to have me revisit. wifi in rooms is insecure - certificates have expired so you may not be able to access devices, although there are imacs in the lobby. The wifi cited in the airport limo service is not available. Based on style I want to score this hotel better, but based on this stay I cannot justify it, but there is promise and a wealth of good reviews to offer hope for a follow up stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice room but...”
Reviews.Author: EWYH
Reviews.Content: There were hiccups already during check in. Guess they must have thought that I was one of guests with endless requests and questions.. Long story short, i explained I had to pay for my stay that day and had to pay by amex. Card was declined 3 times and instead of finding solutions for me, i had to call amex myself and advise them to try 3 alternate methods.. 1 of which worked. We throughly enjoyed the all inclusive services like the famed minibar, wireless internet, coffee tea and chips in the room. Meals are served on ground floor cafe which had a nice upscale cafe-loke ambience. Dinner was a hit and miss. Our kopitiam style steak and dory fillet was too tough and salty respectively. The cream of chicken soup with foccacia was really nice though! Alcohol was forthcoming, no worries about that. Breakfast was nice, ok variety and fresh. Lunch was spectacular! As we had resolved to ask the waiter for reccomendations and we both had a satisfying nasi goreng which I ended off with soft serve ice cream, earl grey tea and their double choc cookies :) Found the gym very well equipped with the latest technogym stuff. We went for a dip in the pool, it was refreshingly cold but please shower before enterring, whats refreshing for me was hypothermic for my partner :p loved the cushioned pool loungers, read a book and enjoyed the breeze. The steam bath was wonderful too, cooked myself deliciously while he went for the sauna. By the way, parking is available at the Elizabeth hotel just beside. You'll have to walk over from the elizabeth and its free for your stay. All in all it was a relaxing stay. Would probably return.

Reviews.Title: “Poor and worse”
Reviews.Author: Chern
Reviews.Content: Where to start? Maybe the airport pickup, where the driver said he had to go to the toilet and disappeared for 30 minutes after telling me to meet him at "post 9". I waited 30 minutes at post 9 and would still be there but for a kind man who let me use his mobile phone to call the hotel. HE was at a different post 9. Am I supposed to know this?? Ever thought o using the toilet BEFORE you pick up a customer? Room was adequate, very small, but nowhere to put a suitcase, or sit other than the swivel chair at the shelf/desk.. Don't get excited about the all inclusive. You cant check in until afternoon so no lunch, you get breakfast the next morning but of course no lunch since you have to check out before lunch. The 2 free laundry pieces is a scam because you have to have then in by 11 am to get them back the same day but you cant check in until later and you cant put then in on the day you check out off course.. The inclusive dinner was OK but nothing to go out of your way for. The inclusive minibar? Two tiny bags of chips, 2 Carlsburg beers and soft drinks. All in all this is a very mediocre place and you would be just as well off booking a 2 or 3 star hotel and visiting a 7-11 and eating at any number of local restaurants. Will I go back? A resounding no.

Reviews.Title: “good job quincy”
Reviews.Author: yanni0069
Reviews.Content: two thumbs up for quincy - hennessy and ruben both were very attentive, patient, friendly. i love my stay at quincy. its the best experience ever. i have to admit im not the easy guest to attend.

Reviews.Title: “The best all-inclusive experience”
Reviews.Author: globbiztravel
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Singapore and the were great reviewsnon many hotels in the area, of course through trip advisor. Ibtend to like boutique style hotels in certain regions. I decided to stay at the Quincy and how surprised I was about the experience. The hotel is very modern, sleek and clean. The hotel is very secure and requires card key access for most areas of the hotel including the front door. When I heard the hotel was all inclusive I figured there were some aspects not covered. My nightly rate included car pick up from the airport. All meals were included in a dining area on main floor and food was awesome. All mini bar food and drinks were also included and stocked daily. The rooms were excellent and comfortable. I really enjoyed my business trip. The hotel is located inna residential area with other hotels in the area. The hotel is also located close to malls and shopping as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: DamianByMischelle
Reviews.Content: Hip and different vibe from the usual mass market hotels in Singapore and yet a couple of minutes stroll to either Mount E or the Paragon and the rest of the Orchard Rd action. Food is very consistent and staff ever helpful. The half board deal is great for a couple of days if time is tight but otherwise it would be a shame to miss out on the fabulous variety of food on offer within a few hundred metres of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: pngpng
Reviews.Content: Full service and all-inclusive hotel which takes care of most needs. And price is economical even though location is within city area. Love the design of the swimming pool. There was a glitch with the TV and an electric socket, which cannot be solved by the technical staff and we decided to leave it at that.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but everything else was only so-so”
Reviews.Author: Hedonist97
Reviews.Content: Good points: free car pick-up, good location and comfy beds. Bad points: cheap / worn furnishing, free internet doesn't work with my ipad, was given a cigarette smokes filled room after I acknowledged the no-smoking policy (how contradictory!). Overall, not a good value for money - I could have stayed at the Mandarin Oriental... Frankly, I will not be staying there the next time...

Reviews.Title: “All in one package is a great concept”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_73_Sydney
Reviews.Content: We chose this based on other reviews and wanted something all in one as we were using Singapore as a stopover coming back from the UK and heading on to the Maldives. We had the usual concerns, the food will be limited, probably pretty average, the room small, the facilities refurbished but tired. The Quincy completed exceeded our expectations. We utilised the free laundry, internet and of course ate all meals there and the food was delicious, lots of choice. They have done a great job with the refurbishment since they have taken ownership and everything is very polished. While the rooms are not huge by Singaporean standards, they make great use of the space so we didn't feel it was too small. The location is also very central to Orchard Rd shopping and it was easy to get a taxi anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice alternative”
Reviews.Author: ellysian
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in location providing better value accommodation in good locale. No restaurant etc trims the prices. But orchard road is just round the corner so plenty of choice for food options. This hotel offers a very good base in Singapore whether your on business or just on a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: FERU06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quincy hotel for a night while on transit in Singapore. Location is on a hill behind the main shopping street of Singapore, Orchard Road, so you can say it is fairly central generally speaking. The walk to Orchard Road is around 5-8 minutes but is kind of hilly so despite the short distance, it can become kind of dreadful with all the shopping bags under the scorching heat of this great island. So somehow we couldnt decide whether the location was great or not. It was definitely walking distance to the subway and Orchard Road but the walk was not a very easy and smooth one.... Service was ok, they kind of tried to be friendly which is already quite something in Spore where in most places you get fast and efficient service but not a friendly or polite one even in top rated places. We did notice though that the night reception staff were pretty much clueless about dining and entertainement spots in Singapore though. But overall service was fine. The room itself was kind of small but very modern and nicely designed. Mini bar was included in the rate which was cool. The pool on one of the top floors was great and the fact it is open 24 hours was really convenient for those arriving on late flights. The room rate includes all meals but we only tried breakfast which was so so with very limited choice. Anyway unless you are on a tight business schedule who would actually eat his meals in the hotel when you are in Singapore one of the best places for food in the world? Last we also had the same issue mentioned in one of the other reviews, which is the fact some rates are only available for Singaporeans and Singapore residents, so be careful when booking. Overall it wasn t a bad stay but not totally convincing for us. The room was on the small side and well the walk back and forth Orchard Road was actually quite dreadful after a few times the same day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and good value for a classy stay.”
Reviews.Author: beajolley
Reviews.Content: This room was beautiful and we had a free upgrade. The pool is lovely, make sure you check it out. Bathroom was spacious and well appointed, as was the room. A free mini-bar and free meals made this a really great value stay without feeling like a budget place. I would certainly go back. The location is awesome as well, being close enough to Orchard that it's easy to go out and do things but far enough away that you don't feel like you are stuck in a busy city area with lots of noise. Be prepared if you take the MRT for a trek up a hill with your luggage, but it's worth it for the location and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Back and still lovin it...”
Reviews.Author: Dungdang
Reviews.Content: Was back again, this time the prices have risen about 40 % in SinDol, and much more for my situation as the currency has risen against the rupiah. The limousine service this time was not a mercedes benz but a lowly toyota, but still very friendly. I was greeted with some confusion as the girl at recention thought that I had already checked in but a printout of my internet booking cleared up the matter and I was upgraded. Breakfast and Lunch were good value, sadly the airconditioning was not able to get the room temperature below 25 centigrades but that was still bearable. Somehow the envelope where a comb should be was empty but otherwise everything was wonderful. Will be back again, certainly...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, would love to stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: traveling722
Reviews.Content: This hotel was "all-inclusive". The room rate included breakfast, lunch and dinner. The mini-bar in the room was included, also. And, free Wi-Fi! Sounds too good to be true. The rate was extremely reasonable, especially with all of the included meals. The beds were very comfortable. The interior design of the place is very interesting, too!

Reviews.Title: “be careful about price policy”
Reviews.Author: edgarstrotz
Reviews.Content: we booked the hotel during travelling by internet - there is a special package including meals - after booking was confirmed we where contacted by mail that this promotion is only for Singapore residents - we had to accept a higher rate - upon check-in we explained that we would not use all the facilites since our flight was arround midnight - we agreed to pay for both nights at the special rate of $ 288 - upon checking out they charges $ 355 which we did not accept and also did not sign upon check in - after long discussion we had to pay as our lugagge was still in the room - they guys at reception did not feel like trying to keep the the promise - even did not say goddbye and left us waiting for our lugagge for more than 20 minutes - our advice: do not book this hotel they try to get all the money out of your pocket!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..will tell our friends”
Reviews.Author: seb_mangan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days and were very impressed with the location, facilites and staff. Have recommended to colleagues at work (I work for Qantas Airways). Could not fault this hotel. Sebastian and Louise Mangan

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Stay - Very Highly Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Itch-4-Travel
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just come back from a 5 day stay at the Quincy on a girls' trip away to Singapore. I am so pleased to say that the Quincy's glowing reviews were spot on - the Quincy is indeed the 'trendiest' stay on the island! We booked via the Holiday City website (finding it to be slightly cheaper than via the hotel direct). Efficient transfer to the hotel in a late model Mercedes set the positive tone for the rest of our stay. Service from all staff was second-to-none. Our twin share room was faultless - the best sleep I have had in ages (perfect mattress & pillow and gorgeous top-quality bed linen). The rain shower - OMG, what can I say? Worth the stay alone! We used the hotel gym and the pool every day; again top notch, Unlimited bottled water around the hotel, wireless internet, iPod docks, plus free minibar and laundry... great! The room rate includes all meals and we initailly thought we wouldn't eat at the hotel restaurant (other than at breakfast) as we were fully expecting a basic lunch and dinner-time buffet with dried out bain-maries of yesterday's leftovers... Nope - its all a la carte dining - and very very nice food to boot. We ended up having three out of four dinners at the Qunicy, plus a couple of lunches - the menu changes every day. All in all I couldn't fault the Quincy. I have stayed in many hotels all around Singapore and this is by FAR the best value for money. i would highly recommend it and would definately stay at the Quincy again on my next child-free trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A chic hotel in Mt Elizabeth area....”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeSingapore
Reviews.Content: Modern and awesome hotel in Mt Elizabeth area, next to Elizabeth hotel which was a sister hotel. Rooms were always clean and neat. The pool was on the higher floor and it was interesting area to see Singapore taller buildings at night. Breakfast, lunch and dinner were usually included in the room's fare made it a good deal to stay. There were always nice crowd staying at the hotel, young & chic executives. Thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: qishmon
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice breakfast! Probably the only hotel around that provides free breakfast, lunch and dinner around. Unfortunately, we didn't get to try out the lunch and dinner spread. But the breakfast was simple and nice! Bed was comfortable. Rooms were clean, quiet and peaceful! Toiletries were replenish everyday. Swimming pool was small but adequate ! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Quincy fed us well and Customer Service was top notch.”
Reviews.Author: kisetsu
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Quincy to celebrate our anniversary under the Qool weekend promotion (03-05 Jun 11). After comparing the rates of Singapore boutique hotels, we decided that Quincy has the best deal in town. I only made my reservation a week before my stay. By then, through the online booking, there were no more king size bed rooms available. I settled for the 2 single beds but decided to email them if they could help. I got a prompt reply from them a few hours later saying that they will take note. On the website, they mentioned it is a 5mins walk from Orchard MRT station. We exited at Lucky Plaza from Orchard MRT station, turn left and head up Nutmeg Road and turn right walking past Mt Elizabeth Hospital. From there on, it’s a gradual climb and coupled with Singapore hot weather at 3.30pm plus our baggage, our walk slowed to a crawl and we only reached Quincy after 10mins. The reception staff Holly who served me saw that I was drenched in sweat offered me some tissues (very thoughtful). After giving me the room cards, internet login code and a bottle of red wine, I thought the process was done but she actually came out to accompany us to our room and even explained all the equipments and stuff when inside the room. I asked if they do wedding banquets which unfortunately no, but she mentioned they could decorate the room with rose petals upon request. I missed the chance, but it’s good to note that they have such service. Room wise, their design is modern chic and to my surprise, they actually manage to give me the king bed. The full height window commends great city-view even from my 8th floor. Complimentary toiletries and minbar were provided. Abundance of towels were given ranging from different sizes. Bathroom has a bathtub, a rain-shower area and integrated bidet system. Equipments wise – iron & iron board, ipod docking system, broadband internet cable, safe deposit and 40” LCD TV. Level 12 is where the swimming pool, gym and sauna/steam bath are located. They are open 24hrs. There is also a relax corner with sofa and bar counter to laze and enjoy the city view. Beverages and towels were available. The area wasn’t crowded during my stay there but I prefer to have lesser people while using the facilities so I only head there after 10pm. IMO, level 12 isn’t rain-proof and their sofa and day beds were soaking wet during heavy rain. The sofa and day beds covers were quite stained and looked worn, probably due to the exposure elements. Hope they can frequently change the covers. Apart from that, everything looks new including the gym equipments. Breakfast, lunch and dinner were all inclusive during the stay. Breakfast is the buffet type, but there are almost 12 selections of meals for lunch and dinner. The hotel only has one dining area and hence breakfast time is usually packed. Notice people came down at 9.30am for breakfast (ends at 10.30am) and that was when the queue was formed. Try to go down earlier to avoid the crowds as the area is small and tables might not be enough to accommodate a huge influx of people at one go. My stay was very pleasant and definitely the hotel looks 5stars to me. Their customer service was however 6stars. While checking-out, they handed me a staff nomination card. Actually I felt bad to only name 2 persons because the whole team were superb. Quincy has brought my expectation of boutique hotels to another level.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a nice stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: vtrandi
Reviews.Content: Was here for a week for business. Really great Hotel with nice staff. Very attentive, especially in the restaurant!!! Try Laksa Noodles (very spicy for an austrian guy like me) and a must are the desserts like Apple Strudel and Profiteroles! Only thing is, room could be slightly bigger but for a week it is not an issue. Next stay in Singapore - there is only Quincy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: wakejac
Reviews.Content: Was there over the weekend for a birthday weekend escape.Simply love the comfortable bed & the toiletries provided as well as the all in concept. It's a small yet cool place that offers a cozy feeling & lots of privacy.Only tat our room is a bit cold even after temp adjustment and would much prefer to hv a lock for the bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: freechildLondon
Reviews.Content: We loved the all-inclusive formula, price included 3 meals a day, free mini bar, hotel facilities (internet, tv, sauna, gym, swimming pool), two pieces a laundry a day (very useful in hot countries like Singapore), and even a limo service from the airport. Location is central, rooms are clean and we loved the modern and minimalistic design, with a stylish bathroom and big windows on the city. Mattress was a bit too soft, but we did managed to recover the jet lag with a 16h continuous sleep. Staff is extremely friendly. If anything the only minus was the food, it was good but not exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great, convenient hotel with amazing pool”
Reviews.Author: tbfrancis
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fantastic for a stress free and convenient trip. It offers a limo pickup from the airport, free laundry (2 items per day), free food and drinks and has all the ameneties you need (internet, laptop hookup to TV). Great location and even better pool, cantilevered out of the building. Also has good gum, sauna and steam room, all FOC.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ViviCACarvalho
Reviews.Content: Quincy is sure qoool! It is a trendy, new hotel, walking distance from Orchard Road. So, it is very well located. Staff is extremely helpful, specially all the waiters at the restaurant. Thanks to all! It is great value for money, because all meals, the mini-bar, 2 pieces of laundry per day and internet wi-fi are included in the room rate. The meals are great, tasteful and well presented. Loved my stay! I will soon update my blog with pictures: vivinaviagem.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Impressed”
Reviews.Author: LaneBangkok
Reviews.Content: The Quincy's location is a 10-minute walk from the Orchard MRT (subway) and 50 meters behind one of Singapore's most prestigious hospitals, the Mount Elizabeth ("Mount E") Hospital. (No noise at all from this hospital). Situated in a leafy, very upmarket condo area, there is a gradual hill walking UP to the hotel. The room are very well appointed, modern and most of all "new". I was very keen on the service which was smack-cab intelligent and consistent. A Spaniard named Ruben who works at the front desk tripped over himself to answer all of my questions, order taxis, even fix a problem with my iPhone. The only negative was that it was 'full board' meaning when I booked the hotel via Agoda for $200/night, all 3 meals came with it. That in itself was a 'savings' in overpriced Singapore but for the fact that the meals are cooked in Modesto's next door and the selection was limited and tiresome after two nights/3 days at the hotel. I'd stay here again and apart from the food issue am very keen on this joint.

Reviews.Title: “Very Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VRIBEIRO
Reviews.Content: Quincy is a very modern hotel, the rooms are really nice, the pool is beautiful, and the staff very helpful, the restaurant is quite good, and the location is very nice a 5 minutes walk from Orchard Road and all those shoppings.... I haven't noticed on my reservation that all meals were included, which for me did not worth it because i have only had breakfast, but all mini bars were also included very nice. Even liking it next time in Singapore I would try the Marina Bay Sands, but if your purpose of staying is the shopping go for Quincy!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, will go again.”
Reviews.Author: Junior1573
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I chose the Quincy for our staycation over the long weekend and loved it. We went with the weekend promotion including all meals and cocktails with a late checkout (3 PM). After check-in we went upstairs and enjoyed the 12th floor pool for a nice and relaxing afternoon. Later on we went downstairs for some drinks and dinner at the restaurant. Not five star but great for what it was. Then it was upstairs to relax for the rest of the night. Morning included the buffet breakfast which has the usual fare. Nothing special but nice for Singapore. Overall we had a great experience and very helpful and attentive staff. We'll definitely be back and will recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Quincy The Queen”
Reviews.Author: MadMichi
Reviews.Content: Didn't know where I was staying until we finally parked and walked up to the reception to realise it was the Quincy. It was a birthday surprise treat from my other half So I reckon it would alot of work to change my tempo. Room: Huge, spacious. Clean, sleek, class chic. It was a new bouqtiue hotel.As long as there's no sign of old-stains,musty smell,worn-out bed sheets,wiring tv, I'm a happy child. I'm easy to please, but easy to find the slightest roach. Couldn't find any fault perhaps I was busy opening my presents? haha. Not much views, This is orchard road, don't expect orchards, but buildings buildings everywhere in the city. Service: No unpleasant encounter. drinks are always made sure they are filled. I like that. Food/Drink: Breakfast/Dinner plus free flow cocktail 6-8pm. ALL inclusive. you get a choice of decent set menus to choose from for dinner. Drinks, free flow housepour (Famous Grouse is their housepour whisky), wine,beer. This free flow was really highly recommended As we were both heavy drinkers who could easily drink up 1 bar in 1 night. The only cafe/bar//resturant in this hotel overlooks a pretty mini chic fountain to create a romantic ambience with the yellow lights at the courtyard at night. Breakfast had quite a number of hot food selection to cure a hangover. Can't say you really get the most comfortable position eating and sitting in an arty fatsy chair, class and comfy seldom marry together. Even had a bottle of red wine and plate of chocolates waiiting for us in the room afters lights down, not sure if that was paid extra. Gym/pool: small, but self sufficient. Could have been better if the bar is by the pool for the free flow. Smoking. Non smoking building. Cheers and kudos. Location: Perfect, in orchard in town, but still requires a bit of walking down the winding road with broken cements caused by tree roots outgrowing onto the pathment. Singapore weather I still haven't get used to it even after so many years. Parking: The basement next door at Elizabeth Hotel. Free. Price wise? You decide, because was a birthday surprise, so I never know. I recommend this hotel if You want hassle free, all inclusive,all in, all planned, no worries no trouble retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, very modern and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: boiaboiawaga
Reviews.Content: Was in Singapore for a conference and read about the Quincy in the Queensland Sunday Mail. Hotel did not disappoint - extremely clean, very functional and in a great location just out of the hustle and bustle of Orchard Road. When I arrived at the airport I was met by the Limo service and taken direct to the hotel, and upon arrival I was greeted by name, which is a great touch. Check in was prompt, and I was given a familiarisation tour of the room by the check in officer. One slight glitch was the airconditioner (which didn't initially work), but I went out briefly just after I checked in and upon my return it was working perfectly Wireless internet worked fine, and the free beers, soft drink and water in the mini bar are a welcome touch. I used both the pool and the gym, finding the pool quite cool (as are most hotel pools in Singapore, despite the fact that it sits one degree north of the equator!) and the gym equipment the most modern I've seen in a hotel. Much is said in this forum about the food at the Quincy, but I only took advantage of the included breakfast which, although quite simple, was more than adequate for my needs. The "two items of clothing per day" is a great idea, and I used this service during my stay. Clothes are provided to reception in the morning and you receive them back later in the afternoon, ready to wear in the evening. All in all a great stay which has lead me to re-book the Quincy for my next trip to Singapore in May 2011

Reviews.Title: “friendly service, comfortable environment, but in an upmarket YMCA sort of way....”
Reviews.Author: Skyline_88
Reviews.Content: The staff here were uniformly friendly and helpful, particularly with ordering taxis given the difficulty of getting one in this city especially if its raining. Location wise is also pretty good, as noted by many other reviewers. One aspect of the property that I did not appreciate from reading the many (justifiably) good reviews however is that this "boutique hotel" is more in the way of an upmarket YMCA then a luxe hotel. Granted, there is no single universally understood meaning on what a "boutique hotel" delivers, so there is no criticising Quincy for describing themselves as such. Why upmarket YMCA? Well, the sense I get is that the hotel has adopted the business model of stripping away anything that is superfluous to providing a comfortable bedroom for guests, thereby reducing staff and other costs and, to some extent, reflecting the cost savings in the room rate. For instance, there is no restaurant really, just a YMCA style self service type canteen. There is no bar or lounge to relax in. There is hardly a reception area, just a bit of corridor between main door and said canteen. Business centre? Please use the bit at the end of the canteen area that seems to double up as a conference table, or there are two Macs in the corridor by the said canteen. There is laundry but you need to drop them off at reception. As for newspapers in the morning, please pick them up at reception yourself. That said, it has a perfectly functional gym. However, if all these aspects of staying at Quincy sit comfortably with your requirements of a hotel, then its probably a place that will earn your custom.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: sterlingincome
Reviews.Content: Have been meaning to write a review about the Quincy for a while now. We first stayed here about a year and a half ago and I think our last trip was our tenth stay. What initially atttracted us to the Quincy was that everything is all inclusive. We run a small business and need to control cost whithout sacrificing quality. The Quicy offers business people a perfect base to work from and do business in Singapore. The wireless internet works well everywhere in the Hotel and there is a open coffee bar with soft drinks and cookies for during the day if you are working from the hotel. The hotel is a short walk from Orchard Rd yet located on a Cul de Sac so it is very peaceful. Don't go expecting gourmet food options. The food at the Quincy is well prepared and plentiful and conveniant if you don't feel like going out after a hard day of work or sightseeing but is no match for some of the dining delights that await at some of Singapores better restaurants and Hawker centers. Menus rotate but if you stay there after a while you will have seen it all. We tend to eat there about 50% of the time and go out the rest. Cocktails, beer and Wine are included between 6-8pm and they will keep pouring until you ask them to stop. The Hotel Manager Iqbal and assistant manager Kristine are always on hand to help out with any guest requests, the Malaysian waiters Mohan and Chandra (we call them Moet and Chandon) are always very bubbly. The front desk staff include Holly, Leo, Ruben, Jaslynn, Nathan and I am sure I have forgot a few who will always be happy to asist with any requirements we may have. None of the rooms have connecting doors which keeps the disruption from fellow guests and make the Hotel more ideal for business travellers that families with children

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: chedup
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Singapore and decided to pick The Quincy given the very positive reviews people had given on various web sites. I must say The Quincy lived up to every one of those positive reviews. Throughout our stay we received exceptional service from all the staff from Reception, Restaurant staff and cleaning staff. The rooms are fantastic, great views, luxury bathroom (the Molton Brown products were a real treat!), mini bar stocked daily, ipod docking station, free wifi! All these great features in your room really add to a more pleasurable stay! We ate breakfast and dinner in the restaurant, and the food was of high quality. The restaurant staff are exceptional and the service was top notch! Nothing was ever too much trouble! The hotel is in a good location, not far from Orchard Road shopping area, just a short stroll. The gym and pool area is great and open 24 hours, which we made use of, enjoying the pool at midnight, overlooking the delightful city of Singapore. This is a great hotel and would recommend highly to visitors of Singapore! The staff are lovely! Many thanks for such an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Generous atmosphere and Great value!!”
Reviews.Author: Heli_I_L
Reviews.Content: This was the 1st hotel out of the 9 5* hotels during our 24 day holiday in Singapore, Australia and Thailand. Originally we wanted to stay at the Marina Bay Sands which turned out to be fully booked. But we were everything else than disappointed to the 2nd choice of hotel. Sure the food wasn't maybe the highest culinaristic experience ever, but taken into consideration the price of the room, which is quite cheap, and the fact that the food is something extra included to that already low price, I was totally happy with the quality of the food. The room was a tad small, but I didn't mind it when the stay was otherwise so satisfactory, and let's not forget that the room was very tastefully decorated and comfortable other ways. The complimentary limo service was excellent. The rooms have free Internet, which every 5* hotel should offer, but yet so few does. The staff was extremely helpfull, especially the tall european guy. For sporty folks like us the 24/7 open gym and pool (cool pool) was superb. We went swimming after seeing the New Year's fireworks at 2.30 am.. what a way to start the new year!! We had a very late flight on the day of departure and after a busy day of shopping we were offered to spend the last hours before the flight at the spa area, which was very nice considering the fact that we had obviously already checked out of the hotel. The Quincy hotel stayed in our minds all through our trip and we often missed some of the services offered by Quincy in the other hotels during our trip. So over all we have to give very high rating to Quincy. You get great value to your money! We recommend Quincy with warmth!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel just off Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: auntieadriene
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night over the weekend in end March 2011 (Qool weekend promotion - all inclusive of 3 meals) and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Parking: Is a tight car park at neighbouring Elizabeth hotel, but free parking available upon request at the concierge. Check in: Very pleasant and painless. Took no more than 5 minutes. Staff brought us up and showed us around the room which was nice. We were given a slip explaining what was included in the package and meal times, and the wifi user ID and password as well. Lobby area: Small lobby which is linked to the restaurant where the meals are served. Large supply of newspapers and 2 Mac computer terminals for surfing. Lovely landscaping surrounding the lobby and restaurant area which was nice through the floor to high ceiling windows. Room: Very nice size with lovely bay window on the side with electric black out blinds which the staff member demonstrated to us along with operation of the other items in the room. We liked the layout of the room, i felt that it was very well thought out and every space was well utilised without feeling tight or squeezy. We were even offered cables to link our lap top to the tv so we could watch stuff off our computer, or borrow some dvds from the reception. Bed was very comfortable. The toilet had a "open concept" with clear class at the tub area (which was comfortable). We were of course thrilled with the well stocked fridge (2 each of soya bean, chrysanthenum, green tea packets, diet pepsi and pepsi, sprite and beer) and snacks (2 packs of chips and 1 cup noodle) with coffee and tea. Lots of bottled water. TIP: there is "unlimited" stocks of roughly the same drinks and water in the chiller at the pool side. The room was tiled (save for a carpet under the bed) which we would have preferred to be carpetted throughout as it got cold from the aircon especially at night. Gym/ Pool: Gym looks very new and state of the art. Nice fluffy towels and water available. At the pool area, the deck was very nice place to chill out with nice sofas and papers and magazines. The chiller is well stocked with ice cold drinks. We did feel the music was a tad loud though. The pool itself is stunning (especially at night) as it is encased by clear glass all around and "hangs out" of the 12th floor of the building. As it is sheltered, the water is very cold! The construction around the hotel was not very noisy but did affect the enjoyment of the pool. Food: We ate 3 meals which were included. Dinner was nice with mostly pasta choices and some asian fare (About 8 different choices). We liked the soup, salad and free flow ice cream. Lunch was similar to dinner in terms of items but were different. We liked our lunch and dinner meals. Breakfast was something that we felt could be much better. The choices were very limited and food was not appetizing. We especially liked the self serve coffee machines available at all meal times with take away cups available which was a nice touch. Location: Was about a 8 min walk to Paragon shopping centre which was nice as it was off Orchard Road to be quiet and away from the buzz, but close enough to walk to shop and eat etc. Summary: Enjoyed our short staycation and had a good break. We felt it was value for money and would consider staying there again. If the pool could be heated it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “an awesome place to relax.”
Reviews.Author: NaddFedora
Reviews.Content: First,I'd like to to comment on the service staff as they are always the one who gives first impression of the place.they were really friendly and efficient,thus giving us a smooth check in and there was even someone escorting us to the room and then teach us how to use facilities in the room. The room was rather spacious and the concept was rather modernized.very oraganised and the complimentary minibar and wine was something sweet! The 24hr pool/sauna was actually good as some people are too busy in the day for shopping and stuffs to 'explore the hotel facilities'. The all inclusive meals were not bad,but I definitely like the attentiveness of the service staff in the hotel.Complimentary free flow alcohol frm 6-8pm was also good.would definitely recommend friends for a weekend getaway from the busy life of Singapore !

Reviews.Title: “Ultimately good for those who are not interested in eating good Singaporean food that's available outside this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: chezong
Reviews.Content: Okay so I'm keen to write my 2 cents worth on this place. Had high expectations but sadly disappointed on quite a few levels. Free meals included were below average. Steak was overcooked. Happy hour - their choice in wines could be improved. I'm not a wine expert but it tasted super cheap!!! Breakfast had sufficient variety but cooked food was only average in taste. For those who look forward to nice b/fast at hotels - this would prob disappoint. I guess its cos meals are included into price of this hotel. So for those who are not foodies, this concept is great value but execution is generally poor. There really is no such thing as a free (good) meal in this world. And I realised this place is managed by Far East & for those who are familiar - their reputation is to kinda cut corners and generally they're cheap! I was surprised that the toiletries provided from the very high end brand Molten Brown...were really disappointing - extremely poor quality of moisturising lotion (felt cheap) and shampoos also rather crappy. My partner & I were wondering whether this is just a low end hotel range from Molten Brown. If this is a true representation of their actual collection - I am so glad I never bought their stuff - I would feel very ripped off. Good points - thoughtful to provide take away coffee cups for our convenience. Complimentary laundry is a bonus. Beds are comfy. House keeping service has been prompt. Good hotel but not sure I would return. Location a little inconvenient. Think I would use the same $300+ for a room without the free meals at Royal Plaza or Mandarin Meritus. Personal preference :)

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, friendly and central.”
Reviews.Author: Youlittlebooty
Reviews.Content: It was great to walk past the long line of people at the airport waiting for taxis to our limo, then to arrive to our lovely room at The Quincy. The cot for our 10 month old was clean and new. The staff were especially friendly and accommodating, and the meals had at least 2 Singaporean selections. Cocktail hour and the mini bar was a bonus, although it would have been nice to have other alcoholic drinks than just beers in there. The pool area was lovely and we had it to ourselves. It was a short walk to Orchard Road and to a local supermarket. In all, we all had a great stay and would recommend this to anyone. Especially appreciated the non smoking policy.

Reviews.Title: “Functioning rooms - not quite as good i expected for the price and the reviews here”
Reviews.Author: Nikkertti
Reviews.Content: I was here 3 nights on my short stop in Singapore. Hotel is situated near the main shopping-street Orchard road (7mins walk). They have unique business-model for upscale hotel, they offer free airport-pickup and meals during your stay and two laundry items per day. I was greeted nice by friendly man at changi-airport who drove me to the hotel in black mercedes. This was nice touch and immediately made me feel good after long flight. Hotel itself was quite modern and clean and the rooms had all the basic amenities and floor to ceiling windows albeit the view wasn't any special. I tried the free meals during my stay and they were nothing special or worth mentioning. Breakfast was quite limited, not much variety. I also found the restaurant somehow noisy and there was no soothing calmness surrounding the small lobby and the restaurant what you can find in many upscale hotels. I tried the pool and found the water cold as someone has mentioned here before. There were saunas and decent gym on the same floor which seem to be nice. There is also construction going on next to this hotel but i didn't find it noisy or disturbing. Overally my stay was ok but not worth approximately 200e/night which i paid and i think that i stay somewhere else next time. Don't get me wrong, this hotel is nice but i think that i can get better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Ray3149
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Quincy four nights following positive reviews on this site. Feared the build up would lead to disappointment, but no need to fear. Right from the pick up at the airport everything went very smoothly with no nasty surprises. Rooms were of a decent size with nice big shower and separate bath. Much talked about complimentary mini-bar was a nice benefit as was the two-piece per day laundry service. Breakfast was OK, but nothing exceptional with a mix of western and Asian items. Only had lunch once and it was acceptable. We had dinner each night and noticed the menu did change. Dinner was good and service was very efficient. Open bar between 6-8pm offered basic spirits, beer and wine and service was generous and with a smile. The gym was small, but had enough (modern) machines to cope with the number of users. Pool was alright as well and the water was cool as it does not really get much direct sunlight. Location is pretty good only a short walk (5-10 minutes) from main shops on Orchard Road. Would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok, not fantastic, not bad.”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Traveler91
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, a good location if you don't mind a bit of walk to get to anything, otherwise plan on taking taxis. Room was a bit on the small side and I had one of the larger corner rooms. I avoided any of the free meals as it was always so crowded it reminded me of an over occupied airport business class lounge. Overall the hotel is above average, but not good enough that I can give it a very good rating. Wish the room had better lights and though the iPod docking station was nice, I sure wish it had a remote. Hotels in Singapore have gotten very expensive again so overall not bad value for the money. Would I stay here again? Not sure; probably would first want to check out some of the other new similar hotels. Going to say yes to recommend this hotel to a friend, but wish there was a maybe box to check.

Reviews.Title: “warm, friendly service, great pool to relax with no pretension & conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: Ranjini050
Reviews.Content: Quincy is conveniently located for the shopping mecca that is Orchard Road, but also to all main attractions in Singers and is an easy commute to Changi but far enough to have respite from the heady craziness that is Orchard Road. Taxi drivers have no issues finding it, unlike another boutique hotel in Chinatown where I had to give directions to the taxi driver. The staff are friendly, helpful, have a good sense of humour, attended to our needs with that impecible Asian attitutde and manners and with no sense of superiority or snobishness. Breakfast is the usual fare one expects in this part of the world. Bed was very comfortable, shower and bathroom large, with Molton Brown toiletrries provided and the water hot! Room had large windows allowing for plently of natural light to assist in adjusting to time. Building and appliances provided appeared to be well maintained. Some snacks provided with no charge in room. The pool, sauna etc, is exceptionally clean and neat, with ample large soft clean towels, bottled water and deck chairs. I thoroughly enjoyed the 10pm swim taking in the lights of Singers from this semi-open pool. We had one issue when we mentioned to the staff, they apologised, were not defensive and attempted to resolve the issue. One my return trip I had already booked but will be returning to the Quincy. Great value for money. Also appeared to be child friendly. Check in and out quick and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: kodyandko
Reviews.Content: just stayed at the quincy.... cant recommend highly enough. Great staff, great location, rooms were clean, very modern, great size, very comfortable. we loved it. Location is great - short 5 minute walk to Orchard road where the shopping is crazy. Staff were very very helpful. The room reate includes everything, breakfast, lunch and dinner . We will definitely be back... Thank you so much for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: zarkhrov
Reviews.Content: The research a week before Valentines: none other than tripadvisor.com The reservation: online at the hotel website The check-in: a bit later than stated on the website The checkout: a bit more messy than I expected. The stay: 12-13 Feb 2011 weekend The meals: breakfast, lunch and dinner were average. The bathtub: smooth and sexy The shower: strong and steady flow... The wifi: never used. The swim-pool: windy and chilly The steam room: ->|<- The sauna: hot and very humid The bedroom: cool design, had fun playing with the light controls The wardrobe: roomy with a safe and iron The carpark: next door at The Elizabeth Hotel. The location: near to Orchard and yet not noisy. The decor: dark and chic The staff: helpful and professional. The end.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service Awful Food”
Reviews.Author: TdnTan
