Reviews.Content: Apologize for my English. Stay on 24 - 26 Feb 2011 Read the last 1 star is 6 months back, but seems nothing has been done for upgrading especially the restaurant. It may seems fun to have all-in service in a 4 stars hotel, of which you may want to expect an exceptional buffet b'fast lunch and dinner. Had twice b'fast, once b'fast and once dinner. B'fast is common with porridge, dry crispy hash, "charcoal" bacon (burnt), chappati, dal, and cereal with its assortment. For lunch i selected pan fried steak which is super dry and hardly to chew. My dinner worst (attached photo) ravioli with burnt bacon. Waiter is good enough offering to change, no more appetite.They have salad (cannot find during dinner), soups, ice cream and serve-by-yourself coffee and tea. Have red-wine during dinner. Not a wine-drinker, but believe it is quite nice. From airport we have our pick up arranged (free from hotel - one way) with mercedes. Happened to arrive early after 5 hours flight and arrive hotel by 10am. we are told that the hotel is fully booked and have to wait till 2pm coz it is the time to check in. I purposely book from their website (best available rate - of which is SGD433 per night) compare to agoda which charge SGD 304 by time i do the booking) in expectation for early check in. And after requesting and was promised to be informed in 1 hour, we are made to wait for another hour. It was around 13.00 and by time we asked, we were informed that we still have to wait and was informed to book additional one day before to ensure we got the room. I was too tired to argue by then and ask to cancel one night of my stay and was told impossible. After insisting,i was told that they need to consult their assistant manager, of whom came out and ask me to do the cancellation from the internet. By time I was able to get through the internet, it appears that i cannot find my reservation anymore, and in less than 1 minute i was told my room is ready - well how can i find my reservation after it was made check-in? Anyway, i went to my room and found that some maintenance still being done. Hotel location is appx 10 min walk to orchard, free wi-fi (i would say fast), mini bar is for free with mineral water, some box juices, and couple can of soft drink (coke, pepsi, 7up) and 2 beers. Room i have no much to complain except the carpet is only surrounding the bed whilst other area are plain. make sure you have your sandal worn all the time. Toiletries from Molton Brown. Gym is small but decent except change room, sauna, steam is mixed for ladies and gents. Pool are small on 12th floor, bit windy, still acceptable. Unless you are staying full day in hotel, i don't suggest to stay here. This is a non-smoking hotel and make sure you don't ask for early check-in, they won't entertain unless you are willing to pay additional one more night. If you are westener, you may find the staffs are helpful, of which i don't except waiters in restaurant all are great - not the food. I never remember i had any burnt bacon, not to mention in a four stars hotel, even in any hawker center. i am a business traveller 40-50x a year. This in fact is my transit stay (weekend) and usually stay in different hotels, though i have some favourite hotel in China, India and Thailand. This is my first review.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Chic with great all round service!”
Reviews.Author: FahmyEd
Reviews.Content: Before I start, a little intro about myself. I am a young professional residing in Singapore. Doing corporate events for a living and have stayed in multiple 5 star hotels in Singapore for both work and leisure. The last two place i have stayed is Fullerton Hotel and Crowne Plaza Hotel. Stayed at Quincy Hotel, Singapore for a weekend getaway. Before making my reservation, I had a lot of questions regarding their package. I was very pleased to received their great service over the line making me feel like i was already their client. They were professional yet injected some humor into the conversation. Looking at their package and initial service, i was sold! Checking in, I was surprised to be given a bottle of red wine. Complimentary of Quincy as a package. I found out that literally everything is complimentary. In room mini bar and even all my meals there! The room was overlooking orchard road and it was modern chic style. See thru toilet and stylist room setting blew me away. They had iPod dock which was a pleasant surpise. Managed to fill my room with music all night. The have hdmi, usb and many more connection to their flat screen tv. I wished the bed was much more fluffy and have a thicker feather pillows. The facilities was great too. 24h access to the infinity swimming pool was great! Had a dip at 1am and sauna after that. Well i am a late night kinda person! Gym equipment was top of the range. Even higher range models than what is found in Fitness First. In terms of location, getting there is a little troublesome for me. Tugging my luggage from the Orchard Mrt, i realise is not as near as i thought it was. It was a hilly climb to the hotel. Nevertheless its is nearby shopping centre Paragon and Far East Plaza. Would love to return again and perhaps try out the corner room next time. High recommended for couples!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, Excellant, Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: TheOzzies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quincy for 3 days in December and it was a fantastic end to our month long trip around Australasia. From the brilliant efficent limo pick up to the staff waiting to take our bags whem we arrived. As soon as we got in the hotel we were directed to sit and have a drink and relax whilst they checked us in. Once in our room Paulo (who is fantastic and very helpful) showed us the "hidden storage" and how to work everything. The beds were amazing and so comfy. In a drawer in the room we found crisps, noodles, numerous differnt teas, coffee, sugar and all this was replenished every day. The free minibar was a welcome change and the 6 bottles of water a day in it were great. (And yes it really is all included!) However if that was not enough you could go to the pool area and help yourself to a fully stocked fridge of cold soft drinks and more water. We only ate one main meal in the hotel and it was the best steak I had had my whole trip. The breakfast was more than ample catering for all nationalities from chicken porridge to bacon & eggs, curry, to croissants and cold meats to cereal. An extra great touch was the self service coffe machines with takeaway coffe cups incase you wanted breakfast on the run...brilliant. The rooms were brilliant and the bathrooms amazing. There is free internet access in the foyer with apple computers as well. One night about 11pm we informed the front desk we did not think our air conditioning was working properly and within 5 minutes there was a maintenece man in the celing of our room fixing the problem. The service really was fantastic. There is a mall about a 2 minute walk away and Orchard Rd about 5 minutes and it is a very easy walk not taxing at all despite what some revies have said! Wheather we were asking the front desk directions or where to bye aftersun they could not have been more helpful. As I have mentioned Paulo was brilliant and there was another guy who had Trainee on his badge so did not know his name but he too was wonderful. There is no room service (who needs it here with so much to do)but you can take meals back to your room which I did one morning with breakfast. Would I stay again...definatly.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience...”
Reviews.Author: Dungdang
Reviews.Content: Booked per internet with pickup service. Great rooms and quirky service (free minibar). The free three meals were ok, but tasteless, but why complaining as I am a little overweight. Lastly they are a little more expensive, but will certainly be back...

Reviews.Title: “Qooooolest Experience at QUINCY!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanelle05
Reviews.Content: Staying with Quincy is one of the best experience we have! Everything works as described in their offer and it makes you enjoy a worry-free vacation. And not to forget, the people working at Quincy knows exactly their jobs. They care for the Guest/s and they will always serve you with a great smile! You always look forward waking up in the morning for a delightful experience! We have "Qoolest Experience" and We love Quincy! Special thanks to Ms. Henessy, Front Desk for always going the extra mile to provide customer service! We have just referred the hotel to our family member who will be in Singapore by September, hoping that they will also experience the best things offered by the hotel. Till our next return at QUINCY!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: angie8629
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised when I got a free upgrade to deluxe room cos i mentioned in the reservation emails that it's my boyfriend's bday. Checking in is a total breeze that took me less than 5mins. Greeted by a birthday card + chocolate from Quincy. Love the concept of the complimentary mini bar. Room i am staying in is great in terms of size and amenities. Love the Molten Brown toiletries too! Overall, a great experience with Quincy and i would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “not quite funky but enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: thieryb
Reviews.Content: chose this hotel for it's funky positioning as aboutique hotel with everything included mainly very good but not quite the funky experience we thought rooms are small but adequeate and well equipped all - in food and beverage is not really worth the extra - we ate breakfadt in hotel but out for lunch and dinner, cocktails were a glass of wine or beer location just up Cairnhill is good for Orchard rd access

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, and with a personalized touch”
Reviews.Author: skquek
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was very designer-styled. Comes with Molton Brown bathroom products. Food was quite delicious overall. My wife was given a surprise belated birthday card and chocolates from the staff when we came back to our hotel room, and i wasn't the one who planned it! A very personal and wonderful experience at the hotel! The pool on the 12th floor was chilly though..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay but quite tiring to get there”
Reviews.Author: HadiShafie
Reviews.Content: The trip got off to a great start with a nice Limousine pickup at the airport (which included in-car Wi-Fi, no less) and continued on with quick check in from the reception, and a very good in-depth introduction to the room and the amenities offered. The view was nothing to sneeze at but it was a great floor. I wish I had time to check out the Infinity pool. Breakfast, lunch and dinner was included, and this would have been great except that the restaurant located in the lobby was quite full, and the menu selection was a little difficult for me, as there a number of meals that I don't eat - not the hotel's fault. All in all, excellent service and wonderful room, it was just very tiring to get there - orchard road is about 8 minutes walk (by my pace, unless you take the shortcut through another hotel, which was a slightly disconcerting) and it is an uphill walk, so if you're going shopping, this might not be the place for you. However, if you are a business traveller, this would be perfect. Free WiFi, free printing, free food (as in, included into the total price), the Quincy is a great place to stay. Love the feedback too, as they followed up with me even after my stay. If i travel alone next time I will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent services, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: gillesat
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice in this hotel in December for 5 nights, then in January for 2 nights. I discovered Quincy on tripadvisor and after doing some research on both this site and through Accord hotels group which I also trust for its range of quality in relation to the price you want to pay. I booked both stays at "Qool" Quincy hotel. I was very positively surprised by its position (5-min walk from Orchard road), in a very quiet neighbourhood, the very "Qool" design of the hotel, its decoration, and even more by the amenities provided in the rooms, which are what you expect to get from a 4-star hotel. The bathtub (you may even follow your favourite tv program or movie from it, thanks to this ingenious idea of a huge glass window between room and bath. Or close the curtain for more privacy…! ) and a real walk-in shower with all you can think of in bath amenities. The all-inclusive system works very nicely: Breakfast is quite complete and offers a nice range to choose from (cereals, bacon, excellent chicken sausages, greens, croissants and toasted bread, porridge, salty specialities such as noodles or omelettes, even Hindu food, and above all, OHHHH !!! the strange green stuff that turns out to be the local, exquisite KAYA, of which I shall say no more, you just HAVE to taste it !! ) Then you may choose every lunch and dinner between about 10 different main courses + soup + dessert of the day (+ ice cream always available). And all drinks of course (wine, juices, sodas...). Then if you want to relax from your all-day excursion go to the 12th storey where you will relax in the open-air pool (which is in the open-air even protruding outside the building, and I mean it!) or work-out and/or sweat in both steam room and sauna. All the staff from front desk to waiters or housekeepers really enjoy what they do. And when you need them don't hesitate, they are always willing to attend to your needs. They have this outstanding gift to remember and anticipate each and every one of your requests. Very special thanks to Hennessy, Ruben:"el chico de la ciudad de Madrid" I am a tour director and I know what I am talking about when I have to write a report about a hotel or a place. (The hotel was not aware of my capacity until the end of our second stay!!!!). If I could always find this kind of place for my clients at work, my life would be much easier. Gilles & Nikos

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MacStockholm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Qunicy hotel at two occasions. * The rooms have a modern decor, they are clean and well maintained. The planning of the rooms is well planned out in every detail. * We enjoyed the Molton Brown products in the bathroom. * Appreciated the pick-up at the airport! * The food in the restaurant is prepared after order and is very fresh. The dishes are varied at both breakfast and dinner. * At the second stay we received a personal written card that greeted us welcome back - nice gesture! * We forgot one thing in the room and it was quickly received after they sent it home. * The staff is extremely service minded and helpful. * The hotel is centrally situated, 5 minutes from Orchard road where all the shops and big malls.

Reviews.Title: “one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: JMac-Perth
Reviews.Content: Great hotel at a reasonable rate given the all inclusive rate. Location is within walking distance to Orcahrd Road. Rooms are cool, modern and clean; not like the tired rooms that one often comes accross.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional support for stressed medical travelers - stay here”
Reviews.Author: EplusM
Reviews.Content: We came to Singapore for an indefinite stay and some stressful medical evaluation. The Quincy staff was highly supportive - they were flexible regarding reservations and dining hours, offered a great rate, and even provided a hand made get-well card. We were only steps away from our medical appointments at Mount Elizabeth and Paragon. If you are coming to Singapore for medical treatment and want support from your hotel - stay at Quincy.

Reviews.Title: “Charging for early check-in is not cool”
Reviews.Author: conesandbuns
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointed with our stay at this hotel. We had arrived from a long trip from Europe at 9am and were shocked to find that the hotel wanted to charge us for early check-in. We would have been fine with it if this was disclosed during the booking process. After paying for the early check-in, we were disappointed with the room. It was small and the bathroom was dirty. There was mould on the walls and there was pubic hair in the toiletries tray! The air conditioner was also noisy. The overall value is not great, with the 'limousine' transfer really just a Mercedes sedan. And the mini-bar in the room is quite limited. However, I would admit the location is quite good, at the back of Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Oasis in the middle of the Singapore Hustle and Bustle”
Reviews.Author: mhaywardtravel
Reviews.Content: From arrival at the Airport where we were picked up by the Hotel Limousine Service, to our final check out, the five nights we stayed at this hotel were absolutely perfect in every way. Staff are simply the best - service is wonderful and nothing is too much trouble. They treat each guest with respect yet offer friendly advice on anything needed. Restaurant service is excellent, the food good, freshly cooked and always exactly as ordered. The unlimited free booze helps at dinner time, and we made best use of it as often as we could. Rooms are superbly fitted out with every useable extra, fittings are good quality and the bed is one of the best we have ever slept in. Once again room service is exemplary and nothing too much trouble. Swimming Pool, Sauna and Steam Room are also very nice and the Gym is as well fitted as anyone on holiday would need. The management of this Hotel deserve every credit for giving guests great value for money and excellent service. Totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: wingwang1984
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by this hotel. The service was exceptional and we were always greeted with smiles and courtesy. The rooms were clean and modern. The location was convenient and was a mere 5 minutes walk to Orchard Road. What made the hotel exceptional was the all inclusive accommodation package, which includes free airport pick-up service in a Mercedes car, free daily laundry, free internet, free mini-bar, free breakfast, lunch, cocktails, coffee and dinner. It is this attention to detail that I loved. Breakfast is limited in terms of range of foods but the hotel makes up for this deficiency with an excellent lunch and dinner menu. Fantastic place. I will definitely stay in this hotel again when I come back to Singapore. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: aussiebill_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 days at the Quincy in early November. As has been previously mentioned the service is great especialy in the restaurant the guys service and frendliness was outstanding. Rooms modern, clean. All inclusive rate is excellent and great value. Great pool. A short walk to Orchard. We will be back to Singapore and will be staying at the Quincy.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant !!”
Reviews.Author: chris_kidd
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Quincy Singapore with my wife over the New Year period and were very impressed with the overall experience. Rooms are cosy not spacious however we expected this in a small boutique hotel. My wife was ill with the flu and the staff provided asssitance and service above and beyond the call of duty. Nothing was too much trouble. On check out my wife was given a personal get well card from the staff which was a lovely and unexpected surprise. Well done Quincy as you are a stand out hotel which deserves high praise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Isimondidie
Reviews.Content: All in all a wonderful stay. The service was the highlight for me but the rooms were also very clean and spacious, great pool and delicious food to top it off. My only issue would be that they don't provide free wi-fi in the rooms or free internet access in the business centre, besides that it was really great!

Reviews.Title: “A welcome surprise.”
Reviews.Author: benscan
Reviews.Content: My travel agent booked me into the Quincy as The Naumi was fully booked and i was totally impressed. The room was a little small but comfy and the All Inclusive rate for Internet and food and drinks was amazing. At first I didn't trust it and expected to get stung for extra costs on checkout, but then relaxed into it and discovered that they were all included in the room rate. Gym was good and rooftop pool lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in the heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: firmanhadi
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore for the marathon. Was picked up in Changi Airport with a Mercedes limo. Holy, one of the front desk, was waiting in the front when the limo pulled up in front of the lobby. The lobby extends all the way back to become the main dining room. Interior design is cool modern. Room was modern although a bit small. Free minibar replenished daily, which include instant noodle, chips, canned sodas, and two cans of Carlsberg beer. Hotel is about 300m from the bustle of Orchard, so it's very quiet at night. Meals and evening cocktails are included in the price. Menu is acceptable (standard fare such as Sirloin, lasagna, Nasi Goreng, etc.) although not exactly haute cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: grahamew
Reviews.Content: For Singapore residents, ask for the Qool Weekend package - great value includes everything - dinner, breakfast, lunch, minibar, late checkout... excellent for the price,

Reviews.Title: “Boutique in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Peachtreec
Reviews.Content: This is a hip boutique hotel in I thought a great location. Most hotels are located off of a major strip, but here you walk up a hill and nestled amongst local residential towers and houses is this hotel. The staff was very friendly and everything was superb. The free mini bar is also a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.. the all inclusive package will save you money considerably in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandSeafoodlover
Reviews.Content: A great 2 days stay in November 2009. Can not fault the Hotel or its staff. My partner and I stretched the budget a bit and chose the Quincy based on a few photos, trip advisor and great pricing for the all incluse aspect. At around £9 for a beer in Singapore. The free happy hour on drinks was really appreciated. It was an truly amazing hotel! We were immediately impressed with the limo sent and a very friendly and helpful driver. The hotel staff greeted us and continued to treat us with perfect mix of professionalism, genuine kindness and personal service. A special mention to Benni and his banter!! It may have actually have been worth it without all of the added amenities. The breakfast buffet was fresh and good and the dinners we had were also good. The rooms were not the largest but were very well equipped and designed. The beds were heavenly. In fact the most comfortable bed in our whole month long trip. The pool area on the 12th floor was fantastic and private with great views. A really nice experience. We both have a love of modern architecture, interior design and horticulture. So this hotel and its small tropical garden was perfect for us and paired with the excellent staff, was a great choice! If ever we're back in Singapore, this hotel would be without hestation our first choice. Liked — The staff (especially Benni) and the hotel's ethos and ammenities Disliked - Wish we had booked for longer.

Reviews.Title: “The Qoolest Hotel In Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: BostonEsan
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Quincy for a week while on a business trip to Singapore. I travel quite frequently and the Quincy is now one of my favorite hotels worldwide. I prefer to stay at modern boutique properties that don't follow the cookie cutter mold of large chain hotels. The Quincy is just that and they provide almost every amenity to make your stay the best you could possibly imagine. Here is a list of a few and they are ALL included in the room rate: -Complimentary Mercedes E class limousine transfer from the airport -A free and, I'll repeat, FREE minibar replenished daily -Free internet access throughout the hotel so you can do your work poolside on the 12th floor overlooking the city, in the restaurant on the first floor or outside on their patio! -2 pieces of laundry or dry cleaning for free per day, which is a huge plus because it is very expensive for hotels to do your laundry in Singapore -Three complimentary meals a day. That's right breakfast, lunch and dinner!! And the food is excellent. -An incredible open pool on the 12 floor overlooking the city and with a clear glass floor on one end looking 12 floors down! -A great gym with one piece of equipment that was so high tech I didn't know what to do with it ;) -and the list goes on and on and on The staff at the hotel also went out of their way to make sure that I had a fantastic stay. Everyone from the Hotel Manager to the Front Desk Staff was extremely friendly and I want to thank everyone for all of their help and smiles. You can count on me coming back to the Quincy the next time I am in Singapore and I've already referred you to all of my friends and colleagues. Thank you for an EXCELLENT stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Again”
Reviews.Author: bleefloyd
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Quincy last June and was extremely impressed with the room, the staff and the food. When I booked Quincy again I wondered could they do it a second time? I was extremely happy that they not only did as well as in June but BETTER. I had commented in my previous review that Quincy did not have a business channel on their cable television selections. This time I found that they added Bloomburg. While Bloomburg is not my favorite business channel it was great to be able to follow business news. It was amazing to me that someone actually listened and acted positively to a request. The staff was great as before. The food was even better, especially the lasanga. Great location for shopping within walking distance. Definately will stay at Quincy when I go to Singapore in January.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: suitejoe
Reviews.Content: I've been to several hotel in Singapore and by far this is my best stay. Rooms are not big but smart use of space and design plus their high ceiling created a great comfortable space. I personally prefers high ceiling over spacious hotel. Bed are super comfortable with high threads count linen and feather topper. Love the pillows too. LCD TV is huge and the high window adds space and depth to the room. Cosy sitting area by the window is fantastic and once the night falls, discover the sexy lights and reflections in the room and window panels. Very cosmopolitan looking. All amenities are top notch from the molten brown toiletries to the bedroom slipper. The mini bar is free and it comes with lotsa drinks and beer! Even by the pool, soft drinks ad beers are Free! All meals are also included and to my surprise, the food quality is so good that it can put some 5 star hotel to shame. Heard from the front desk that the Qool Cafe is managed by the Modesto. Great crispy bacon during breakfast. Yum. As for the service, they did go all the way to try their best but seems like some foreigner have difficulties communicate in english, especially over the phone. But overall, they did try hard to please the customers. Facilities are average but good enough since there's a small pool (always chilly), sauna, gym, steam room, free internet. Location is good. 5 mins walk to Paragon Orchard but yet on a quiet rd with other condos and residences . Even though I'm a singaporean, Quincy does makes me feel that this is a home made for me, personally. Overall a very good stay and will definitely be back . Thank you Quincy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Monkey56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Quincy for 5 nights in October 2010. The hotel is new and modern. Unfortunately the first room we had was very noisy due to a water pressure issue which kept us up most of the night, however once we advised reception of the issue we were promptly moved and given a nice card and chocolates as an apology. Even though the issue was handled well, I was disappointed that we were given the room in the first place, since I assume the water pressure issue may be an ongoing problem with that particular room. All the staff in the hotel were very friendly and professional. The all inclusive package was great value. Even though we did not get an opportunity to have any lunches and we only had two dinners in the hotel we felt we really got our moneys worth from the airport pick up, the two pieces of laundry each day (fantastic!) and breakfast every morning. The two dinners we had were very tasty and the menu selection was great. The staff in the restaurant area was very friendly and helpful. The pool was great also, for 3 days straight we had the pool to ourselves in the afternoon. I enjoyed the fact you could help yourself to drinks in the fridge at the pool and use all the towels you needed. In regards to the hotel location I think that there have been some inconsistent comments about location in other reviews on trip advisor since that nearly put us off from staying at the Quincy, however, we found the location to be excellent (as tourist, I can’t speak for business travelers). We mainly did sightseeing in Singapore and a little shopping, but we found the convenience of shops and restaurant from the Quincy very handy. The room itself was a good size, loved the electronic shutting blinds and the Molton Brown products – fantastic touch.

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap but very clean and nice (kids said "terrific")”
Reviews.Author: casandlisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and found it very clean and comfortable. The weird pool on the 12th floor was a big hit with the kids. The price includes three meals, which is okay but the food is generic 'international'. Somehow I felt a bit bad being in a place like Singapore and eating cereal and bacon and eggs at a breakfast buffet. The food was okay but not terrific, but the staff were very nice and helpful. Its location is a bit of a walk off Orchard Road (though cutting through the car park of the York Hotel over to Scotts Rd is a lot more convenient than hiking down Mount Elizabeth Road). Another reviewer noted the hike up the hill was hard after being on Orchard Road, but I somehow think folks forking out the sort of money to stay here are probably not averse to splashing some bucks on a short cab trip up the hill. It wasn't cheap, but I have no other experience on Singapore hotel prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly there”
Reviews.Author: WharfTrader
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the GP for a few nights - Slightly nervous about the all inclusive thing, but on the whole its a good concept well executed - Location is excellent, minutes from tons of shops and transport links Check in fast and friendly considering my late arrival - Room was quite nice - reasonable size - Bed comfy with decent pillows (always hard to get right) - Nice TV with plenty of channels - Few nice IT touches for those on business - Wifi included and very fast - bathroom a good size with decent tub - The glass window into the room a nice idea, but practically not great as blind is a bit of a fuss - Nice M&B shampoo etc - And plenty of towels Gym very cool, all new stuff - Pool was great - cool water temp, with a glass window at one overlooking the edge which was quite scary! I only had breakfast there and it was very ordinary - They would only need a few tweaks and it could be very good - unlike others i found the space fine, and the staff pleasant - not sure you want to be tied here for all 3 meals anyways with so many great options in the city (the hotel next door does a great Nasi Goreng btw) There was an issue with the airport collection which left something of a bad taste in the mouth, though to be fair they made a big effort to correct it and i would imagine it was a one off - Always a good sign of a good hotel that when something goes wrong they make the effort to either correct it, or offer something else in lieu - Kudos to the staff Overall i would certainly recommend this hotel as a break from the chains, and given a decent rate i would look to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Krepeth
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of staying at this hotel over the singapore grand prix and I have to say it is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The thing is they get it all right. The all inclusive concept does help but it also gives them more chances to go wrong, but they don't. Friendly staff, modern rooms with everything you could want, three good meals a day and drinks, good gym, good pool and even a transfer from the airport. If I was to nit pick then I would pick on the shower, it had a clear window through to the bedroom which was nice, but it also had the toilet in the bathroom, this meant if you wanted privacy while using the toilet you had to wind down the blind in the bathroom. If the blind had been replaced with one of those windows that can frost with the flick of a switch then it would have been much easier and way Qooler! But I do stress that is about as big as my issues with this place got. We had a fantastic 5 nights there and I would just about go back to Singapore for the Quincy! Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “If you stay anywhere else in Singapore, you're just plain nuts”
Reviews.Author: SukhumvitRoad
Reviews.Content: Best value, best quality. What else do you want? The Quincy's all-in concept is absolutely great in this age of hidden fees and sneaky charges. What's more, the products delivered and first rate. Slick, comfortable rooms; great laundry service; terrific internet connection; and food that's a lot better than you might imagine. I've tried half the hotels in Singapore over the last thirty years. The Quincy is my pick, hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Weekend Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Daphnendamien
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my hubby under the Qool weekend package meant for singaporeans and pr. We were quite impressed by the friendliness of the staff as well as the thoughtfulness of the hotel management in providing things that travellers would need for a short stay. For instance, there were alot of free drinks (beer, soft drinks, packet drinks & mineral water) in the minibar and by the poolside. Travellers who enjoy snacking would also find the free potato chips and cup of instant noodles as "bonuses" which they don' have to buy themselves. We simply love the bed as it is really soft and comfortable; the cosy room with the automated curtains drawn down is really an excellent place for quality sleep especially when one's mind and body have been overworked by the high stress of city life. The spacious bathroom and the comprehensive set of toiletries is another feature that took us by surprise because we never expect to see mouthwash there too. Though some reviews mentioned that the only restaurant at Level 1 failed to provide much variety, we felt that the variety and quality of food there are rather acceptable given the price that we pay for the stay. Lastly, I would strongly encourage travellers to try out the glass-paned swimming pool on Level 12 despite its small size because it was quite an unique experience swimming in a "fish bowl" and lazing around without much disturbances.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - perfect location - new property”
Reviews.Author: travelguyOZ
Reviews.Content: When booking I was hesitant of the concept of having an all-inclusive price (airport transfer, breakfast, dinner, drinks, mini-bar). Working as a buyer of travel services for corporate clients I am usually sceptic of “gimmicks", however, I have to agree that it works and is excellent value. I happen to get sick on the way to Singapore and literally spent 3 days at the Quincy nursing my cold, hence I reeeealy had time to test everything. Room: The rooms are roomy, bright (unobstructed views), modern/hip, very functional, bright, good quality carpet, attractive walls. Bathroom: bathroom with glass wall to living/sleeping are with privacy screen (if needed). Very functional, large shower, good bathroom amenities (shampoo, soap, lotion, etc.), spacious and clean. Pool: Only had a quick look as I was sick but the overhanging glass pool is really nice. Definatly not a lap pool but a nice plase to unwind and have a drink in the evening. Free stuff: - Breakfast: The price at the Quincy includes all you can eat breakfast with a large breakfast buffet and high quality food. - Dinner: is also included and the menu is pretty extensive for an all-inclusive price. I had a steak with potato and vegetable and the steak was perfectly done. - Evening drinks: I was sick and therefore did not have alcohol, however, they do have a full bar to drink you usual mix drink (Gin Toni, Whisky Cola, etc.). It is not a bar with a bar tender but uses the lobby and breakfast/dinner area for evening drinks. - Internet: Free unlimited wireless (or wired) internet is great, especially if you are stuck in your room. Good internet speed. - Mini-bar: I was somewhat hesitant if really everything in the mini-bar was free but it was. There were several cans of soda, water, juice, chips, crackers and some chocolate – all free (not good for any diet). I think there was also some alcohol but not sure anymore. - Airport Transfer: The best after a long flight. It was not some simple car either but rather a town-car designed for single/two people passenger transfer. They even had free wireless internet service in the car – great. I am normally not so enthusiastic about hotel I stay as 5-star properties are our corporate standard, however, this hotel has an excellent location and the all-inclusive pricing makes it an absolute winner.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place!”
Reviews.Author: icook
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place. The service is terific. The rooms, as well as the hotel, are decorated in a modern, clean style. The hotel goes the extra mile to provide every amenity. It has a wonderful gym on the 12th floor along with an endless pool (the pool edge is glass and overlooks the street -- eerie feeling when you swim close to it). There is wireless internet which has excellent connection speed. The restaurant off the lobby is well done. The food is good and and the wait staff is super. The hotel is located near, but far enough back from, Orchard Road to be very close to lots of things.

Reviews.Title: “totally AWE-some”
Reviews.Author: karen-OneManilaGirl
Reviews.Content: from the spanking benz airport pick-up down to the bathroom amenities, the quincy hotel will make you want to stay longer in singapore. the front desk staff (kristine, jaslynn, and everyone!) and the dining staff all go out of their way to accommodate guest requests. there is no language barrier (for english, at least), your food is prepared in an open kitchen which is a very interesting concept (and the food is divine), and the rooms are actually much better in person than the photos. the all-inclusive package becomes the icing on the cake as the view from the outside can sweep you off your feet. and the interiors are even better than some european hotels. the location is amazing and taxi fares to and from the hotel are minimal due to its central location. come for lunch, aside from the tasty entrees, they serve the best chocolate cookies on the planet! the gym, the steam room and sauna, and the pool, no minute is wasted. will definitely come back to singapore and spend my whole stay at the quincy. oh, and the only con? you might want to move in for good! :) thanks quincy!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: daisySwitzerland
Reviews.Content: perfect stay in Singapore. super friendly staff, clean room, beautiful view from room, big bed, free internet (apple) relaxing swimming-pool area, free drinks and decent food. just a 4 minute walk to orchard road and underground. stayed for 3 nights and went back for another 2 nights :-) that should say everything! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Quincy”
Reviews.Author: NZLuxury
Reviews.Content: Cant recommend this place enough, with great staff food and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Ang H
Reviews.Content: What a place, great location, apart from the walk back up the hill with the shopping :) Everyone has already covered what you get in previous posts so I wont repeat. All I can say is that 6 of us (3 rooms) we more than well looked after by everyone. The restaurant staff were great and remember our drinks each day and had a table ready or got one together promptly once we arrived for meals. Loved the pool! Loved the wifi everywhere! Celebrated my birthday whilst there and they had left a lovely cake and bottle of wine to enjoy on our return from our days outing , just beautiful. Would come back in a heartbeat! As i honestly couldnt fault a thing

Reviews.Title: “English understanding = 0, they reserved the cost of accommodation on my personal card instead of the company card”
Reviews.Author: justavisitoryousee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Quincy hotel from July 18 to 23. When I checked in I told the receptionist that my company had paid for the room, and showed her the confirmation number. She told me that it had only been booked, but not paid, and asked for my bank card. After 18 hours of flight, jet-legged, I handed over my card to her, and she reserved SGD 2,000 on it. The next day July 19 I told about this to my company. They gave me a billing authorization with the card number that the deposit should have been put on. Upon my return to the hotel I showed this authorization at the reception, and they confirmed that they had received it earlier that day, and will cancel the deposit on my card. I have checked my bank account each day during my stay at the Quincy, but the amount was still reserved as deposit for the accommodation. After I have asked for the reason of this at the reception desk of the hotel several times, finally they provided a facsimile sheet with the subject Cancellation of Verification. This document states that Quincy authorized my bank to release the amount of the deposit. Back home, after a telephone call to my bank I found out that Quincy reserved this amount until 2 August. Basically this means that the hotel has been/is using my money for 2 weeks, whereas they had the correct card number from my company on which they should put the deposit. This is the worst ever example of customer service, completely unprofessional, unethical, and unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “All inclusive, that really mean all-inclusive”
Reviews.Author: pk_kaufman
Reviews.Content: The first nice surprise is that we were collected at the airport by limo. The second nice surprise is that it is set back from Orchard Road and thus less frenetic and only a 5 minute walk. Brand new (opened end of last year) the concept is one of pay up front and no add-ons ie full board - yes 3 meals AND cocktails included - good buffet breakfast and pretty good quality lunch and dinner (a la carte). of course if you were there for more than 5 days, you could become bored. Beds are great - firm - many pillows, excellent blinds, good lighting, many bathroom bits and pieces eg quality shampoo, large soaps, toothbrushes that can be used more than once, brilliant service. The real kicker is that each room also gets 2 pieces of laundry done free each day - great for trousers or shirts. means you can cut down the amount you bring. The mini-bar is restocked daily at NO cost as well. believe it or not. of course it is mostly beer and mineral water and juices and soft drink, but so what! Free Internet of course, and excellent gym and pool

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with amazing amenities included -- great value”
Reviews.Author: kc75lop
Reviews.Content: I don't do all inclusive packages, but this place is a great deal. All meals included, a free ride from the airport in a Mercedes, free wi-fi, a piece of free laundry done a day, and free happy hour, free mini-bar in your room. Even if you only eat the breakfast, use the wi-fi and drink the happy hour (which is what we did), it's a deal. Food: The breakfast is definitely fairly small buffet style. Don't expect much, but it's enough. Cereals, muffins, eggs, sausages/bacon, coffee, and a few Asian dishes. Lunch and dinner have a menu you can order from with about 10 options. We tried lunch 1 day and it was great. Also note this is the only restaurant in the hotel. Rooms: The hotel is very new and modern. If you don't go for the trendy motif, then this probably isn't your cup of tea. We really enjoyed it. Rooms are definitely on the small side, but all amenities you would need are included. Everything is new and in great shape. Pool/gym: The pool area is different that the usual. It's on the 12th floor so great city views. It's an infinity pool. Not much seating around the pool and the area is covered (although open air to outside) so if you want to sun, there really isn't much. It was great for us to lounge on the lounge chairs and swim without burning up. The gym is small but all new equipment. Service: 5 star Location: We thought it was great. Right off Orchard Rd. Probably a 7 minute walk to get there. We liked that we weren't ON the main strip. It was more peaceful. The road the hotel is on is nice, quiet, tree lined. Very safe. Very convenient. Only con: They charge for early check in which is not convenient when you get off a red eye (like us). We just paid for it, but it adds up. I would definitely go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “a lot of inclusions and a little bit of style”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: The main drawcard for Quincy is it's all-inclusive nature. Having said that, I didn't find it such great value given that there is great, cheap, food on its doorstep all along Orchard Road. We enjoyed the pool, sauna and steam room, but were disappointed to find that hardly any of the rooms looked like the slate one on their website. Check out www.neilsonparc.com for a more detailed review.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I had booked more than one night”
Reviews.Author: janandrob
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and hope to return to Singapore soon to stay here for more than one night.Great location, great service, beautiful room, and wonderful business model. Fabulous place.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Quincy & the staffs”
Reviews.Author: Dalimartha
Reviews.Content: Well, continuing our journey from horrible 1,5 hour at Value Hotel Thomson (maybe you could the review on that hotel) on 4 July 2010 at 10.30AM until 12.00 AM to arrived at Quincy with warm welcome from front office. We stayed there for three nights and all the experience were great. Can you imagine with $378 with those facilities we get 3 meals + free minibar + free local phone + airport pick up by limo + wifi + free 2 pieces of laundry/day + cocktail hour, we think its worth it, compare if we need to stay at Value Hotel Thomson. We made comparison if we were stayed at Value Hotel Thomson instead Quincy, we only paid approx. $200 more for 3 days (For taxi, meals, laundry etc) which I know that's nothing, but the things that we could not compare ware to feel the comfort, coziness & obviously friendly staffs in the hotel. We felt infused by the bedroom, the pillow (goose down) & mattress,it made us slept really really well that night. The staffs, When we arrived Leo and the chinese lady (sorry , forgot you name) helped us our checked in and due its late night there was no porter to bring our suitcases to our room, and you know what Leo brought our suitcases to our room. Impressive ! We were impressed the hospitality by Jesslyn (hope the spelling is correct), Frances, and the waiter Chandri. We know its better if the room is bigger but its acceptable. But for the limo service why is only from Airport to the hotel ? because due we arrive from Value Hotel Thomson by regular taxi so we cant use the facility, maybe in the future Quincy could compensates for take us to the airport using the limo. At this moment based on our experience in Singapore, Quincy is our favorite hotel and will stay there again for sure. Looking forward to stay there again in the near future. Arie & Slerly Dalimartha Indonesia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: bleefloyd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quincy June 23-24. I work in Indonesia and had to travel to Singapore for a new visa. Quincy offered a great room with full board at a great price. Service was excellent. The food, included, was surprisingly very good. Tiger beer during evening hours included was great. Everything went very well for me on this trip. Others (Smokers) who stayed at a different hotel had problems. I would highly recommend this hotel for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it alot”
Reviews.Author: DucatiGirl
Reviews.Content: Staff very professionnal and fiendly. Nice room though quite small. Good food with true Italian cuisine. Internet free of charge in the room. Location: good but maybe hard to access cause of narrow sidewalks.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID - if traveling for leisure and with children!!”
Reviews.Author: satrupa
Reviews.Content: Having done an extensive research about various hotels in Singapore and reading the excellent TA reviews about Quincy, we (3 sisters with spouses + toddlers and our parents) decided on booking ourselves for 5 nights there. We booked 4 rooms thru booking.com (@350 sing dollar/room/night) and requested for the rooms in the same floor. Since we were traveling with kids and my mom is a cancer patient, what was the deciding factor about the hotel was the all inclusive deal. In case the kids or mom were exhausted or in the mood to stay in, the all inclusive service would prove handy. What started off as an ideal hotel choice with the prompt pick up from the airport and smooth check in of the 4 rooms being given on the 14th floor turned into a nightmarish 4 days. Don't be fooled into trying this place with your family. This is an good business hotel PERIOD. Will sum up by with highlighting a few points that all visitors must be aware of while booking Quincy - LOBBY & RESTAURANT - the hotel has a trendy business look but with the tiniest lobby and one narrow passage way that they call a restaurant/coffee shop - all meals are served at this place that cant seat more than 50 ppl at one time and the menu is SAME for breakfast, circulated every 2 days for lunch and dinner - some of the staff members are quite helpful and warm but the staff at the 'restaurant' are rude and obnoxious. Not at all at par with even 3-4 star service standard - the all inclusive deal does not cover children (no matter what age) and the food is BAD. - when we checked in we were told, kids (aged 5, 5 and 3) could eat breakfast but other meals would be a la carte. But every time we sat to eat we were questioned about it by the staff which was humiliating and upsetting to say the least. the front desk had to come and sort it out each time. ROOMS - Beware, the rooms are tiny! there is just enough space around the bed to walk around. No space to keep your luggage if you are staying longer than 4 days - the housekeeping service is pathetic as well. all they did was make the bed and vacuum the area around the bed. they should learn a thing or 2 from other star hotels - the mini bar is limited to 2 beer cans and 4 soft drinks as beverage options and 2 packs of chips as food but is a good value add - the AC in the rooms were not working and we had to call and ask maintenance to come fix it every night LOCATION - the hotel is a min 10 min uphill walk from orchard road and the MRT making it impossible to walk it with kids. - there is a shortcut to the mrt through the 'York Hotel' lobby across the road but can be uncomfortable and embarrassing as you have to walk through some other hotel (and that too is a 10 min walk) - the neighborhood is quiet and ideal for business travelers. you feel odd in the hotel full of business suits when you are in shorts and tee and a holiday mood with kids running around. - if you want to stay at Orchard, there are a dozen other better options that are bang on orchard road. dont pick this hotel if you're coming for a holiday and want quick access to malls, mrt, eating joints. SERVICE - mixed. the senior staff is well trained and warm, the waiting staff is a nightmare. try it to believe it FACILITIES - the pool is a joke if you are used to 5 star pools. its on the 12th floor and not barely 20 mt long and 5 mt wide. since its covered, the water is chilly even on a hot humid day. children are not allowed the pool!! and there is no separate child pool. - the gym is as big or small as the rooms with no instructors or trainers but with quality equipment - the internet access and speed is a big plus plus esp for business travelers - the tv channel options are v limited - there is no bar, eating area barring the lobby coffee shop making the place very prone to claustrophobia if you are a seasoned traveller and have seen high quality service and certain level of standard and are traveling with kids, then you most surely will hate this place. but if you are a business traveller in the city for a night or 2 and are looking for a trendy boutique hotel in a quiet neighborhood with free internet laundry facilities and all inclusive meal package then this place is ideal for you. at the end of the day, I believe I made the wrong choice in picking Quincy over Mandarin, Marriott, Four Seasons or other such options in the same budget. At 250 USD a night, this place is pricey and just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The Crocodile Rock's, just like the Quincy!”
Reviews.Author: London-Phil
Reviews.Content: Whilst Mr Jones was distinctly absent at his namesakes abode, there was however much to croon about when I happened across the little gem that is the Quincy! This was my second visit to Singapore and I was looking forward to my next foray into this ultra urber city. First time around I stayed at the Shangri-La on Orchard Road, Krunthep Wing no less. This hotel is best summarised by fab service, fab facilities and a fab location so consequently, highly recommended! I do however try and not revisit the same hotel over and over again as I believe repeats if any, should really be confined to the TV, life's just too short! Having scoured TA as usual for ideas and suggestions, the Quincy Hotel was chosen as the location, facilities and price all seemed to offer a nice balance and so, how was it I hear you ask... Well dear viewer; pretty good! If your an inveterate page scanner, you can safely leave now assured choosing The Quincy is unlikely to disappoint you. For the rest of you, please read on as the devil's in the detail and I do so enjoy detail... To begin proper, I pre-booked 3 nights directly with the hotel via their website and arrived a little hot and sweaty but on schedule at least. I was greeted at reception by Nat, one of the Service Executive's at the hotel, who confirmed my reservation and duly completed the necessary paperwork. I was then shown to my room and it was then that I discovered there was a slight problem, at least for me. In essence, had I been travelling with a small furry feline friend for company say, then the only swinging that could have occurred would have been on the radio as the room would have simply been too small to accommodate the both of us, truly this gave bijou a new definition! I immediately decided that it was not for me at which point, I turned to the chap who brought me to the room and said, “No, not acceptable, we go!” I then returned to Nat at reception to explain my unhappiness. To further compound matters, whilst discussing room availability I was then informed that due to essential maintenance, the pool was closed (hot and sweaty, remember?), the deep sigh that escaped was one of frustration rather than anger. Unfortunately, the pool facility was one of the deciding factors for me in choosing the Quincy therefore, it wasn't simply a matter of, “oh well, never mind”! Furthermore, as I had personally confirmed the pool facility with the hotel directly, I simply couldn't understand why no attempt was made to inform me prior to my arrival of the change of circumstances. Enter Ruben, Service Executive number 2. Ruben listened and nodded at the appropriate moments, this at least enabled me to properly explain why for me, the current situation was untenable. After some initial confusion, it emerged that the pool's unavailability was not due to planned maintenance as originally suggested by my earlier companion, but was an essential repair which was therefore, unavoidable. What was I to do? The room was actually quite nice but just too small for this single lone traveller even without a cat, I have standards to maintain after all dear viewer! Ruben asked if prehaps a larger room would help to ease my current state of dissatisfaction; “Hmm, it's a start” I replied. After some further discussion, I was eventually shown to Room 0901 by Ruben which was equally pleasant but could now crucially happily accommodate my single case which was no longer relegated and confined to the floor. This still left the pool facility to reconcile even though I now accepted it's loss was unavoidable. I decided to provisionally accept the room and my luggage was duly guided to it's new home in my absence as by this time, I had pottered off for a walk in the rain to ponder my next move. It was late by now and thoughts of moving were as unwelcome as the discovery of the pole-axed pool so whilst out, I made the decision to sleep on it leaving just the two nights to fill, if I had to! I arrived back a little soggy but lighter in mood nonetheless to find a handwritten “I'm Sorry” card from The Q Team and a small soft toy Crocodile (which I still have by my desk as I write this!) on my bed hoping that, “I enjoy my new hotels swimming pool”. Well I never, how unexpected! Such thoughtfulness really was surprising, especially after my honesty, big brownie points here folks, other Hotel's please take note! After a pleasant nights sleep, I concluded that as there were only 2 nights left in Singapore, negotiating with a different hotel would have simply consumed to much time therefore, I would stay for the duration and make the best of it, pool or no pool. As I've rambled on a little, let me try and detail more specifically the strengths and weaknesses of the Quincy, sorry it's taken so long to get to the point...LOL! Location is OK but getting to Orchard Road is kinda convoluted, fastest route walking being through another hotel which may not be too everyone's liking also, if your not a regular walker, then it's best to be aware that you may have problems with the steepness of the local roads, especially in the rain. As I'm sure you already know, The Quincy is an all-inclusive Hotel, meaning that your breakfast, lunch and dinner are included within your room rate. This was a new experience for me and overall worked well but, there are some important considerations to bare in mind. The set meal times are just that, set so deviation is difficult. The Menu is also rather limited and repetitive I believe having spoken to other guests. Overall however, I found it perfectly adequate as indeed were the drinks on offer; i.e. drawn beers rather than bottles, house wine and the necessary soft alternatives although it must be said, service could be inconsistent at times ranging from good to poor. More specifically, as regards the menu, there were also a couple of issues concerning what was and was not possible. Example 1. I asked for an item not on the menu (there's always one I know!), plain potatoes instead of the spicy potato wedges on offer as they simply overpowered the very nice steak I was trying to enjoy. This request was graciously agreed to so, loads more brownie points! Example 2. I then asked for a bottle of red wine with some 20 minutes still remaining in the window for ordering and was denied. After an interesting discussion with the Maître De and unwilling to be thwarted, I offered to pay what was required regardless; not a happy bunny and nothing whatsoever to do with the money! What makes this last example even more confusing and annoying is that when reviewing my final bill, I don't think they actually charged me for the wine in which case, why create such unnecessary bad feeling when there was no reason to? For the record; whilst never previously a fan of the “all-inclusive”, the Quincy came out very respectfully, a little more flexibility would make it even better though, if that's possible with an all-inclusive. Finally as I am not a stranger to Customer Service in my own business, I would specifically like to mention and commend Ruben, whose input I found particularly focused and constructive, so much so that I was minded to show my appreciation in a more practical manner other than this review, my sincere thanks. And thank you for your company. If you do ever make it to Singapore, give the Quincy a go and don't forget to let me know how the pool was, maybe one day I'll return for a quick dip, who knows? Happy travelling. Phil. A London Boy.

Reviews.Title: “Glamour Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavideBali
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel in Singapore, in my opinion. For traveler who doesn't want to spend a fortune, but can get all the facilities in a walking distance to the heart of Orchard Road. The formula all inclusive is very good, even if personally I'd prefer to choose my restaurant outside. Anyway Italian cooking is great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Draconian policies, terrible food, and not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: chiwahwah
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with a lot of expectations. I am a seasoned business traveller and have been to Singapore many times. Have stayed at most 5-star hotels, and decided to stay at a boutique hotel this time for a change. - Draconian penalty for smoking - terrible Food - Limited room service, closes at 10pm - Small room - Pathetic mini bar - TV channels limited - Small pool with limited sun - Nice small gym I was shocked when I was told to sign a statement during check-in that I would be charged one night rate's as a penalty if they found traces of smoking in the room as a "cleaning fee". WHAT? I was not told during booking online, even though I fully understood that this is a non-smoking hotel. If I had, I wouldn't have booked this hotel. What if a friend of mine decided to smoke without my knowledge when I was out? Usually in five -star hotels, all you would get is a friendly reminder about it. I refused to sign it, since I had not been told. When I said I would go to the Hyatt, they said they would charge me a night's penalty for cancelling. The point here is that they didn't inform me about this "extra', and outrageously high cleaning fee during booking, not that I am a chain smoker! they wouldn't let me check in unless I sign that statement. 2 managers came out and finally one of them said it's ok to smoke as long as I didn't burn the room down. Have never heard of any rule like this anywhere in the world. Food is absolutely awful. The breakfast is a meagre buffet, with very few choices of food. Everything that's available is oily and processed and unhealthy. The "omelete" is flat and oily. The bacon is soggy and soft. The cheesse is cheap processed cheese. The coffee, oh the coffee, it "self serviced" - 2 office canteen type machine for you to choose from. I asked for scrambled eggs, and it came back as over-cooked lumps of egg. I dare not try their lunch nor dinner after my first breakfast. They really need to train their kitchen staff. AND room service closes at 10pm??????? the problem is the hotel is a about a 10 minute walk to the nearest 7-Eleven. so after 10pm - good luck if you are hungry. The room is small - definitely NOT a studio. It has space for only one bed, and a small desk right in front of the TV. storage is very limited. The bathroom is super nice though. I got a bigger room with a bath tub. The bed is very comfortable. The unlimited mini-bar: you get 2 cans of beer, pepsi, pepsi light, and some water plus some local juice. Half the channels on my TV didn't work. The Internet is rather fast, compared to other hotels. The Pool... nice pool. small. but it's covered and you won't get any sun until late afternoon. The gym is small but adequate. The steam and sauna is co-ed and never turned on. Honestly speaking, I do not believe this is very good value for money. free wifi, free limo, free laundry and free crap food and mini bar.... I would rather they charge everything separately. Late check in - "oh our hotel is very full today, but if you are willing to pay s$20 per hour, we won't be that full." I am very used to the Asian hospitality style, and this hotel is not even on par with any 4, 5 star hotels. But if you are from Europe or US or Aus, and have not really expereinced Asian service, then you may find this hotel superb. I would not stay here again - and I do not suggest any business traveller to do so either.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bigtop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Quincy for 4 nights 9 June 2010. This hotel is located just around the corner from Orchard Road, behind the Paragon Mall. The Paragon has an excellent choice of restaurants oin the basement level. The hotel as a well equiped gym with 3 running machines, 2 cross trainers, bike and weights. Also a Sauna and Steam room with shower facility. The pool which is located on the 12 floor next to the gym as a very cool deck with LED lights and part of the pool has a glass panel where you can see the ground 12 levels below. In the room you find everything you need, quality toiletries, the minibar is free and contained a couple of beers, soft drinks, water, and juice. Rainwater shower and a separate bath. The black out curtain was motorised and worked much better to the normal curtains you get in other hotels. Meals are included in the room price, we only ate the breakfast because the food is so good in Singapore we were always out and about. The buffet breakfast was same as any big hotel, cold food, hot food, good coffee, pastries, eggs. In the lobby there are free mac stations for use which was handy. But most of all the staff at this hotel were so helpful and friendly. We forgot our phone charger and they were happy to charge our phone every morning. We wanted restaurant recommendations and they looked them up. We needed to get to a friends house and they printed off a map for the taxi driver. I would stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it. This was my first time in a boutique hotel, we always stay in the 5 star big chains, but never again. The service and rooms at the Quincy has made me think twice about the big chains. .

Reviews.Title: “Nothing needed”
Reviews.Author: TimmyTonsil
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and that all inclusive deal was great in the arvo after a long day shopping and sight seeing to have a drink and meal in the lobby was great. Limo pick up at the airport awesome, felt like the super rich. Pool was awesome and staff very kind and obliging

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the city”
Reviews.Author: Julianna30
Reviews.Content: Staff were genuinely friendly and willing to "think like a customer". Room was cozy but not much time spent there so not a problem. Many features built in - ie iron board in the wall, sliding doors, making use of every space. Quality amenities. Quite and welcoming space just 5 minutes from Orchard road. Yes it is an up hill walk but I didn't mind as there was no pressure to go anywhere in a hurry. Cocktails on the house at the end of a busy day of shopping - who could ask for more!? Special thanks to the staff in the restaurant/dining area.

Reviews.Title: “Qool.. Qool.. Qool... Great value and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: DryIze
Reviews.Content: My colleague recommended this hotel to me and I have to thank him for that. Quincy Hotel is a great hotel since they offer lots of complimentary service. It began with the complimentary airport pick up on my arrival which I considered as a great service. The reception's staff was friendly and efficient in handling the check-in. The rate is also inclusive of free breakfast, lunch and dinner. And also free flow of alcohol beverages during afternoon time. However, the variety of the food is limited. The room is modern and has a minimalist design. It is also equipped with complete amenities and free mini bar. Unlike most of the hotels in Singapore, the in-room internet access is free of charge. The gym is equipped with modern equipment even the space is a little bit small. The swimming pool is located right beside the gym and the view is great at night. The hotel is in walking distance to Orchard Road although you will walk slightly uphill on your way back to the hotel. The only downside during my stay was the dining staff was not responsive in removing empty plates on my table. Sometimes I had to remove the empty plate myself. I will definitely stay in this hotel again on my next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “The best value I've experienced. EVER.”
Reviews.Author: ManilaGeorge
Reviews.Content: Quincy Hotel is one of a number of hotels that we enjoy corporate rates. But look - the regular rate of the Quincy Hotel is rate is equal to the corporate rate that we enjoy in another 5-star hotel in Singapore. In other words, the rate comes out cheaper. This is a boutique hotel. Classed 4-star. BUT - everything is 5-star about it. Service, quality of rooms, bathroom amenities, room appointments. EVERYTHING. And for the price, you enjoy: 1. Free laundry or dry cleaning of 2 pcs daily except on day of arrival 2. Complimentary buffet breakfast AND ala carte lunch and dinner (!!!) 3. Free broadband or wifi access anywhere within the hotel 4. Free airport pick up via a Mercedes E limousine 5. FREE MINIBAR (drinks and snacks) replenished daily 6. Gym open 24 hours - with equipment they can brag about Location is perfect. Just a few minutes' walk to Orchard Road (the Paragon and Lucky Plaza are the closest malls). It's in an enclave, so you are away from the crowds or Orchard. Front desk executive Eric is soooo nice. I've been to a whole lot of hotels, 5-star and otherwise. This provides the BEST value ever. I rate it 6-star on value.

Reviews.Title: “nice new hotel”
Reviews.Author: nwolf82
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice new boutique hotel. All inclusive with free breakfast, lunch & minibar. Modern design overall. Free high-speed Internet. Big LCD TV in each room. Cons: Pool & gym are small (nothing else can be expected from hotel of this size). Getting taxi in the morning might be a little problem & most of the taxi drivers do not know this hotel (you have to tell them Elizabeth hotel, which shares the same driveway).

Reviews.Title: “i fell in love with quincy”
Reviews.Author: alvin-aaron
Reviews.Content: i have to thank my partner for choosing the quincy for our first ever trip to singapore. this experience, along with the architectural sights and wonderful city planning of singapore definitely made me want to visit it more in the future. as an architect, i thought the design thru their pictures in their website made me look forward to staying in the hotel. and they did not disappoint. the experience started with an inclusive airport pick-up and it was a much needed transition from the airport to the hotel. we were told that weekends would be much peaceful, considering that the hotel is more of a businessman's hotel (with all meals inclusive in the package). that probably contributed to the much restful stay. staff were courteous (thanks guys), amenities were well maintained...though i just wish they had better (well fit) uniforms for the maintenance staff ;-) the gym and the cantilevered pool with a good view of the singapore skyline are open 24 hours. i would have enjoyed the pool more though if it was heated :-) the rooms were tastefully detailed. good materials and a functional and brilliant design for the closet door which functions as the toilet and bath's door as well (though this may pose as a problem to multiple users). and may i say, the mechanized black out shades was a much appreciated feature. the interior location of the hotel was perfect. you wouldn't say that busy orchard road is nearby which is 5 minutes walk from the hotel. overall, i would recommend it if you don't mind the price.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered!”
Reviews.Author: cherieTCB
Reviews.Content: Excellent reservation system and staff answers email promptly in Queen's English. Modern hotel, prix fix with pick-up from airport (very prompt at 3 AM for us), 3 meals a day, and laundry. Roof top infiniti swimming pool Excellent very gracious service typical in Asia

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Modern Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MaMaisonboutique
Reviews.Content: Room has beautiful view and clean with free mini bar! Food is fantastic and staff is very friendly! The general Manager is very helpful! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “all inclusive is great!”
Reviews.Author: HongKongMarvin
Reviews.Content: i was very happy to get my bill and the tally is exactly what i signed up for... no internet charge, mini bar charge etc. i'm sure you already read about the pool and all that other great stuff. but the "qool" starts to get anoying... and it was a good value when i first started going there 6 months ago... but already the price has gone up enough that expectations should increase... and they are the same. though they have a good formulae, so i hope they stick to it. i'm just bummed i'll lose my value option because of all these great reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Partially Qool”
Reviews.Author: Bodarony
Reviews.Content: Pros: Stylish, good toiletries, food was repetitive but adequate, all inclusive, laundry 2 pieces per day. Location is great. Slight uphill climb from Orchard but should be OK for most people. Cons: 9 day stay but the Pool/Sauna was closed the entire time. Did not get to enjoy this key feature. Furniture in lobby (plastic chairs) really uncomfortable. Staff not overly friendly. Rooms are quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Superbly Managed - One of the better choices in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: eton1970
Reviews.Content: Very well managed property that benefits form excellent location, clever design and a comprehensive package that includes in many cases airport pick up, laundry, web access, 3 meals a day with happy hour thrown in. Staff is well versed regarding sights/event in town. Frances runs an excellent shop with Issy and the entire staff very helpful. Rooms are a bit smallish as is the case with genre of hotel but well designed and efficient. Instead of staying in the same (and rather tired) properties in Singapore, the Quincy was a very pleasant and excellent choice. We will return, and highly recommend for business/pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, Trendy Design”
Reviews.Author: ucdcp
Reviews.Content: Quincy's overall design was very chic and modern, and smart layout made up for the smallness of rooms that some previous reviews criticised-- I will always prefer a well-designed and simple space over tons of room. We weren't in love with Singapore-- but if you have to be in Singapore, then this hotel is really quite nice. A bit pricey, which the hotel justifies by being "all inclusive," an odd concept in an urban location-- why would you want to be at your hotel for all three meals and the cocktail hour, and need the free mini bar (beer only-- no hard liquor. but yes, it's free)? Ironically, one of the slogans is "all inclusive = freedom." I would amend that "having my fifty bucks per day back and being able to choose a few different locations for my cocktails = freedom," but I digress. I'm being a bit harsh-- and there were many business travelers there, who might appreciate the cocktails more than sightseers like me. Pool was pretty sweet, although not five-star clean. Fitness room was good for a hotel that size (smallish) and the sauna and steam room were nice and clean. The staff was helpful and very friendly. Best perk that I've NEVER seen anywhere? 2 free items of dry cleaning / laundry per day. I know I just ranted about the all-inclusive swindle. Maybe I take it all back. The laundry thing won me over.

Reviews.Title: “New Modern Hotel, Qool staff, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Hailua
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there for a week and loved it. The hotel locates in the heart of the city; short walk to everything. Great guest service, friendly and Qool reception staff; I liked the way staff willing to go extra miles to be helpful. The room is so new, clean, comfortable and well decorated. The bathroom is big and has everything you needs. This is one of the newest and the first all inclusive hotel in Singapore offers a wide range of amenities & services that makes it so convenient. It includes free wireless internet, local calls, beers, sodas, water and chips in the minibar which get fill up daily. Free pickup from the airport, 2 pieces of same day dry cleaning service a day, 3 meals a day, and one happy hour all you can drink etc..Plus the pool, fitness room, and spa are all on top floor with beautiful city view and open 24/7. Over all, this is a great value hotel and would strongly recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “I'd like to live here!”
Reviews.Author: suzloua
Reviews.Content: Quincy has all the stylishness and efficiency of a large operation, with the friendliness and thoughtful personal touches of a guesthouse. They have something for everyone - a free airport pickup for those laden down with baggage, free wired and wireless internet for those with business to do (or who just want to catch up on Facebook!), free laundry service for those who need a few things spruced up, free drinks every night between 6-8pm, and three free meals a day for when you want to just relax by the infinity pool, which overlooks the city as well as straight down to the garden below through its glass panel in the floor! True, the food is not exceptional, but it's not half bad either - you won't leave hungry, that's for sure - and while they rotate through the same dishes every few days, there's a decent enough choice that anyone will find something they like. The staff are friendly and helpful, make a point of remembering guests to say hello to, and the location is perfect - less than five minutes' walk from shopping hub Orchard Road, with both the Orchard and Somerset MRT stations another five minutes walk in either direction. The only thing that could be improved upon is perhaps to have a proper bar for guests to socialise outside the restaurant. Other than that, Quincy is perfect for business travellers, couples on a holiday, or a group of friends looking to live it up in Singapore for a few days. I will definitely be returning on my next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Happening”
Reviews.Author: Amanvari
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel even though it does not slot into my standard preference which leans toward boutique lux colonial. Superb service combined with great value for money food spread. Hip and cheeky style from zero to semi-cantilevered pool. Tiny room but well styled. No wall art anywhere; so what ever-is -on-your-TV-is-art...and so it goes on. Take the limo transfer to and from the airport. Try something different, just one caveat contemporary = cramped + funky. ...
