I think this is part of what your experience here is all about:less is more, more or less that is.

Reviews.Title: “great place, friendly staff , good food, great location”
Reviews.Author: Andy&suey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with a friend who had never travelled before, found the room to be very comfortable with all the amenities provided , loved the rooftop pool. the all inclusive portion was also great I found the food to be excellent and enough of a variety to please everyone , it is a boutique hotel - so small in itself and the resturant but I never found it to be overcrowded. The staff were freindly and always gave plenty of warning to the guests when they were about to close down for end of service. The location is perfect as it is only a very short walk to MRT and orchard road but far enough not to be noisy. The all inclusive is great value for singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Only ok, do not go if you are afraid of heights”
Reviews.Author: lizzieGalway_Ireland
Reviews.Content: This hotel has mixed reviews but we had an okay experience there. The staff were helpful, we booked the all inclusive option which was a bad idea, as the food is only okay and Singapore has so much to offer in the culinery area. I am afraid of heights so I did not feel comfortable in the hotel. the location is excellent as you are near the main drag but are also in a very quiet area. The hotel is new and very modern, nearly too techy. They staff are very good and even let us use the gym facilities to shower and change as we had a very late flight. It is fine for a few nights but did not appeal to my tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Quincy”
Reviews.Author: macbrave
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Hilton Hotel Singapore for a few days, I moved over to the Quincy for my short holiday. It was an excellent move. The staff are warm and welcoming. Everything is covered in the cost - room, breakfast, lunch, dinner, minibar, cocktails at 6pm, internet access, laundry (2 items per day), newspaper. It is almost impossible to run up extras and there is no need to find the 7/11 to buy drinks for your room!! The hotel is a short walk to Orchard and Scott. From here, you can shop, go to the movies, eat at hundreds of restaurants and take the metro round the city. The room is bright and clean. Linen and towels are changed every day, minibar replenished every day. Even the blinds are electric so they open from your bedside. There are tea and coffee making facilites in your room but you can always pop down to the restaurant for that mug of latte or capuccino. Be clear that the restaurant offers fairly simple food; the menu, renewed each day comprises some 10 main dishes and limited choice starter and dessert. But when it is all inclusive, I found it well cooked and well presented. If I do want something different for a meal, there are hundreds of restaurants in easy walking distance. This is the best hotel I have stayed in for a long time, and I spend a lot of time away on international assignments. This is a hotel that lays out the cost and doesn't try to squeeze extra costs for everything it does. 'So it does what it says on the tin' . I would whoeheartedly recommend this hotel for location, fun, value for money and comfort. If only I could find equivalent hotels in other major cities of the world like this.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: frozen_fire19
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a night at Quincy Hotel as a weekend getaway aka stay-cation. For S$298 (only available for Singaporeans and PRs) we also had free meals - Buffet breakfast, Set lunch and dinner, late checkout till 3 pm, complimentary minibar, internet and local calls. Quincy Hotel is wonderfully designed, sleek, chic, with lots of black and silver. Interestingly it shares its driveway and carpark with the neighbouring Elizabeth Hotel, same management perhaps, and its main entrance is via access-card only, so that makes it feel more 'exclusive'. Check in (at 2pm) was a breeze. There were Macs with high-speed internet right at the lobby and my partner could easily check his credit card account balance there before paying for the room. Our room was average-sized, on par to other 4/5* hotel rooms we've been to locally. Large king-sized bed with white plushy cushions, a huge flat-screen TV which got my partner very excited, huge windows looking out to the rest of the city.. My partner had no problems setting up his Macbook wireless internet access and PS3 (yes he had brought his PS3!) to the TV. I loved the Molton Brown toiletries, but took a little while to figure out how to work the shower, and got drenched in doing so. The shower has both an overhead 'rain' shower head and a hand-held shower head but I did not notice the former and stepped in fully-clothed and yeah, got drenched with icy cold water. My bad. The hot water supply here is plentiful, and I had a nice steaming hot bath in the bathtub after that silly faux paus. The minibar contains soft drinks and beer and there's a cup of cup noodles and some chips too. Dinner was Risotto for me and Sirloin steak for my partner. There was free flow of house pours, wine and beer too. Food was not bad, nothing to complain about, but nothing to rave about either. Service was very efficient, and our meal was quite a quiet peaceful fuss-free affair. Later that night we headed to the 12th floor where the Gym, Pool, Steam-room and Sauna were. There was nobody there! We made ourselves at home in the Steam-room but it took too long to reach satisfactory steam levels, so we headed to the Sauna which was in local terms, simply "SHIOK!". The pool was beautiful under the night sky, but it was too cold to stay in for long. Had a comfortable sleep but my partner complained that the air-conditioning controls were not working and he had a rough night as a result. He said that the temperature on the control kept on changing, sometimes at 18 degrees, sometimes at 26, when all he wanted was a 22. I can't really comment, because I had slept throughout. :p Oh and by the way Quincy Hotel is a non-smoking hotel. My partner had to travel all the way to the ground floor outside the lobby to have a smoke. That must have been particularly troublesome, especially if you had wanted a smoke in the dead of the night. Breakfast was buffet-style. I had hashbrowns (very cripsy, the way I like it), a big bowl of fruit yoghurt, some cheese, a very good cup of Latte Macchiato, cocoa pops, sausages, etc. Lunch was Seafood Fried Rice for me and Spaghetti Bolognese for my partner. Again, nothing to complain about the meal. The gym is quite wonderful in my opinion. Its chic and sleek, and has a bountiful supply of white fluffy towels and bottled water. The machines are in great condition, and I had a refreshing morning run looking out at the city. A pity no one seems to use the facilities here, because I was the only one in the gym throughout the morning. Orchard Road was a 5-10 minutes walk from the hotel - something that I did not like really because it was drizzling and I was wearing heels. Apart from that, I think my stay at Quincy Hotel has been pretty wonderful. The staff here are warm and friendly and will share a joke with you occasionally. They seem to be know the guests well and even address some by their names.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: petalee
Reviews.Content: Hotel Quincy was perfect for our 2 day stopover. It had everything we needed and I must give praise to the friendly, helpful staff. This hotel is convenient in every way but if you are looking for a lavish marble clad lobby or lush garden pool it is not for you!

Reviews.Title: “Worst reception in the world”
Reviews.Author: cmariab
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at the Quincy on the hotel's own website, put the correct data in, i.e. 1 adult and 1 child, was quoted a price for the all inclusive package, accepted and paid. Unfortunately when I arrived at the Quincy, at 7 am after a long flight from Europe, I was informed at reception that my daughter was not included in the all-inclusive package so I would either have to pay extra for her mels and drinks or eat elsewhere with her. of course niether is an attractive option - eating in 2 places each time and no child portions and overpriced food in the Quincy. Plus, I thought I had book all inclusive ofr both of us. The receptionist claimed - wait for it - that it was open to interpretation!!!!!! Not to me it wasn't - a deal is a deal. Nothing on the website or booking confirmation had indicated that one person was all inclusive and 1 person wasn't. It was bizarre. I do not know if this is a case of a toxic receptionist or if there is a policy of getting reception staff to look for ways of charging guetss for extras, but I have never felt so excluded from a hotel in all my life. The receptionist the claimed that a child was only up to 3 years old! Later, other staff I had to argue with claimed a child was up to 4 years old! Again, who has heard of that? A child is normally up to 11, 12 or 16 but 3 or 4? A baby is up to 1 or 2 so what is a 3 or 4 year old? I finally got my daughter included in the all inclusive but byy now it felt like they were doing me a favour. it is a good thing my daughter is so young she did not understand any of this. Later in the day, I went to eat in the hotel restaurant and the receptionist had ''neglected'' to tell the other hotel staff my daughter was included in the all inclusive package. Again, this confirmed my suspicions about what the hotel claims via booking and what it will deliver once you arrive. So I had to argue my case again with a new set of staff and by this time I was really not happy. Dinner ruined. I would advise anyone thinking of going to the Quincy with children to check with the hotel on what their definition of children is and who is included in the meal plan before booking. i can not understand why a hotel trying to establish itself would lose a customer in the first 5 minutes like this. I would also just go to one of the more established hotels near the Quincy and just go bed and breakfast that way you know where you stand. Cocktails are just vodka, gin or whisky with a mixer. Pool is really cold as it is high up. Quincy is a nicely designed hotel but I really did not enjoy it - see above. Also, early check-in is 140 singapore dollars (half as much again) so that can make your night at the Quincy very expensive, or you wait around until 2 pm! Again, I wonder if the more established hotels are more understanding of the weary traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: SupaSal
Reviews.Content: A surprize stay here for my birthday was amazing, the little quirks and the pool overlooking the city are what make it, although I dont know about price I do know everything is included in your stay which is a great idea. Location is great but bring your credit card, the shopping is the up there with the best in the world, felt like I was inside Vogue with the amount of designer stores... and the food in Singapore is amazing -although the hotel food is good its not amazing I suggest getting out there!

Reviews.Title: “Quincy”
Reviews.Author: PhilippeA1
Reviews.Content: Fancy hotel, well situated, near Orchard Road. Friendly service and nice room.

Reviews.Title: “stunning, swithched on and savvy”
Reviews.Author: travelingaussie0
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this new boutique hotel for a short city break on the way home to Australia. What a find! Cool, friendly, trendy and spot on the money- rate includes arrival transfer , 2 pieces of dry cleaning ,3 meals and happy hour every day. As well as complimentary mini bar, free wi -fi, a good gym and a stunning pool (cantilevered out on the 12th floor).Rooms are stunning and equipped with all the mod cons. Best of all is the staff and special mention must be made of Francis who introduced us to the property and treated us like friends throughout our stay. Would not hesitate to return when next flying through Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “The Quincy Hotel makes the all-inclusive concept work in every respect”
Reviews.Author: HermesEssex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights at Quincy, which as an all-inclusive hotel is unusual in Singapore. We found they really made the concept work by offering contemporary and comfortable accomodation combined with a varied selection of meal choices and excellent service. The rooms were spacious and well-equipped, and we particularly liked the dry-cleaning service of one garment per person per day whch was included. All staff were friendly and very helpful, and I should make special mention of Bennie and the restaurant team for whom nothing was too much trouble. They were happy to improvise the meals to suit our taste, and prepared a packed breakfast for us on the morning we left as it was earlier than the restaurant was open. There were hot and cold drinks and snacks available throughout the day. The hotel is also only a few minutes walk from the centre of Orchard Road shopping area. This was a great choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all my expectations. Modern boutique gem right behind Orchard Rd.”
Reviews.Author: SYDtoAKL
Reviews.Content: Ended up booking 3 nights in Singapore as the end to a month long whirlwind tour of SE Asia. Along the way we stayed in some pretty amazing hotels...Peninsula in Bangkok, Langham Place in Hong Kong, Grand Hyatt in Guanzhou. But Quincy Singapore was the best surprise of all. We booked a package deal through expedia that included mercedes transfer from the airport, all meals, evening cocktails, mini bar and internet for about $220 USD. What we didn't expect was the most gracious service (including 2 pieces of laundry per night) and good food. Who goes to Singapore for free food? Singapore is the capitol of delicious, diverse fare. But the lobby restaurant changed their menu daily and cooked a la carte dinners to order. The staff were amazingly friendly, helpful and cooperative. Traveling with a 2 year old and a 4 month old has been challenging, but the staff at the Quincy made it so easy - from arranging the cots promptly, to supplying us with milk so that we would not have to walk to the nearest 7 eleven, to making the rambunctious toddler laugh. The hotel is conveniently located up a short hill from Orchard road (right behind Paragon and Takashimaya) but the street is quiet and tree lined. The lobby has 2 mac desktops for you to use while waiting for a taxi. Concierge exceedingly helpful printing maps, timetables, etc Rooms are modern, clean, cheerful with Moulton Brown products. The pool is cool, important for Singapore's year round heat, and cantilevered on the 12th floor. The bottom of a portion of the pool is glass and you can see street level underwater.....very trippy and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Full Service Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrPeters
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quincy Hotel in January 2010 for 2 nights. We were picked up from the airport in the hotel vehicle. The hotel is just a short 5 minute walk Orchard Road and the Paragaon Shopping Centre. Check in was very efficient. We arrived late at night and we were just in time to grab a meal from the restaurant. Dinner was very good with a choice of 6-8 main items. The rooms were okay for our needs. We had a view looking towards Far East Plaza. Great fitness centre and the pool is amazing. All amenties from mini bar including water, beer and soft drinks included in daily price. All meals were also included in the daily price. We were provided with a great selection of local and international foods for lunch and dinner. The waiters are very helpful. This was a great place to stay. It is completly different from other places in Singapore. The full service concept is a great idea. We will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The Quincy got the details right.”
Reviews.Author: FrankWeho
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The modern rooms (neither particularly small nor large) are perfectly laid out with many terrific design and convenience features---like a glass bathroom with separate shower, super comfy bed, great sheets, lots of outlets above the desk for your gear, sophisticated built in lighting, nice finishes, good soundproofing, electric shades, many more. The all inclusive plan (airport pick up, minibar, laundry, three meals, happy hour drinks) is refreshing. The 12th floor glass pool is beyond cool. I’m sure the Quincy is getting room rates well below their budget—it’s a great value for a place of this quality. Location is 5 minutes walk to Orchard Road (shopping central) and 10 minutes walk to the subway. And taxi’s are cheap.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect start for our 5 weeks Asian Pacific Trip”
Reviews.Author: rlas_10
Reviews.Content: Excelent start from the airport with the limosin Very nice room with a view Very friendly and helpfull staf A good ALL IN concept Just a smitch from the CIty away A Place to remebber and to go back to

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quirky design...is 'all inclusive for you?'”
Reviews.Author: ZippyLondon
Reviews.Content: We were staying at The Goodwood Park hotel but decided to defect to the Quincy as it seemed more like the style we like. The hotel is a cool urban-chic type property and is in a good location - five minutes (uphill) from Orchard Road. Free limo service: We were not able to benefit from the 'free' limo service as it is from the airport only and it was not possible to use the offer the other way (wonder how the limo gets back to the airport!). The room: As has been mentioned; the rooms are on the 'tight' size but have been cleverly designed with loads of mirrors and light so it works well. The bathroom is a good size and includes a bath and shower (with great pressure). Molton Brown toiletries always very welcome!. The pool: Once you've found it (12th floor - no indication in lift) it's very cool if a little scary if you are scared of heights. The perrfect place to chill for an hour or so. Gym: Well laid out with decent equipment. Free Mini-bar: Now, if you are expecting a European style mini-bar, think again. It's stocked with some weird (and possibly wonderful) stuff that you won't have come across before. IMO, the only 'useful' stuf was the TWO beers and I gave the soya drinks and stuff a miss. All-Inclusive aspect: A/I does not mean free; you've paid for it so don't think it's a gift. If you are there for a couple of days then it's OK but when in Singapore, I'd rather eat locally. It was OK but the breakfast was a bit disappointing with nasty OJ. Free Broadband: GREAT! Singapore was a 'mare for internet and it felt distinctly 1990's. Free laundy service: It's per day so get yours in on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! This place is amazing (and so Qool)”
Reviews.Author: barbarawalshtravel
Reviews.Content: Although we are both quite well traveled, this has been the most impressive, modern and well presented establishment we have discovered so far. Quincy is unique in Singapore as the only "all inclusive" hotel in the city. This means that all meals, limousine pick-up from the airport or cruise centre, minibar, high speed internet, 2 items per day laundry service, beautifully equipped gymnasium and even a 2-hour cocktail period each evening are included in the one very reasonable charge. Not only that, but the friendliness of all of the staff of the hotel is unbelievable. This willingness to please and help at all levels reflects very well on the management of the hotel. An example of this willingness to do just a little more was in evidence this morning when a lady at breakfast had mobility problems, so the waiting staff went to the buffet on her behalf and assembled her breakfast for her so that she could remain in her chair. We also love the Quirky messages locate around the hotel that just add that little extra enjoyment for anyone staying here.

Reviews.Title: “good location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Winter_of_Germany
Reviews.Content: We was stay in this hotel for 2 nights, hotel room are clean and beautyful. That the fist hotel we feel most clean on the world. Staff very pro and allway help us. We hightly recommend this hotel who wnat to stay in this location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice concept, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Alias34632
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quincy for one night on a short stop between the Seychelles and a trip continuation to Tokyo. We had booked a room based on the good TripAdvisor reviews and ended up pretty happy about our stay. In general, the "all inclusive" proved very comfortable. No thought to give, all is in: we were picked up by a very friendly limo driver at the airport and transported through the city. During the trip we got a first glance of Singapore with some explanations from the driver and a free map to go around later. Arriving to the hotel, we were checked in a very professional (but a little bit cold?) manner. Early check-in was unfortunately only possible against an extra 100 SGD. Not really willing to go for the extra, we dropped our luggage and started our city tour. We returned around 2 PM and were shown to our room by a very friendly concierge who chatted with us on the way up, asked whether we needed any help with tour arrangements (he offered to look up transport schedules to the zoo for us) and later introduced all aspects of the "package": included meals, mini-bars, 2 pcs of laundry, cocktail hour, swimming pool, gym, etc. A word of caution though: Unfortunately the transport schedule for the zoo was incorrect, and taking the shuttle bus to the zoo is anyway a really bad idea unless you are on a very tight budget. The bus took about 1 hour, since it picked up guest from loads of hotels before actually going to the zoo itself. The bus costs 4 dollars per person, and a taxi cost us less than 20 dollars and took only 20 minutes! The room itself was nice and modern, having both a rain shower and a bathtub, some good amenities and a very comfy mattress - we slept like in heaven. After a short rest, back to town and shopping, which was quick as the location is ideal for shopping: 5 minutes down the road brings you to Palagon, one of the shopping centers on Orchard Road. We also had breakfast, lunch and dinner at the hotel, which was convenient. Opening hours are quite extensive (6:30-10:00 for breakfast, 11:30-14:30 for lunch, 18:30-22:00 for dinner). Food was decent, not really Michelin-style but good solid dishes (lots of Italian style pasta dishes, burgers, etc) of reasonable teanure. For drinks, you can pick between an outstanding buffet of fresh fruit juices, a vast choice of soft drinks and some wines (or liquor in the evening from 6 to 8 PM). We liked our meals but I can understand the other comments mentioning that you can get bored of the food or worry for your cholesterol if you stay there a longer period. Summary: Like's: all inclusive concept, excellent rooms and bedding, friendly concierge, beautiful pool with glass walls overlooking the city, stylish design inside the hotel Dislike's: the extra charge for early check-in Overall, I'd definitely recommend the Quincy and would not hesitate to get back on a next trip to Singapore (amazing shopping location...!!!). If we had known how nice Singapore actually was, we would have stayed a few more nights instead of just a short stop over. The zoo and night safari were great, and the shopping was the best we have ever seen. Quite cheap and so much choice.

Reviews.Title: “OMG... inspiring boutique stay...”
Reviews.Author: Ecuatoriana
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Singapore a number of times, but this was the best yet. We were booked for just one night, but within minutes of checking in I changed our flights and we stayed for 2! On the con side first: the rooms are on the Tokyo side of compact - but the bed is very comfy and the design is so clever and inspiring. Plus the views are great. They also forgot to send the included airport pick-up, but they reimbursed a cab and sincerely apologised. On the positive: the all inclusive rate is fantastic value for a stop over -made the days so easy. The food was simple but delicious, the service very friendly and efficient, and the eating area is a great space to sit and chill out, surf the internet etc. The location right near Orchard Rd is perfect for shopping, wandering around, movies and catching the MRT. We used the amazing pool one afternoon, you can swim right along the glass edge 12 stories high. Great little gym with spectacular views. We had a corner room which was slightly bigger. The bathroom is beautifully designed with Molton Brown toiletries. For a 2 night, 3 day stay in Singapore, we really enjoyed the Quincy. Thanks to the very friendly staff there.

Reviews.Title: “Great for short visits.”
Reviews.Author: agent_bx
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Singapore for the first time with wife on Holiday/Business and stayed 4 days at the Quincy. We travel a fair bit but this was the first boutique all inclusive hotel we stayed at. I really wanted to 'love' the Quincy experience.The hotel itself is very new, funky, modern and functional for a personalized service due to the relatively small number of rooms. A beautiful and unique pool to swim mid afternoon as the sun is setting. The Service at the hotel by the office and room service was exceptional, and 5 star...except for the restaurant staff. If you consider that for the Quincy to provide good value for money in Singapore one does need to have about 2 meals at the hotel, then one would spend the most time with the restaurant staff... yet for some reason it appears that the hotel decided it wasn't important to hire staff with smiles. Having just arrived from The Hilton in Kuala Lumpur for 5 days, I can say that there the Quincy restaurant staff was far below subpar in comparison. The range of foods is much better than school canteen food as other reviewers have said, and indeed not all oily - with a healthy mix of fruit and vegetables. But if you're looking for a gastronomic tour of Singapore you wouldn't stay at the hotel for every meal of your 4 day stay, which in a long winded way gets me to my point; this is a great hotel for single travelers or couples, on short stays, and will only provide value for money if you eat at the restaurant for most of the meals on your stay. I stayed here with my wife (tick), for 4 days (cross), and didn't eat at the hotel much due to strict closing times/restaurant staff/tasty food options elsewhere (cross).

Reviews.Title: “Great Concept, Good Location but the food...........”
Reviews.Author: CBGL2008
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a welcoming Reception with very pleasant, helpful staff. We were escorted to our room which was more than adequate for our needs. We went on a little trip to Orchard Road which looked fantastic in the run up to Christmas. It was a bit of trek back up the hill to the hotel but it was good exercise. We put our shopping in the room and then it was time to enjoy the food and drink as part of the all inclusive package and that's where the trouble started, the wine was passable but the food was a nightmare!! If you like everything with a tonne of grease then eat here!! Most dishes were cooked beyond all recognition and everything tasted pretty much the same, the chef really needs to be replaced. The choice of breakfast was limited but just about passable The room was ok with enough space for our shopping, the bed was VERY comfortable, bathroom well stacked with a great shower. 1 beer each for 2 people was a bit stingy as was the waiter refusing to allow us to take a glass of wine to our room after dinner. The pool was closed during our visit but they made that very clear before we booked. Despite the dreadful food I would still recommend The Quincy for the rooms and staff but please, do your cholesterol levels a favour and eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Best Hotel yet”
Reviews.Author: Nigel69
Reviews.Content: I stay in many hotels in the world and finally someone has come up with a concept that covers what most travellers require. Superb service, food during the day, lunch and dinner are included at this hotel. Drinks in the evening until 8pm Internet access a standard. Even some washing included each day. All for what most would consider a standard price. I was very impressed with this hotel. It is criminal they are not No 1 on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Esboare
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, beautiful new building and all inclusive. Situated in very nice area close to Orchad Road. We really enjoyed our stay. Better than most of the 5star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great all inclusive idea”
Reviews.Author: Alex044
Reviews.Content: Nice small rooms, little inexperienced staff but very helpful and good value for money. Walking distance (5min) to orchard street and extremely nice airport pick-up service, with mercedes very comfy. Very small gym...but ok if you are there early.

Reviews.Title: “Spoil Your Senses”
Reviews.Author: cjre
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy being spoilt and love modern surroundings and earthy tones with a touch of style and class then this is the Hotel for you. Rooms are very clean and spacious with all the modern comforts of home, the bonus for me was the spacious bubble bath with Multon Brown products, they have thought of everthing! Have your taste buds tantilized with a variety of meals to choose from their lunch and dinner menus and enjoy a leisurely buffet breakfast with a cup of freshly brewed coffee to start of your day. Free internet access so you can keep up to date with those never ending emails and you will love the swimming pool with a glass bottom viewing panel on the 12 floor and for those fitness fantatics they have the state of the art gym equipment and enjoy a relaxing sauna after a busy day of sightseeing or shopping plus so much more. Staff are fantastic, very helpful and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Close to Orchard Road and the main shopping centres a womens dream. I look forward to coming back again soon, thank you Quincy Hotel for making my holiday experience enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Singapore - cool vibe and great location”
Reviews.Author: gavster
Reviews.Content: I came across the Quincy Hotel simply because my usual stay (the St Regis) was full, and I was pleasantly surprised. I have to admit that despite the great reviews and nice website, I had pretty low expectations of the all-inclusive concept but boy was I surprised. I was greeted by a friendly driver with a brand new Mercedes to pick me up from the airport. The staff greeting me at the front desk were friendly and efficient, and the room was a good size with great TV, free internet and a nice bathroom with Molton Brown amenities. Now sure, the catering wasn't the St Regis, but equally it was good basic fare and to be honest I actually preferred it! It was a much more relaxed place to stay, although for some reason having to drop my laundry off at the front desk each morning rather than have someone pick it up was the only thing that I didn't like! The gym, swimming pool and steam room were excellent with a lovely deck area to sit on and brand new gym equipment. All in all this place is fantastic value and I won't hesitate to stay there again. The location is great if you want to be near Orchard Rd without being right on there - it was actually nice being just a couple of minutes up the road and away from it all. Well done Quincy team - you've got a great thing going!

Reviews.Title: “Generally, A Mixed Basket but Nevertheless Quite Good...”
Reviews.Author: Chris J
Reviews.Content: I only volunteer to review on Tripadvisor when the property is truly deserving ( As my folks admonish: if you have nothing nice to say...just keep it to yourself) With Quincy, its a mixed basket but nevertheless a good property. An enjoyable spiffy brand new property beside Elizabeth Hotel, walking distance in a quiet & leafy area on Orchard (behind Paragon, expect a slight up-hill stroll) Due to some mix-up, we hauled ourselves in a cabby (with a nice chatty driver, who told us the Philippines, or a part of our country was under Martial law... not exactly something you want to hear coming in from Bali) so can't say much, nor rave, about any airport pick-up limousine or anything (here's the point of my disappointment, no apologies or reimbursements only justification yada,yada,yada,etc...). Its a design hotel (read:meaning service can be sketchy hehehe...we were given a higher floor room, very smart and compact design with Molton Brown toiletries though I think the toilets need an exhaust of sort, teehee) with a considerate though sometimes antiseptic staff (props to the warm Holly though), with an all inclusive bent (the only time I've been on all inclusive packages are the stays in El Nido Palawan or Club Paradise) with meals (food was quite tasty, for me), laundry, mini bar and 2 pcs of laundry/per room. Overall, a tad disappointed (since the property came in highly regarded by friends of mine & too bad we came from the heavenly Ayana Resort in Bali) but hope to give them another chance I guess. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “It's like having your own home in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Blair9
Reviews.Content: Quite simply, if you are not staying at the Quincy Hotel when you are in Singapore, you are probably not smart enough to be travelling in a foreign country. Seriously, this is the most amazing place. Booked three days in advance as we traveled with our son (23) from Penang, Malaysia, we picked the Quincy because TripAdvisor mentioned a limo from the airport and free breakfast. Wrong! How about free limo, free breakfast, free lunch, free dinner, free 2 hour evening cocktails (any liquor, not just beer), 2 items of clothing cleaned (perfectly) each day for free, and free mini bar! Complimentary newspaper and free Internet service complete the package. When nearly the entire staff greeted us at the door, we knew this was special. From then on Reuben and Frances and the entire team of desk staff and servers and chefs and managers went out of their way to make us welcome. The hotel is a five minute walk to Orchard Rd., so you get all the incredible shopping with none of the noise. Reuben helped us on so many decisions; when to go to the zoo, which restaurants would be best, shopping suggestions, and even remembering to offer us an umbrella on a day when a torrential downpour made us glad we had it. Frances and all the other managers were equally helpful and made our stay wonderful. The price is fantastic for the service and amenities. Though the room is not a suite like you might find at Raffles, it is roomy with a great shower. Take a tour of Raffles and stay at Quincy. This is a very special place and will make your stay in Singapore the best ever.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and value”
Reviews.Author: thewiseoldowl
Reviews.Content: The service in Singapore is usually good but at the Quincy it is outstanding, all staff at all times. This linked to the value in the inclusive package of meals, drinks, laundry, free internet and airport pickup means this will be my regular hotel in Singapore from now on. It is unfair to select out staff when all are good but Izzy who solved my computor problems and Mathan who provided inobtrusive but outstanding service in the dining room stay in my memory. It is in a quiet but handy location, 5 minutes walk to Orchard Road. Rooms are small but well appointed and comfortable. Ideal for me. Meals are good but not outstanding, basically Western cuisine. For entertaining business guests for evening meal I can go to larger hotel buffets such as Oscar's or Carousel. One thing that would be good from business aspect would be a lounge or room where I could have client meetings but perhaps that could be available next door at Elizabeth Hotel which I understand is under identical ownership.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money - there are better meals, better rooms and better locations to be had for less cash”
Reviews.Author: ianfly
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read some of the other reviews here before I booked - I would have gone someplace else. The all inclusive resort in the city idea sounds like fun - but the reality is that inadequate facilities and second rate catering make it more like a university conference centre than a fun resort experience. Rooms - while branded as a studio they are in fact a SMALL hotel room. Decent TV and the bathroom has quality toiletries, but otherwise nothing special. Very limited storage. As noted in another review - the free minibar is missing most of the usual hotel minibar treats. What was there could be picked up at a 7-eleven for a few dollars. Gym - a couple of basic machines and some light weights plus treadmillls. The pool was closed (without warning) which left the one interesting feature of the hotel - its 12th floor pool out of bounds. Meals - a TOTAL DISAPPOINTMENT. At dinner the appetizer was soup...... no choice.... a main dish of pasta looked like school cafeteria food - no vegetables or salad available with it. Dessert of fruit salad continued the cafeteria theme. Invite a guest to share that meal and hand over $38++ for the privilege. Drinks - was silly enough to arrive for dinner at 8.05pm and received a brief lecture on being there before 8 to get a glass of wine included. Just cannot see the value in this place - you can find better hotels, bigger rooms, and better food for a whole lot less money.

Reviews.Title: “Quincy is my choice - I am coming back!”
Reviews.Author: JustMeInSingapore
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 weeks in Singapore at Quincy. The staff were very friendly, and they went to great lengths to make my stay enjoyable. The rooms are great, I had a great view from my window, the utilities in my room were tip top - TV, kettle, shower, bath - can I live here please?! Within 5 minutes I could be in Orchard - the famous shopping street. Taxis could be booked from the hotel, the MRT (underground) is 10 minutes away so transportation was no problem. My colleague stayed in Pan Pacific. We viewed each others hotel and both came to the conclusion that Quincy really is - The Best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wrong Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kermadek
Reviews.Content: Most likely I will be in the minority, but I was hugely disappointed in my stay at the Quincy hotel. Firstly, planing a 3 days trip to Singapore, we were trying to make our choice between the executive floor of the Hilton Singapore, PanPacific Orchard, Swissotel Merchant Court, Intercontinental Singapore or in Quincy Hotel. All of them are in same price basket and we just tried to find just better service. Wrong list! The level of service of Quincy is not even remotely close to standard of Hilton or Intercontinental or any other reputable international chain! And they are too huge and too understaffed to provide any personal touch as it supposed to be in “boutique hotel” (as they proclaimed itself) The advertised concept of “all inclusive” is also very confusing. Normally, most of us do not consider a collection of soy milk cans and other cheap soft drinks as a standard mini-bar. There is absolutely no alcohol in “free minibar”! Not a big deal for us by itself, just a disappointment. The inclusive breakfast was a disappointment as well – the selection of food is very limited. Dinner and lunch were not much better – the same garnish for all dishes and piece of fish or meat. Evening cocktail consist of three drinks – wine “white or red?” and “beer”. It’s just shame to offer such food in city with great culinary reputation The most problematic area was a size of the room – never in my life I stayed in such small rooms. They are small, and I mean it! And there is defiantly something wrong with plumbing – the noise in the pipes is close to the level to working vacuum cleaner. The staff are polite but rather inattentive. Even finding a taxi could be a problematic. And the waiting staff in restaurant probably the most unsmiling waiting staff I ever seen. So, if you are like us, and thinking about choosing Quincy or , say Hilton, select Hilton, Intercontinental or something else with tradition and standard of providing good service to the Guests.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Overhyped”
Reviews.Author: gary052
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for those who like the all inclusive concept. The rooms a modern with some nice design features,but the plumbing is very noisey,so hope the room next door doesnt like an early shower!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Quincy”
Reviews.Author: chetz
Reviews.Content: Having looked at countless hotels prior to booking we were totally satisfied with our stay at Quincy.It was interesting to read the previous review,taken from the business angle I presume,and compare it with the others and our own opinion.Is the formatting of the TV and lack of HD a deal breaker?If you have flown 12 hours to land at Changi the sight of a gentleman bearing your name on a card and holding the keys to an air conditioned Merc is akin to a cool towel round the back of the neck!!...For those of us starting holidays which take us in leaps and bounds across asia we have factored in the cost of the hotel, the availability of choice as to whether you have one,two or three meals and the luxury of that limousine welcome...who wants to wander outside with multiple cases and crush them into the back of a (generally) undersized toyota? OK,whinge over...Quincy was great,loved the room,pool location and vista brilliant, funky foyer/restaurant area especially at night,staff attentive and amenable. Food was great,and here again, arriving at the hotel at 7.00pm,dump the cases and coming downstairs...who wants to be bothering about where to go to eat...have that first meal in relaxed,welcoming surroundings. As it is,the Quincy is ideally placed for access onto Orchard road.A mere 150 yard walk downhill takes you to the back of PARAGON shopping mall,and a walk through this puts you right in the middle of Orchard street itself...brilliant at night and at christmas better than any oxford street!! If Ihave one pointer for management and visitor it is that Quincy is very new (jan or feb of 2009) and of the taxi drivers we used only 1 out of 6 knew the hotel or name,we had to identify its location by naming the hotel next door!! with something like 14,000 taxis in singapore the hotel wll take time to become fixed into their brains..SO.. please give ALL visitors a taxi card with hotel and address prominently displayed as part of the check in process. We give Quincy five stars for a Quality experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: AnYanXuan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quincy hotel last month for my birthday celebration. Generally, it was a good experience, nothing spectacular. The room was comfortable and the amenities provided were of good quality. The bathroom was rather small though, but for this price, it was already a good bargain. All meals were included in our package! The mini-bar was stocked to its brim, and everthing was free! However, during our lunch on the second day, the staff at the restaurant were rather rowdy. There were only a few people having their lunch at that time, so they were quite unoccupied. The kitchen staff were talking and laughing so loudly until somebody from the front desk had to come and tell them to keep their volume down. They toned down though, but the whole incident just spoilt the peaceful and comfortable enviroment. All in all, this hotel offers a really good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Staff and Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: NatalieInAustralia
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with the Quincy Hotel. The staff were always happy, smiling and always very helpful. I had a comfortable and pleasant stay here. Why would anyone NOT take advantage of the 2 piece complimentary laundry daily? Or the mini bar x2 Beers, x6 soft drinks and a selection of refreshing flavoured teas and soy milk! Or the fantastic breakfast, lunch and dinners on offer?? Or The happy hour? Or free internet usage? I loved the fresh roti and the spicy dhal curry I had for breakfast! That was to die for! For lunch I recommend trying the Nasi goreng...yum. Now, I only wished I stayed long enough to go through and try the whole lunch and dinner menu. Dinner I would suggest the steak, cooked to perfection! Had the tiramisu for dessert and that was delish... ohh! and the creamy seafood chowder was better than anything I had in Sanfrancisco... You have to try it.... I really want to go back and do it all again. I have already recommended the Quincy to all of my friends wanting to stay in Singapore! I had a wonderful and comfortable stay. I used the gym and the pool nearly every day and both gym & pool were exceptional clean and well maintained. The bed, sheets and pillows were crisp clean and luxuriously cosy. The room was perfect for two people and very stylish and modern. Everything was re-stocked daily. Laundry always came back perfect. Room was always clean and bed made very well. Well done Quincy - Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed -- I was expecting much more from a business oriented hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tetsuos
Reviews.Content: I made my booking for the Quincy at the last minute. Initially, the hotel's online booking engine was not working, so I tried contact by email. After a few hours, the web engine was restored, and I made my booking directly. Just after booking through the web, I received a reply to my email with an offer for S$10 less. Too late. Too bad. The limo pick-up idea is nice, but pointless. Singapore has excellent public transportation options including: MRT (subway), bus, taxi, and limo, all available on demand at the airport. Taking the hotel limo required a special call to the hotel to confirm my flight details (more than 48 hours in advance), arriving at the airport and hunting for the limo driver (since there are multiple exits from the baggage claim area), then following him downstairs and waiting ~10 minutes for him to bring his car over (in Terminal 1). I could have just walked straight out of baggage claim directly into one of the waiting limos and paid ~S$35 without any waiting required. Why doesn't Quincy just provide the limo as an option and reduce their hotel rate? It's silly to pay for some guy to stand at the airport with a sign when there are plenty of the same cars waiting for on demand passengers. I arrived at the hotel to discover that the pool was under maintenance and not available. Too bad, since that's a showcase item at the hotel. In fact, not only was the pool under maintenance, but so was my room. The closet light didn't work, and an access panel was open on the ceiling. The air conditioning was permanently set to "freeze," so my only option was to completely switch off the fan if I didn't want blue fingers. The room layout is decent, and the decoration is suitably modern, but the size of the room is tiny for Singapore standards. Clearly the window through to the bathroom was included to make the room feel bigger without actually occupying more space. The toilet flush capacity in my room was very limited. Both the small and big flush buttons resulted in the same amount of water being released from the tank into the bowl. The shower (like nearly all showers in Singapore hotels) is poorly designed from the perspective of water leakage and usability. The door swings either in or out, and it's almost impossible to stand inside the shower and swing the door due to the limited space available. Swinging the door out results in covering half the bathroom floor with water. The shower has a funky amenities shelf that is virtually useless for holding the supplied mini bottles of Molton Brown shampoo/conditioner/etc.. The shelf is more like a flat grating that has been bent into a U-shape, but because the bottom is not solid, the bottles can't stand up straight and end up falling on the floor. The (small) rainshower is nice, but the water spray doesn't work well at distributing the water over a large area. Due to the limited space, only one person could reasonably use the bathroom at a time. Minor issues, but these are things that should have been noticed when designing and building the rooms. The hotel room's TV is wide screen, but since none of the channels offered on the hotel TV system are HD or 16:9 format, all the images are stretched. Why aren't any Singapore hotels offering HD? Singtel and Starhub both have HD channels now. If they aren't doing HD, there could at least be an option on the remote control to change the aspect ratio of the screen to 4:3 so everything doesn't look squashed/fat. I didn't bother with the included dinner or drinks. The hotel's website and staff seem to make a big deal out of the "all inclusive" package, but I just don't get it. If this hotel is targeted at business travelers, why offer those meals? I always have business lunches and dinners when I travel, and I rarely have time to take advantage of cocktails at the hotel. The all inclusive aspect of the hotel is not much more than a typical club or executive floor gets you at a larger hotel, and since everyone at the Quincy is essentially on the "club floor" it loses the privacy and exclusivity that is typical of such floors. Yes, the minibar is included, but this is quite typical in Singapore, and the minibar is actually no better than a drink machine in the hallway (no snacks/candy/liquor). Breakfast was O-K. Honestly, I wasn't impressed. Nothing is available to order, and there was no coffee offered. I had to go hunt for a mug and use the coffee machine myself to pour a cup. The fresh fruit selection truly failed for Singapore. There were apples and some old papaya. Besides all those points, which are things I have learned to live with at other hotels, the clincher came at the end of my stay. When I arrived at the hotel, I told the manager who showed me to my room that this was my first stay at Quincy, since I normally stay at the Naumi hotel, but they were fully booked this time. I indicated that I was giving this place a try as a possible venue for our company during CommunicAsia (a big expo in the summer every year). This was a not so subtle hint that I expected things to go well during my one night stay. Unfortunately, I doubt this was communicated to anyone else, or if it was, they just didn't care. After my breakfast, I had a 10:30 AM meeting. I also had a 12:30 PM meeting/lunch. My flight out of Singapore was at 4:30 PM. I could: (a) shave and go to my first meeting then return to the hotel around 2:00 PM to pack and check out, or (b) no shave but pack everything and get out of the hotel ASAP. I called the front desk to request a late checkout at 2:30 PM. After some deliberation with a computer or person, the front desk told me that they could give me the late checkout, but I would have to pay a late checkout charge. I explained that I could not accept a late checkout charge due to company policy, so that wouldn't work for me, and I asked why they needed to charge me. The clerk informed me that because the hotel was very full over the weekend, they needed the rooms back earlier for new guests. Think about that for a minute. Why would paying a late checkout fee have anything to do with making room for other guests? How would me paying a late checkout fee create a new room for the people arriving later? This was just a poor excuse to try to extract more money from me. After I explained my situation (I needed to go to a meeting now, and I didn't have time to pack everything) and schedule to the clerk, she told me that I could keep the room until 1 PM. Obviously, if I was having a meeting at 12:30 PM, keeping the room only until 1 PM would be useless. She then asked if I needed the room or just a shower. Hello? Was I talking to a wall? Here I am, a first time guest who normally stays at other hotels in Singapore. I'm a business traveler, and many frequent business travelers need late checkouts. I expected better from a new hotel trying to attract more customers. This attitude to try to extract more money from a new guest asking for a late checkout without paying any attention to my situation was very poor form. I won't be staying at the Quincy again, and neither will my colleagues. I will gladly go back to the Naumi (a much smaller boutique hotel with only suites and much more personal service). Quincy staff: I hope you take note of these comments and make some improvements -- gimmicks and newness only last for so long, and I didn't see much besides that during my short stay at your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location & value for money”
Reviews.Author: akeuma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Qunicy for a week with a young child. The staff at the hotel was very welcoming and friendly, and the full board really suited us. Location was great as it was about 5-10mins walk from orchard road. The rooms are of decent size and clean. Happy hour everyday from 6p.m to 8p.m. The food was ok although the menu was quite repetitive. Overall, it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect....The secret is out (Everything you need to know Review)”
Reviews.Author: gringoAustralia
Reviews.Content: Well....The Quincy Hotel - Where do I begin? We like to think of ourselves as well travelled. We usually travel overseas 2 to 3 times per year and have stayed at countless Luxury hotels - None however like this gem. I will not try and double up on the countless positive (and accurate) reviews on here, rather give some more precise info to help you in your Choice. Firstly let me say the reason for our trip was our Honeymoon, so finding something special was important. Thanks to my research on Trip Advisor the Quincy was just that. We arrived into SIN at Midnight and were met by our well dressed complimentary Limo driver who shook my hand and congratulated us on our wedding. Whilst en-route to our hotel (and giving us a very informative narration along the way) he contacted the hotel to inform them of our arrival. When we pulled up, staff were waiting at the door (1am mind you) to give us a warm welcome. After a fast, friendly check in, we were escorted to our room. Our Room....where do I begin. BEAUTIFUL. IMMACUALTE & MODERN. Too much to say but a nice size, comfy bed and all the mod cons of a 5 star hotel (even though this isn't)...and yes FREE MINI BAR. Now the mini bar is a small fridge consisting of juice, soft drinks and beer (no spirits) but hey...how many hotels provide this for free? Toiletries provided were top shelf and replenished every day. The GYM. As regular gym nuts the equipment was high quality. 3 x New Gym quality Treadmills with LCD TV screens. Exercise bikes and Elliptical machines, new gym quality weights and weight stations...everything you need for a quality workout - overlooking the... MAGNIFICENT POOL....amazing. Located on the 12 floor this pool really does 'jet out' from the building. The walls are glass so the view of the city (even underwater) amazing - even more special at night...and as expected immaculately clean. The Sauna and Steam rooms also clean and both function well. My only negatives for this area (hey this is an unbiased review) - you have to turn on Sauna/Steam when u want to use (approx 30 mins warm up...but I understand reasons why) - Music in the gym would be nice (a little too quiet) - Area is unsupervised which is no problem, but the only phone on floor (in case of emergency) is not working. DOWNSTAIRS DINING AND HAPPY HOUR. I will start with the ‘Happy hour’ 6 – 8 pm every night. FREE…that’s right FREE drinks. Have to say, someone needs to teach the staff how to pour drinks. Bennie and the guys really do serve it up. Firstly, the beer. Tiger Beer on tap served in a Chilled glass (or jug if thirsty). Spirits – hmmm this is where they need to learn (and I mean this in a good way). Normally when you ask for a drink (especially when free) you would think they would be a ‘little tight’ on the serving size. These guys serve the biggest pours (glass is over half full of scotch / vodka etc). You add your own free mixer. These are the STONGEST drinks I have had…amazing. Red and white wine is Italian and is quite nice. I was expecting the service to be a little slow to limit drinking, but was pleasantly surprised at the speed and friendliness of staff. WELL DONE GUYS. BREAKFAST – unlike some buffet Breakfast’s the menu is changed daily. Food was excellent and good selection. Eggs cooked to order also available. I am a very fussy coffee drinker, but the coffee beans and machine used does make one great Espresso. LUNCH & DINNER – Now we purposely avoided the free meals here for the sole reason we wanted to get out and have the Local Food. We had a late checkout (1800 hrs) which I will add was complimentary due to our honeymoon. Due to the time, management offered us Dinner and Drinks before departure which we gladly accepted (rather than airline food). Again the Lunch and Dinner menu’s are changed daily. I am so glad we did not eat here until the last day. The food was absolutely DELICIOUS. Had we’ve eaten here on the first night we would not have left the hotel. I had the Mee Goreng – which was as good as any I have had. More importantly, my wife felt like a steak and chose the Sirloin. Now, being Australian we are spoilt for quality beef and have high expectations. My wife’s steak was THE BEST she had ever eaten, cooked to perfection. Beware – don’t eat dinner here too early in your trip or you will be hooked. Yes…all your meals are FREE. STAFF – what can I say…exceptional. It would be so hard and unfair to single out any one staff member. I am not sure whether the fact we were honeymooners made a difference – all guests seemed to receive the same service. EXTRA’S – 2 free pieces of Laundry per day. Internet free and no problems with the connection. The only thing the hotel lacks is room service (which is probably why not 5 star). Having said that, room service was not high on our list (never is) but if it is a priority then you would be Stupid to overlook this hotel for that reason. CONCLUSION – We truly had an exceptional honeymoon thanks to this amazing property. I am concerned (like many) that we may not be able to return once the popularity of the Quincy increases. From a selfish point of view, I hope it doesn’t. I found this property thanks to Trip Advisor. I have been disappointed so many times before with Hotels in Singapore (more expensive too). The Quincy will always get my business. Regards Paul & Natalie

Reviews.Title: “Qoolest place you could stay. Just love to use their marketing Q....”
Reviews.Author: JohnR_Vic
Reviews.Content: Very friendly place to stay. The international welcome call to ensure the Mecedes pickup would be from the right place, to the informative driver, the lovely welcoming staff are all part of the Quincy Quality of service. All in provisioning, meals, minibar, wifi, and laundry. Many other hoteliers can learn from this experience. The restaurant folk, of Bennie, Ravi, Miathan and Chandra are all so friendly and helpful. The meals were of good quality. Our three days and nights were restful indeed. Love to be back soon. The rooms aren't large, but well eQuipped, all the TV screen inputs you could wish for the the front, power points for chargers or your laptop. A/c thermostat where you can read it. Not the only place we have stayed in Singapore, but great value, service and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Qool Hotel (as you say at the Quincy...Qool!)”
Reviews.Author: smithy78Brisbane
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel and even better service!! Great rooms, great price - fabulous extras!!! Would definitely stay there again when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “No surprises, 100% perfect”
Reviews.Author: spruiked
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel: * Great location right in the middle of the Orchard Road shopping district and minutes walk from Mt Elizabeth hospital and the Paragon, a great shopping centre. * Fantastic friendly staff. * Great wifi -- which is included in the room rate! * Very nice food -- again included in the room rate!! * Very nice room design. The best thing about this hotel is its consistency. Everything is consistently perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Concept”
Reviews.Author: saltsjoduvnas
Reviews.Content: Quincy are running an all inclusive concept meaning, pick-up at the air port by a minivan with a most amusing driver that gave us a 30 minute history lesson on our way to the hotel. at the hotel everything is included in the price; accommodation, 4 meals, laundry, local calls etc. The hotel is super-fresh with a spectacular pool and work-out on the 12.th floor. All rooms with 42 inch flatscreen very comfortable beds. We will stay there on our next visit to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfection”
Reviews.Author: ivgit
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on 27 oct. We used their free limo pickup at the airport (with wifi on board). Since we arrived all the staff were helpful and very friendly. Rooms are modern, cool and hi-tech. From the wifi, to the console to connect camera, pc or dvd player directly to the tv. As already reviewed all is included (mini bar, internet, etc), the pool @ 13 floor as well as sauna, fitness center and steam bath are open 24 hrs. BUT, there's a but: Singapore is hot outside and freezing inside (cars, shopping center, hotels etc...) and Quincy is one of them/ If you shut down the air con in the room, once you leave the room and remove the electronic key the centralized system will turn it on and when u come back into the room you will find it close to 18 c. Same in the public areas. We really enjoyed the pool and the SPA, specially because there was no one except us. The breakfast buffet is included but not comparable with other hotels, little choice for a vegetarian. At the end we ll recommend this hotel, just bring your BIG scarf with you not only for Quincy but to enter every place in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “simply perfect !”
Reviews.Author: veroniquebali
Reviews.Content: SImply perfect because details are thought deeply and you know it because you dont even have to think about. It works, It's smooth, it's simple, It's Q ! The BEST OF THE BEST ; Bedding is simply heaven, you sleep in feathers all around. Pillow, topper matress, doona... First quality, your sleep is their concern. Veronique from Bali

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Quincy, you'd be foolish not to....!”
Reviews.Author: UKBENBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Firstly the facilities are immaculate, the sauna, steam room, 12th floor pool, all 24 hour access. The rooms are well kept, well stocked with toiletries, minibar (free) and everything you could need, Iron, Ironing board, hairdryer, slippers dressing gowns shoe horn, the list is endless. The set food menu's can get a tad tedious after a week, but for short stay there is something for everybody and the quality of the food is very good! Staff are very helpful! they make it a pleasure to stay at the Quincy. Most importantly just a short walk from a 7/11 shop, and 5 minutes away from orchard rd, and the nearest MRT is 5 minutes away. If you dont like walking, taxis are literally on the doorstep ready to take you anywhere. Its no surprise it is flying up the rankings on TripAdvisor

Reviews.Title: “The place to be”
Reviews.Author: HDLBruxelles
Reviews.Content: No limit at the offer in singapour....certainly in the traditionnal like Hilton, mandarin and so...Find somewhere with something of unexpected is difficult...Don't go further and choice the quincy hotel. The rooms are great (not too large but nice and up to date). Everything is included (minibar, breakfast, lunch and dinner) but the price is unexpensive, don't be afraid to choose an other place, you don't loose a lot of money. The staff is helpfull. Something else? The swimming pool in "the sky". We are definitely "Quincy"

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 1plus3
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with this little boutique hotel for our ten year anniversary! It was our first time away without our kids since our eldest was born 4.5 years ago - so a special occasion. The Quincy is all about service and they do a great job. Nothing is too hard and everyone is just soooo friendly. Having everything included is hard to get used to but such a nice change! Security is great too. We arrived before 8am and were able to check in there and then which was such a relief because we were both exhausted! The rooms a small but completely functional. There is a lot of building going on around (as there is everywhere in Singapore) but there was absolutely no problems with noise at all! The location is fabulous just a quick stroll to the heart of Orchard road and the MRT. All in all a great place to stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient and friendly - perfect for the family”
Reviews.Author: gadSydney_
Reviews.Content: We are a 3-generational family who chose to stay at the Quincy because of its newness and location, and also because of the extras provided - limo, included meals, drinks etc. Even with these "extras" we were not prepared for the courtesy and caring attitude of all of the staff. They were attentive at the counter, looked after us in the dining area and we were able to leave luggage for a few days when we went to Nikoi Island. We were also able to arrange a late check-out on the day of our departure for our late flight to Sydney. Get in while its new and has the special offers currently available.

Reviews.Title: “Redefines hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: pol2vega
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to give my spouse a surprise for V-day. It was a great experience for both of us. We didn't use the limousine, a service that I was impressed to hear of and certainly worthy of mention, as I secured our stay by other means. And yea, all meals provided is a great bonus. Our first impression was that security to the hotel is very tight and this was comforting. Only guests who have a card can enter the lobby. The lobby encompasses lots of glass to make up for its narrow design. Upon entering the lift, you could say we were pretty impressed by its modern and new feel. We were pleasantly surprised when told by the staff that the hotel was only less than 20 days old. The vibes that we got in the lift was reflected in the room interior. There was lots of glass used. Interestingly, the toilet which was seperated from the room by a mirror-like glass panel was hidden when the lights in the toilet were out but fully visible when we hit the on switch. We liked it that the door to the closet doubled as the toilet door too. The desk stood right below the TV along with a convenient panel for TV connectivity sandwiched in between. Complimentary mini-bar drinks always help. One minus is that air-con is centrally controlled, which turned out to be a pain at night 'cos it got pretty hot. Location-wise, we can't say it was very close to go to Orchard Road. It's probably better to cross the adjacent hotel to access Far East Plaza on Scotts Road. For other hotel amenities, we'd have to say the swimming pool floor is amazing. This was probably the first pool we tried that has a glass panel to allow swimmers to look a vertigo-inducing 12 floors below. It's great that one could look out at the vicinity while having a swim. The sauna and gym facilities were located on the same floor too. For parking, Quincy doesn't have any space but it does share the lots with the adjacent The Elizabeth Hotel. In terms of value, the experience is something one would probably want to try at least once. The price is a little on steep but once you consider the limousine pickup/complimentary meals/ultra modern facilities/exclusiveness, you realize it's fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: Petal86
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel with friendly staff. Security is very good. With all meals, happy hour, mini bar and limo pick up all included it was very convenient. My room had a lovely view and the hotel is close to Orchard Road and public transport as well as the shopping.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel I've stayed in ,perfect in everything they do ,funky modern”
Reviews.Author: sukkiesydney
Reviews.Content: Yes, I was skeptical of the reviews at first when booking online,surely with so many hotels in singapore to choose from I wasnt sure which one to choose,but was so happy that I made this choice at Quincy They lived up to all that was promised,from the moment we arrived with the classy limo service pcikup from the airport to hotel in a benz,we arrived early at 7am to hotel ,was greeted with friendly staff who accommodated us with coffee & breakfast upon arrival until check in . I've been to many hotels in Sydney & Europe, but these rooms were exceptionally clean bathrooms modern ,the beds were so comfortable ,the linen crisp & smooth . Tea & coffee .mini bar in room all complimentary but never used as so much in the restaurant downstairs that we didnt need it ,we were always full. The breakfast & all meals was a plus,didnt have to pocket out more expenses . Free internet in room,free 2 items for laundry per room,all inclusive meal deals ,what else could you ask for? The staff especially Frances made us feel at home from the minute we arrived till we check out,they were always willing to assist & very polite. I also noticed while having my meals in the restaurant which was next to the reception desk that all other guest were just as happy ,everyone was smiling . The hotel is suitable for everyone,from families,business & leisure travellers. I truly enjoyed my stay in Singapore & believe this hotel should be on everyone's list when staying in singapore as you wont be dissapointed . The management & staff have definately got it right ,thank you again & would definately recommend your hotel to everyone who visits Singapore . Exceptional value ,service & quality

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service was exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: SouthAustraliaAussie
Reviews.Content: Quincy Hotel was one of the best hotels i have stayed in so far. The service was exceptional. I would like to thank Bennie, Rari and the restaurant staff for making every meal in the restaurant warm and enjoyable. It was a great deal with mini bar, cocktail hour, all meals and limo pick up at airport all included. I can't wait to go there again. Oh great location too.

Reviews.Title: “So different.... so good”
Reviews.Author: oldmaule
Reviews.Content: Was recommended to this new hotel by the neighbour of a friend who had just visited Singapore. The tariff includes almost all the things you normally would spend when staying at a hotel. The visit started well with a Merc pickup from the airport. Complimentary drinks are in the room, A good breakfast, lunch and dinner with drinks are all included. Such a good idea if you are only staying a day or two as the choice is made for you and you know exactly what your spend will be. The rooms are very comprehensively fitted out and contemporary in style... not large but quite adequate. Probably the best feature of the Quincy are the great staff. They make you feel at home from the moment you arrive. We had an early start to catch the train to KL and Benny offered to put together a breakfast box for each to have on the journey. Have never experienced such great service. Have had experience running a hotel in Port Douglas and there is no doubt the Hotel Manager, Franck is responsible for the running of such a different operation. I am concerned that the popularity of the Quincy will be such that it will be difficult to get such a good deal in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Glamour & sparkles”
Reviews.Author: Lesportsac
Reviews.Content: Ok, so there were no paparazzi... but the Quincy certainly made us feel like celebrities. I could wax lyrical about this funky hotel - it exudes cool. From the warm welcome to its modern conveniences, the Quincy ensured that is was as much a destination on our trip as any other in Singapore. The rooms were flooded in natural light, spotless in cleanliness & smothered in creature comforts. Special mention to Frances whose genuine warmth & commitment to hospitality were exemplary. The pool is beyond superlatives - reminded me of a Travel & Leisure photoshoot location set. It's true, there are better meals to be had than the offering at breakfast, lunch & dinner, but this in no way detracts from the experience. There's ample choice to satisfy anyone's tummy... but do venture out to try Singapore delicacies like chilli or pepper crab & chicken rice. Orchard Road is a 5 minute casual stroll down the road. Taxis (surprisingly inexpensive) are on tap from reception. I'm glad we cancelled our reservation at Raffles to give this place a go... & I used the cash I saved to flex the plastic on Orchard Road. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Deservedly high marks”
Reviews.Author: timffm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quincy on a 3 day stay in Singapore and were not disappointed. From the airport pick up to getting a taxi to leave everything went well. The big plus point is that the management obviously read Trip Advisor and take into account comments - some negative points no longer apply. The rooms are German in style - I mean modern German, which to me is a complement! Clean, no clutter, not huge, and everything where you need it. We onyl had the breakfast, which was fine, but the lunch and dinner seemed to have plently of happy people when we passed. The hotel still seems new, which means no taxi driver seemed to know where it was, so pick up a handy card at reception which you can show to taxi drivers. One final small point, which summed up our stay. We went back hours after chekcing out to collect our bags and head to the airport. We were hot, tired and sweaty. The manager saw us and offered to go and fetch us (free) bottles of water. A nice touch Recommend

Reviews.Title: “Most conventient for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: busystar
Reviews.Content: I have spent 2 weeks at the Quincy . The all inclusive package (meals, phone, internet, drinks, fittness, pool) made me feel at home and independent. Travel expense and budget is predictable. Service at the Hotel and in the Restaurant is very kind and friendly. The design -rooms are fancy and practical with great view from "Mount" Elisabeth. Restaurant is good but should have a more selection for long term guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Endesu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a busy week of meetings, and chose the hotel because of the all inclusive package. I must say the hotel offers great value for money, but the service and rooms are not the best compared to other choices in Singapore. Good: Free internet, good meals, nice interior and a great 24 hour pool and fitness center Bad: The restaurant staff can be called uninspired at best, and the menu got a bit tedious after a few days. A 10-15 minute walk down to Orchard is not the most convenient. Rooms are on the small side, although nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “great accomodation, very convenient full package”
Reviews.Author: bulagna75
Reviews.Content: A very great four star accommodation, the hotel is centrally located, the stuff is very friendly . We booked online the full board package (included airport transfer, free minibar replenished once daily, free happy hour before dinner time, lunch and dinner a la carte with free soft drinks, buffet breakfast). The room was spacious, modern design, very comfortable. The food was very good (including the pasta al dente!). the open air 16th floor swimming pool is amazing with glass windows that allow you to watch singapore skyline. Great fitness center facing the Singapore skyline.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern and Chic”
Reviews.Author: WaOzabout
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the Launch Opening night! very flash. they converted the dining area into a çlub'' complete with speakers, dj's and stage! media arrived and all guests were invited to join the party. Very nice hotel, excellet service (as always in singapore) easy to get a taxi, outside the door most of the time. newspaper at your door every morning. simple breakfast but enough when on business. very modern bathroom and room. really thought about space saving ideas here!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjcrmanaloto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at the back of busy Orchard road so no traffic noise at night but near enough to walk to Metro, Paragon or Lucky Plaza. The room was small but that's only because my shopping bags were too many. The free laundry (2 pcs. per day) plus the other freebies are worth it especially the free meals---when you're too tired to go out to eat. The gym could have added a regular stationary bike since they only had a recumbent one. My husband and I had to check out by 12 but we were able to workout and shower at the gym to catch our late afternoon flight.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 3Squirrels
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have stayed at. The staff was great, the location great, the food great, the room great! We really enjoyed the long weekend there!! And, since we were traveling with a baby, we liked the complimentary lunch and dinners! The rooms could be a bit more spacious since it got a bit too full with the baby cot and all the extra things you have when traveling with children. The only disturbing issue was a strange loud noise against the window/front panel of the building during heavy rains (especially during the night). The hotel has a great interior design, really friendly atmosphere, attention to details, very comfortable beds, nice bathroom, large flat-screen TV... I can highly recommend it and if I go back to Singapore I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A BIG Thanks for the Unforgettable Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan_SG
Reviews.Content: In addition to all the great stuffs mentioned in the earlier reviews (which are all true), I would like to share my two cents worth. I booked a room at Quincy over the weekend for my 6th wedding anniversary. A couple of days before, I called the hotel and Franck (I didn't know he's the manager until I read the reviews) was on the line, I informed him that I had arranged a floral delivery to the hotel, for my wife as a surprise. I was afraid that the flowers will arrive before we check in so this is just a heads up. Franck said it will be all taken care of. On the day of check in, my wife and I were served by friendly Nathan who showed us to our room. On the way up to level 13, I noticed the hotel's minimalist decor style which is what I like. The room was, as expected, tastefully done up with a pretty good view. Nathan briefed us on the room amenities and hotel facilities. He then picked up a card standing on the bed and handed it to us. It was a "Happy Anniversary" card from the Q team, it even contained a caricature of both my wife and I. Thanks to Franck and team for the thoughtfulness. The flowers did not arrive by the time we left the hotel at about 5.30 pm for some shopping at Orchard road. We returned for dinner at about 7.30 pm. I excused myself to check with Nathan about the floral delivery and he told me with a cheeky grin that the flowers are already in the room. Needless to say, the wife was pleasantly delighted to receive the flowers.
