I had always wondered if the hotel staff deliberately kept the flowers until we left the room before sneaking them in so as to create the surprise element for my wife. Whichever the case, I could not have arranged that better, it was exactly how I wanted and Quincy's staff seemed to have read my mind. We had a short but great weekend at Quincy, the service was impeccable deserving of a 5-star rating. Kudos to Franck and your great team. Finally, something to improve though would be the restaurant staff could be little friendlier but I guess they were quite stretched by the large meal crowds.

Reviews.Title: “I can just say WOW...excellent...”
Reviews.Author: toptom
Reviews.Content: Well the most memorable experience was the passion of all Q-staff to serve the customer. Outstanding to mention here was FRANCES. Very charming and supportive. The Quincy has excellent service and value for money. I liked the room and hotel style very much. For sure I will be back when in SIN again. Thx to all Q-staff and keep going... P.S. Very nice gesture to get a hand written welcome back card signed by Q-staff...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff where how we feel is the most important consideration :)”
Reviews.Author: milkyoz
Reviews.Content: Hi Team...Thats us just got home from our trip.Singapore was our first port of call and what a great choice it was to stay at the new Quincy......Awesome can do staff....nothing was to hard...my wife unfortunately was ill and the staff couldnt do enough for us..thanks for everything and would def stay there again with Franck and the team......cheers and all the best

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: CKober
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely designed though quirky. The materials sometimes could be better. Rooms very small. Apart from this small grievances great place to stay, very close to Orchard Road, very friendly staff, the breakfast was also ok for me, quite fresh. Nice view from the window. Great pool, reasonable gym. The restrooms were also nice, spacious and clean. While in many hotels you still find these floor standing unhygienic toilets, usually with a line of yellow grime in the joints with the floor, they have opted here for the more modern wall - hanging concept, which shows also attention to the details that really matter.

Reviews.Title: “Finally a 'home' in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: antipodienne
Reviews.Content: Singapore has long been my worldwide bugbear for finding a decent hotel. I've rarely stayed at the same place twice, and I dread every new venue as my experiences have been invariably lacking. The Gallery tried the funky minimalist hotel concept and failed miserably. Most other hotels in Singapore are overpriced and/or tired. The Quincy, however, manages to be edgy and funky while still being extremely comfortable, friendly and reasonable value for money. The all-inclusive concept has its pluses and minuses: On the upside, the free internet, breakfast, one way airport transfer and plentiful bottled water and soft drinks in the rooms is fantastic. On the downside, I think the lunch offering is the weak link - carb, carb and more carb. Cheap and easy high volume food (although freshly prepared) rather than high quality or healthy. The fact that it's free makes me hesitant to criticise too strongly, but in this one area I think you get what you pay for. The rest of the hotel, however, exceeds expectations. What really clinches the deal for me at the Quincy is the high quality room amenity and the fantastic service. The rooms are small but incredibly well designed and very comfortable. The bathrooms are well appointed - fair to say luxuriously appointed - and the beds are far more comfortable than the usual Singaporean Slab. The shower is luxurious with hand-held and overhead rain shower options, while the bath is deep and long enough to enjoy a soak, complete with speaker and glass wall for those who want to watch TV while they relax in the tub (there's a privacy shade for those who don't). The blackout shades on the external window are fantastic (especially after a red-eye flight) and the bathrobes/towels/linen are all high quality. Good digital climate control, wall-mounted flat screen television and very fast (free) internet complete the package. The staff are cheeky and fun, and most impressively they seem to remember and genuinely like the guests. Frances has been a particular standout for me on both of my recent trips, although all the staff have been terrific. The Quincy would benefit from a loyalty program so that things like late check-out can be extended as a matter of course to frequent guests rather than only to those who stay for three days or longer, but may only be one-time visitors. I've negotiated late check out for both of my stays, but I hate having to do that when other hotels extend it to me as a matter of course due to my status with most major hotel chains. But this small downside won't be likely to dissuade me from staying here as long as I can continue to negotiate my stay to suit my needs. To the contrary, I'm really looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Sportbilly121
Reviews.Content: As former residents and still frequent visitors to Singapore we have long been seeking our bastion and though the standard and number of hotels in Singapore is probably not exceeded anywhere else in the World we still sought base camp, somewhere we would return time and time again. The Quincy is worthy of consideration in this regard and we shall certainly be back there soon though jury is still out re: our bastion. We liked the rooms, sufficiently spacy, certainly not cramped, modern and slightly wacky (never complain when I can watch the missus take a shower whilst lying on bed ). Beds were very comfortable. Management and reception staff were very friendly, helpful and good fun. Very convenient and relatively quiet location too. Minuses - the all in deal with the food makes the $200 rate not such good value as the food is both limited and average. I found the waiting staff slightly surly too, frankly they looked out of place. The pool is minimal and the gym I imagine was designed by or for a woman. In the meantime our quest continues.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected surprise!”
Reviews.Author: egarim
Reviews.Content: I have reserved a room at Quincy for one night (5-6 Sep) to celebrate my 1st year wedding anniversary with my wife. Wow, I must say it was indeed an unforgettable experience for both of us and we have enjoyed our stay very much. To start with, though Quincy was a pretty small hotel in terms of size (just 108 rooms), I was surprised that it has this security feature at the main entrance which prohibits anybody from entering without the hotel room access card. I believe the hotel guests would get additional comfort over the security in the hotel. The checking-in process was fast and very well-managed by Leo who kindly brought us up to our room to explain some of the high-tech features of the room. We were rather surprised by the wide selection of the meal menus as well as we initially thought there would only be like a couple of choices. The set lunch and dinner were delicious and much to our liking. I guess the only flaw to bring up in an otherwise perfect experience was that we were disturbed by a series of continuous pumping noise, which we suspected to be coming from he water pump as it was raining heavily during that morning. I guess this was unavoidable as we were staying on the top floor. Overall, we had a memorable experience to mark our 1st wedding anniversary and we would be looking forward to return again in the future. To all the staff of Quincy - THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel staff and service I have ever experienced, ever!”
Reviews.Author: Citizen_of_the_Earth
Reviews.Content: I was put in The Quincy by my overseas job for the purpose of having medical care in nearby hospitals. When I saw the reasonable price which included meals, I had no idea what to expect. I was rather astonished to find a driver in a suit waiting for me with my name on a sign just outside baggage check at the airport. He carried my luggage to the curbside and told me to wait 5 minutes for him to pull up. I was still looking around for a hotel van, when a beautiful black mercedes benz pulled up and my friendly driver glided out to wisk up my luggage. I settled in to the leather seats and began to get a taste of the magic of The Quincy Team. The driver shared information about The Quincy, the nearby hospital and interesting information about Singapore as it was my first time in the country. I arrived some 8 hours before check-in so Franck, the hotel manager, with his beautiful French accent offered me a complimentary buffet breakfast, the use of the shower, gym and pool facilities and carried my luggage to the dressing room as well as early check-in after my medical appointments. During my month of surgery and recuperation at The Quincy, the amazing luxurious treatment continued. Miyuki came to my room to hook up my laptop to the large screen TV and showed me how I could legally watch movies from the internet. Reuben brought excellent movies from his own personal collection to help me pass the time. When I was too weak to come down for breakfast, it was brought to me by Bene or his staff. Bene even came up with a specialized menu for me based on the dietary restrictions subsequent to surgery including supplying special food and drinks for my fridge. Suresh made sure my medical documents were scanned properly and quickly. Suresh and Chau helped me to mail boxes since I couldn't lift anything. Now I am leaving and Franck has offered staff to help me pack and weigh my bags. At this point all the Quincy Team feels like a family. They have taken photos of me with various staff members and sent them to me so I will never forget their kindness and hospitality during this most difficult time for me. I can't list everyone here but I thank Holly for the hugs, Nathan for the gift from his homeland China, Frances for keeping me straight-making sure I got my rest and drank enough, Suresh for the great conversations and keeping me laughing, Chau for the friendship and fun, Reuben for the great movie advice and caring attitude, Eric for the great photo shots, Bene and all his staff for taking care of my dietary needs and Franck ,of course, for making it all happen and keeping my spirits up......I thank everyone for genuinely caring for me and all the other guests as I see you do each and every day and night at The Quincy. You guys are remarkable!

Reviews.Title: “If Carlsberg did hotels”
Reviews.Author: Wearyandcynical
Reviews.Content: If Carlsberg did hotels, they would be just like The Quincy. The hotel of itself is new and modern offering all of the usual 4-5 star facilities, but that is where the similarity ends. They do a fully inclusive package, with a happy hour dining between 6 & 8 where drinks are free, the food is good with a varied menu - BUT the big difference is the staff THEY ARE SUPERB, the best I have encountered in over 30 years of World travelling. All of the staff are brilliant and knowledgable and helpful. Also allthough it may have nothing to do with the hotel, having arived late evening from the UK, I slept like a baby, and the next night etc. it's never happened for me before to sleep that well with a 7 hour time change. As Tina Turner says "Simply the best"

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended. Best Hotel (value for money)”
Reviews.Author: BarnaJ
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel infrastructure with all services included. The most friendly and helpful staff I have found in years! You all guys do a wonderful job! Best wishes to Ruben! The Hotel is hip but cozy. I felt like home :-) The glass swimming pool on the 12th floor overlooking Orchard Road from behind it is really a must see. Food is nice; the hotel is really clean and new. No negative points at all! Great, great and great!! I love Singapore and now I love Quincy too!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Lucy Liu for a FANTASTIC stay! Yours, Al Pacino”
Reviews.Author: Al_Pacino_London
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly recommend the Quincy if you appreciate a great location, a fun and cool vibe and super attentive service. The rate includes a bunch of free "extras" which is just one example of how the place under-promises and over-delivers. My plan was to stay for 2 nights and relocate perhaps to Sentosa but I enjoyed my stay so much, I extended by another 4 nights, i.e. the full duration of my stay in Singapore, and was very sorry to leave!

Reviews.Title: “One of the very best Hotels ever! Thanks Benny!”
Reviews.Author: FAFC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel recently and what can I say, the facilities, staff, food, location etc etc was 1st class. The all inclusive option was fantastic and very much worth it, so to the free internet. The pool was breathtaking. The fitness centre was great and included both a sauna and steam room. The close proximity to Orchard Rd was very handy but far enough away for a quiet nights sleep. The only minor issue was the bar fridge, drinks were not cold enough. This was easily fixed though, reception quickly sent up a bucket of ice. Any qualified beer drinker (Aussie) would know that beer tastes better when put on ice anyway! Would definitely stay at the Quincy on our next visit and I would recommend the hotel to any type of traveller. Be sure to ask for Benny or Maden (restaurant) who were fantastic and helped us out so much whilst in Singapore and Malaysia (Johor Bahru).

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT SO MUCH!A++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++......”
Reviews.Author: magie34
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very accidentally,(thank GOD!) and since our first day of staying we absolutely LOVED it!I mean really loved it!the food was fantastic as well as the room and customer services!I remember the name of the guy who served us(Lee) and he was so friendly!We are going there this Feb 2010,I can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “exQuisite”
Reviews.Author: Beaglee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! From the chauffer driven car picking me up at the airport to the time I reluctantly had to leave (left it as late as possible and nearly missed my flight back) my experience at Quincy was second to none. All aspects of the hotel were fantastic. I thought the room was more than adaquate, the gym was modern and the pool inviting (bought pair of goggles to use it) however the pool was under maintanance for half of my stay there which was a disappointment considering the humidity of Singapore. The staff were all courteous and kind from the chauffer to the dining staff. The front office in particular get a special mention for their courtesy, politeness and helpfulness. The only minor note was that the bar fridge could have been colder but apart from that the hotel is very strategically placed with Orchard Road only a short walk away. Will definately stay there on my return to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised...”
Reviews.Author: Keslergo
Reviews.Content: Date of Stay: August 5-7,2009 Room Type: Standard Room Upgrade: none Amount Paid Per Night: 248SGD which comes with breakfast, lunch and dinner. Reservation Method: Hotel Website Loyalty Card: None Airport/Hotel Transfer: Complimentary hotel limo was there when I stepped out of the doors, and was waiting for me outside the terminal after I got some cash from the ATM. Location: Okay, so you would understand better where I’m coming from, I normally stay at the Grand Hyatt and one time I stayed at the Meritus Mandarin, which were both very close to Orchard Road, you won’t even have to count 100 steps. Although Quincy is still within the Orchard area, it’s a good 7-10 minute walk from Paragon, and in the searing Singapore heat (or wet monsoon rains) it makes a lot of difference. Check-in: Was very fast, someone even brought me up to the room, to show me how things work, and where things are located. Room: was standard, in fact if you are with someone, you might feel a bit cramped because there is no place for your luggage, I like the use of space, but somehow I wish there was a little bit more to move around. Bathroom: The bathroom was standard although be careful with the hot water on the showers since it could get very very hot.…the Molton Brown toiletries did give a nice touch. Bed: Bed was quite comfortable and the pillows were a mix of synthetic and down feather plus the duvet were very comfortable. Breakfast: was standard hotel breakfast, nothing much to write about. Lunch: I was able to have lunch once, the fried rice was quite nice, better than what I was expecting actually…unlimited sodas and juices plus you can also help yourself to the salad bar. Dinner: quite unfortunate that I missed dinner on both nights that I was there so I couldn’t write anything about that. Check-out: Check out was fast and efficient, nothing much to write about that. Overall Evaluation: Service is excellent, I guess if you will compare it with the bigger hotels, the service at Quincy is definitely warmer. It’s also pretty affordable especially if you take into consideration the Mercedes Transfers which is about 50SGD, laundry plus the lunch and dinners, it’s gonna come out very cheap. Unfortunately I feel it’s a bit of a hike to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Uber chic, great staff, fantastic location - a great vibe overall”
Reviews.Author: Nando1982
Reviews.Content: Over the past few months I've stayed at this hotel numerous times (weekly for the past few weeks). From my very first stay I knew it was like no other hotel I've stayed at - from the quirky decor, to the 'all-inclusive' concept, the young and vibrant staff, and unusual room designs. All of it fantastic. You get a real sense of the boutique-ness of the hotel straight away. The rooms are small but perfect for the business or couple traveller. Very clean and modern and always well-maintained by the housekeeping staff. Front desk is always energetic and smiling and with plenty of hands on deck. Always happy to accommodate your needs where they can. It's located about a 5-7minute walk from the bustling Orchard Rd and Scotts Rd, but due to its location at the end of a residential area, it's utterly quiet and peaceful. Three meals a day are provided, with a quality better than I expected. There are plenty of other freebies included in the price so you'll be hard pressed to find a better value hotel this close to Orchard Rd. Waking up at 4:30am every Monday for a flight is never easy, but it's made so much more bearable by knowing that I'm arriving somewhere so warm and inviting. I can't say enough about the staff and the great job Franck and his team do to keep everything running like clockwork.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Paul-selina
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 6 nights and it was fantastic. Great food, great rooms and a very good gym.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessentially Quincy”
Reviews.Author: Cordelia9
Reviews.Content: Wow! From the driver who met me at Changi Airport, to the friendliness of the staff at Reception and in the restaurant, I was well and truly looked after. Even though I was there for a mere 24 hours, I didn't have to think about where to eat as the meals were included. The room was great, even though previous reviewers have commented on the size, and the Molton Brown toiletries added a touch of class! I discovered the hotel by accident and what a find. I intend to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Qonvenient, Very Qute, Very Qool!”
Reviews.Author: Melb0urnef00die
Reviews.Content: Chose Quincy when I made my last minute reservations and am glad I did! I did not have enough time to enjoy Quincy's amenities to the fullest but loved it anyway. No more unnecessary travelling fluff, Quincy got it right for me where it mattered.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel to stay at in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: MarkB33
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a week at the Quincy hotel. It is a new hotel within easy walking distance of Orchard Rd. The room decor is clean, modern and comfortable, with a free minibar and Wifi. Breakfast, the only meal I had during my stay, had plenty of verity and hot drinks were available all day. Best of all was the staff. They were always cheerful I had to rearrange my flight home, Thank you F for sorting out everything except the payment. I would recommend this hotel to anybody visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Q The Most Important Letter in the Alphabet”
Reviews.Author: TommyTravels2
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Quincy for four nights last week. I've stayed in a lot of different hotels in Singapore over the years but this one is the most memorable and enjoyable so far. The staff are amazing and really make you feel welcome. Even though this was my first visit the staff greeted me like I was a long term friend, a really energetic vibe that I've not encountered in any hotel anywhere else in the world. I've never stayed at a hotel that is all inclusive and I've got to be honest and say that I was sceptical at the time of booking. I thought the meals would be tiny and unappetising for a start. Thankfully, not the case at all. The menu is generous, the servings the same and the food is more than enjoyable. The wines served at happy hour were also of a good quality. Breakfast was also good with great coffee! I broke my neck to get back to the hotel for every meal! The rooms are a good size and are very comfortable. The only criticisms I have are that the pillows are a little firm and the absence of a clock in the room was also intriguing (I'm sure there's some sort of philosophy behind this omission...). The mini bar fridge could also be a bit colder so that you can fully enjoy the complimentary beverages... Vaguely cool drinks are not the greatest after braving the humidity outside. The swimming pool deck was also very enjoyable, I really dug swimming in a glass pool on the 12th floor! Very unique like everything about this hotel! The value that this hotel represents is nothing short of amazing, the rate inlcuded all meals, mini bar, two pieces of laundry each day, limo pick up at the airport in a shiny new E Class Mercedes, free wifi access, happy hour cocktails and free tea and coffee all day. Try and get that anywhere else, I challenge you! I'll definitely stay here again and can't wait to go back! Well done Quincy, you guys are seriously Qool! Cheers Glen Perth Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “The Quincy really is my second home”
Reviews.Author: GuySydney
Reviews.Content: Over the past few months I've stayed at the Quincy numerous times and it really has become my second home. First the good things. The staff are truly amazing some of the best I've come across. The rooms are large enough to stay in for more than a few days in comfort. The all inclusive concept is great and certainly makes my expense claims easier! The only things I'd change would be to add speaker phones to the rooms. Long conference calls aren't fun at the moment. I also miss a meeting room and business center. With these changes I'd highly recommend it to business travellers, at the moment these do detract from it's usefulness for business travellers. I also sometimes arrive late at night after the restaurant is closed so I'd love 24hr room service even if it was outsourced. Overall highly recommended and it seems it's getting more popular one of the last times I tried to stay it was booked out!

Reviews.Title: “extraordinary concept”
Reviews.Author: shok52
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week to trial. normally stay at Grand Hyatt. not any more. ended up extending at quincy. Returning next week for another 2 weeks. This place has a very qool personality. The all inclusive concept works well...except for the coffee department. The self serve coffee is a pain when you have to wait in line and you have to try and make the cappuchino yourself...and i can't! . A quincy barista and a real machine is on the wish list. Anyway apart from that the staff are fantastic and are trying to please constantly. They are upfront and you want them to be. this place is really a refreshing addition to the singapore hotel scene. don't be phased by the small rooms. i spent a lot of time working there and they are well designed "small".

Reviews.Title: “If only I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: laurieton
Reviews.Content: The room was very modern with a great view from the 9th floor. I was only there for an overnight stay so I didn't have the opportunity to sample lunch and dinner. I was able to use the pool facilities before my evening flight, even though I'd checked out which was most appreciated after a day of sightseeing. The all-inclusive concept was most welcome and the receptionists were very helpful. I can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Siyaaarya
Reviews.Content: Great budgeted business hotel. Located next to the main shopping road.. and staff are very freindly

Reviews.Title: “Sleek hotel and good service”
Reviews.Author: Fer&Ana
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights, they pick us up at the bus station as we took the bus from KL. Overall service is very good and the swimming pool on the 12th with a sort of infinite edge over the city is really nice. Cleaning of the pool needs attention though. We'll definitely come back to this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Efficient, Unobtrusive,”
Reviews.Author: Chakshu_Roy
Reviews.Content: - Airport Pick up was smooth - Check in process was efficient. - Suggestion: Staff could ask guests to take a seat while the documentation is being completed. - Great all inclusive concept. Tip: To avail of the inclusive laundry (2 pieces) one would have to stay for more than one day. - Room and Dining: Excellent - Suggestion: In our room the water kept spilling out of the shower area. - Great Staff.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay again...”
Reviews.Author: yvan333
Reviews.Content: Airport Tranfert: Driver was there on time but the Wifi promised in the car was not working. Check_in: Staff very friendly. Very good. Room: Too small !!! only enought room to move around the bed, not more... Very noisy, especially during the day when they are working in others room. I called the frontdesk and was told that they will stop in 30minutes. It didn't stop until evening! Breakfast & dinner: Very poor choice & quality. Better to go outside...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: arashinokoto
Reviews.Content: I decided to treat my boyfriend to a restful weekend at the newly-opened Quincy after hearing about it on the Internet - and I never regretted my decision. It was all-in-all one relaxing experience, the staff were warm and obviously proud of their beautiful hotel (rightly so). I loved the concept of having everything in one package, we did not have to worry about anything. The pool on the 12th floor was great - loved the sauna and the steam bath. Also, the hotel had a wonderful smell like they put something through the ventilation, it made me feel that I was really on holiday, even though I am from Singapore! The room itself was amazing, nice big bed, but the air-con could have been colder, though. Loved the bathroom and the free minibar. So kudos to you, Quincy, for making my weekend special. Will definitely be coming back again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptation Service”
Reviews.Author: Gizmo5
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at Quincy was a exceptional stay. The rooms are so beautiful and i must say that the staffs were great. I definately have to mention this gentlemen who i had extreme pleasure of meeting which i believe his name is Surash.He was very helpful and when i asked him for direction, he escorted me from point A to B. I expected service like this from a 5 star hotel but i was totally blown away. It may be a small gesture but for a new traveller like me, it a big deal.He even knew alot of Singapore when i asked him as i am new to this Beautiful Country. I would like to tell everyone who visits the hotel to look out for this gentlemen. Any help you need, he's the go to guy. I noticed that he is a calm and collective person. Surash, a Big Thank you for making our stay in your beautiful hotel a wonderful experience. I will definately return. Thank You Sir.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite place to stay in S'pore!”
Reviews.Author: Sabloniere
Reviews.Content: At the very last minute we decided to change our booking and stayed at the recently opened Quincy hotel. A great place to stay, we enjoyed every minute of it. The staff is warm, has a personal approach and really tries to create an atmosphere where you feel at home. The coffee & tea self service facilities contribute to this cozy feeling of being at home. Room is well equiped, comfortable beds and all you could wish for. And if it wasn't there (we liked to use a dvd player) the staff goes the extra mile to please you. Food is ok, multiple options and open all day. The breakfast could use a slight update, to bring it at the overall high level. Excellent fitness facilities. Great for leisure and business. We will come back!

Reviews.Title: “A pure hidden gem on Orchard”
Reviews.Author: OliverinUK
Reviews.Content: I was eating at the restaurant at the lobby level and overheard a conversation between a couple and a manager from the hotel. I was alone, and as tables are near each other, i could hear most of their conversation. The lady spoke about trip advisor, i had no clue what this was until I reached my room and surfed the net (for free as it is inclusive in the rate). I now understand what it was all about, not only I discover a good website with a lot of hotel reviews, but I now also get why this lady kept saying "it is so unfair". I read the review called Buyer beware as well as the other two, which are in all fairness very good. Before I give my feedback, I have to say that Raymond must be a flea market addict as I would never categorized this hotel as such. In fact, it is modern, excellent staff, very practical rooms, there is all you need for when you travel. The lobby looks gorgeous, it is not a big hotel so do not expect big rooms, big restaurant. The concept there is like athome, you help yourself at the buffet, you press for your desired coffee (free all day long), itis convenient, easy, you do not need to wait for anything. I found Quincy a bargain, so for value for money it is a 5 for sure, at $208 for a room on the 11th floor, with a huge window and a see-through bathroom, and all inclusive such as limousine pick up (Mercedes), free minibar, free internet, free breakfast, free lunch and dinner, free drinks, free laundry I thought my $208 were very well spent for once. At this price, you get a room only anywhere else in Singapore, especially in this part of town. It is off Orchard road, ok 6 minutes walk but when you reach the hotel, it is so quiet and peaceful, and the hotel is reserved to hotel guests, making it very private. If I have the chance tomorrow, I will speak to this couple and tell them what I did and if I see the caucasian gentleman tomorrow I will also tell him that I rate the hotel highly and in all fairness, they are trying so hard to make you feel special. The rooms are very practical, large writing desk, large flat screen TV (I plugged in my laptop in the TV, it is huge and something I can not do at home) The pool is on the 12th floor with sauna and steam room. The girls at the reception are all beautiful and helpful, there is a right amount of politeness, professionalism and enthusiasm in this hotel, that once you have stayed there, you just want to come back. Quincy was not my first choice before, but has definitely become my top hotel in Singapore, I have to agree with the fantabulous review. Keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “Much needed option for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: sethlad2
Reviews.Content: Quincy had only been open 3 weeks when we stayed in Feb so we expected a few bugs....happily we found none. From the moment we arrived,staff were attentive & helpful,even arranging specific food options for my wife who has a gluten/wheat intolerance. Manager Franck was charming & keen for feedback. The rooms are definitely modern design,its clear a lot of thought has gone into the styling although they are in need of a splash of colour. Bathroom had bath & shower with fantastic pressure,much appreciated by 2 Aussies on water restrictions at home. Huge plasma tv & small window ledge couch provided ample comfort,bed was massive & comforting. I have no idea what the previous reviewer is on about,very hard to please? Quincy provides all meals in the tariff & they were fresh & tasty. Breakfast was standard buffet with plenty of options,perhaps lunch/dinner could offer more local fare in time rather than the Italian emphasis from the kitchen next door? Pool was a highlight,towels & water everywhere & amazing view. Location is quiet & a short stroll from Orchard Rd,we will definitely be back John & Kathryn

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: Raymond_Carver
Reviews.Content: Very clean and modern, and the staff are nice, but the decor is tasteless and soulless; room furnishings are cold, hard, and uncomfortable. A small swatch of carpet beneath the bed is the only touch of warmth to the room, otherwise there are very hard (freezing cold) floors. Mirrors and aluminium abound. Terrible value for money, for what is available in Singapore. Yes, there are three meals a day, but my "filet of salmon" was deep-fried, and the sauce on my ravioli tasted like it came from a can. Everything in this hotel looks and feels like it was purchased at a "modern furniture" flea market. Don't stay here unless you have ginger-ale tastes and a champagne budget.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting addition to the Singapore hotel scene”
Reviews.Author: DazzlerSydney
Reviews.Content: Attracted by the grand opening deal, I booked for three nights at the Quincy in February. Including all three meals, airport pickup and bar fridge in the tariff is pretty good. Note the small print: the limo trip is one way only. And you can't get too far out of it on the two beers in the fridge! The pool and gym on level 12 were great. The food was passable, although a little more variety in the breakfasts would help. Location is fine, particulalrly using the short cut through the Goodwood park carpark to Scotts Road. All in all worth staying again while the introductory tariff remains.
